original: gang du 'gro ba la sogs pa yin pa der gnas par byed pas rten yin la de med na skad cig re re zhing skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji ltar rgyu'i dbang gi de nyid du sgro btags pa'i yul gyi lhan cig skye bcam ni rten yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pa de bzhin du so so bar shes pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin du skye ba tsam ni 'du ba yin te ji ltar brdarüîΩbyas pa de bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan 'ga' zhig kho na ni ma yin la de ltar skye ba tsam gyis byed pa po nyid dam 'bras bu nyid gzhan ni ma yin zhing de ltar skyas ba ni rgyu'i dbang gis de ldog pas gzhan du mi 'gyur
analyzed: gang du 'gro ba la sogs pa yin pa der gnas par byed pas rten yin la de med na skad cig re re zhing skyed byed yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // ji ltar rgyu'i dbang gi de nyid du sgro btags pa'i yul gyi lhan cig skye bcam ni rten yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin pa de bzhin du so so bar shes pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin du skye ba tsam ni 'du ba yin te ji ltar brdar byas pa de bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan 'ga' zhig kho na ni ma yin la de ltar skye ba tsam gyis byed pa po nyid dam 'bras bu nyid gzhan ni ma yin zhing de ltar skyas ba ni rgyu'i dbang gis de ldog pas gzhan du mi 'gyur
translated: Since it is the support of whatever goes and so on, it is the support. If it did not exist, it would be the producer of each moment.üîΩJust as the object that is imputed to be thatness through the power of the cause is the support of the simultaneous mind and mental factors, but not of others, in the same way, the mere arising of consciousness that possesses the individual awareness is the assembly of causes, but not any other, because it is understood in accordance with the convention.

original: ba yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba yang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In that way, mere arising is the agent or the effect, but not any other. In that way, mere arising is taught to be undifferentiated by the power of the cause, but not to be different.

original: 'dis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phrod pa 'du ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the assembly of causes.üîΩIn the Autocommentary,

original: 'grel par ni /
analyzed: 'grel par ni /
translated: it says:

original: rnam par gnas pa rgyu nyid ma yin yang der gnas pa'am 'du ba can nyid du yang de nyid la 'gyur ba yin gyi de la 'am gzhan la yang zhes bya ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa rgyu nyid ma yin yang der gnas pa'am 'du ba can nyid du yang de nyid la 'gyur ba yin gyi de la 'am gzhan la yang zhes bya ni ma yin no //
translated: Although the basis is not the cause, it is the basis or the collection of the cause.

original: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni mi rtag pa la ltos nas bshad pa /
analyzed: 'du ba can gyi rgyu ni mi rtag pa la ltos nas bshad pa /
translated: The cause of the collection is explained in dependence on the impermanent.

original: rnam gnas nyid ni rtag pa la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam gnas nyid ni rtag pa la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The basis itself is explained in dependence on the permanent.

original: 'dus pa yang rigs bzhin du rgyu nyid kyis rten gzhan la rnam par gnas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dus pa yang rigs bzhin du rgyu nyid kyis rten gzhan la rnam par gnas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cause of the collection, like the class, the basis of the other, the basis itself?

original: rten 'jig na sems mi 'jig pa'i 'du ba ci'i phyir bsal bar byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rten 'jig na sems mi 'jig pa'i 'du ba ci'i phyir bsal bar byed pa yin snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: When the basis is destroyed, why is the collection of the mind that is not destroyed refuted?

original: 'dus pa yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The collection is also like that.

original: rten dang brten pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'du ba ni de bkag na bkag pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi 'du ba ni de bkag na bkag pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The collection that precedes the support and the supported is taught to be refuted when that is refuted.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The entity of the support and the supported is like that.

original: rang gi ngo bo gnyis su mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can 'du ba'i shes pa yin na so so ba grub pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo gnyis su mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can 'du ba'i shes pa yin na so so ba grub pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that if the cognition of a composite is a cognition of the individual parts, the individual parts must be established as existing separately is:

original: rigs pa sogs pa rgyu med par rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa sogs pa rgyu med par rnam par gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúwithout a reason, it would be permanent.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang 'dis du ba khas blangs pa yin yang @254b 'jig rten pha rol 'grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dis du ba khas blangs pa yin yang @254b 'jig rten pha rol 'grub pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Moreover, this demonstrates that even though one accepts smoke, the existence of another world is established:

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúor else.‚Äù

original: gal te 'jig rgyu las 'dod na zhes bya ba 'di la thal ba mtshungs pa dang / slar yang 'tsho bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang gang gi tshe yang 'jig byed med pa de'i tshe yang de med pa nyid kyis gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya zhes bya ba 'dis kyang sngar dang phyis kyang nye bar dgos pa med par
analyzed: gal te 'jig rgyu las 'dod na zhes bya ba 'di la thal ba mtshungs pa dang / slar yang 'tsho bar 'gyur zhes bya ba dang gang gi tshe yang 'jig byed med pa de'i tshe yang de med pa nyid kyis gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de'i rgyus kyang ci zhig bya zhes bya ba 'dis kyang sngar dang phyis kyang nye bar dgos pa med par
translated: If one asserts that the world is destroyed by a cause, then the same reductio is applicable, and it would also be necessary to say, ‚Äúit would come to life again.‚Äù And when there is no cause of destruction, then it would be permanent because of its nonexistence, so what would be the use of a cause?

original: lan btab zin pa yin no //
analyzed: lan btab zin pa yin no //
translated: This also responds to the previously stated irrelevance.

original: gal te 'gyur na 'jig byed ma byung ba'i dus su yang 'gyur la de'i tshe ltos pa yin yang bya ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'gyur na 'jig byed ma byung ba'i dus su yang 'gyur la de'i tshe ltos pa yin yang bya ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: If it did, it would also transform when the cause of destruction does not occur.

original: dbang med du 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir la de'i phyir gnas par byed pas ni /
analyzed: dbang med du 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir la de'i phyir gnas par byed pas ni /
translated: Even though it relies on that, it does not perform its function because it is powerless to destroy.

original: rten ma yin par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: rten ma yin par bstan pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the statement that the endurer is not the support is

original: gzhan las te /
analyzed: gzhan las te /
translated: from another perspective.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu las dngos po 'jig par gal te 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu las dngos po 'jig par gal te 'gyur na /
translated: If things were to be destroyed by the cause of destruction,üîΩwhat would the endurer do? It would not do anything.

original: gnas par byed pas ci zhig med pa gnas par byed pa nyid dang bdag nyid 'brel pa ci zhig byed pa yin te /üîΩ'jig pa la 'di 'ba' zhig dbang du gyur pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas par byed pas ci zhig med pa gnas par byed pa nyid dang bdag nyid 'brel pa ci zhig byed pa yin te / 'jig pa la 'di 'ba' zhig dbang du gyur pa kho na yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is the connection between the endurer and itself?

original: dbang po la ni dgos pa ci yang med pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po la ni dgos pa ci yang med pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit alone is powerless to destroy‚Äù is that it has no purpose at all.

original: gang gi phyir de med na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams kho nas nges te dngos po'i 'jig par 'gyur te 'jig pa la yang de rnams nus pa med pa yin zhes bya ba phul du byung ba'i tshig ni bzhad gad kyi tshig yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir de med na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams kho nas nges te dngos po'i 'jig par 'gyur te 'jig pa la yang de rnams nus pa med pa yin zhes bya ba phul du byung ba'i tshig ni bzhad gad kyi tshig yin no ;
translated: Because even when that does not exist, things definitely disintegrate due to other causes of disintegration, and disintegration is also powerless.

original: / de'i phyir nus med yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: / de'i phyir nus med yin zhes bya ba ni nye bar bsdu ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThey are powerless‚Äù is a conclusion.

original: yang na dngos po ni skad cig ma ma yin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po ni skad cig ma ma yin pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or, a thing is not momentary,

original: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa can ma yin la gnas pa'i phyir de'i rgyu tshol ba yin la de yang gang gi tshe nye bar gnod pa yod pa'am med pa de'i tshe gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa'i rgyu nus pa can ma yin la gnas pa'i phyir de'i rgyu tshol ba yin la de yang gang gi tshe nye bar gnod pa yod pa'am med pa de'i tshe gnas par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because the cause of its disintegration is not powerful, and the cause of its endurance is sought. Moreover, when there is or is not harm, it does not cause endurance.

original: des na rang nyid kho na 'jig pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rang nyid kho na 'jig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it disintegrates by itself.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po'i chos yin yang gnas par byed pa med pa dang nye bar gnod pa yod pad dag la de ltar 'gyur gyi thams cad du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po'i chos yin yang gnas par byed pa med pa dang nye bar gnod pa yod pad dag la de ltar 'gyur gyi thams cad du ni ma yin te /
translated: Although disintegration is a property of a thing, it occurs when there is no cause of endurance and there is harm, but not in all cases.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa yin par sems par dogs pa la ;üîΩde 'jig 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i dngos po rnam par gzhag pa la sogs pa yin par sems par dogs pa la ; de 'jig 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The body is not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc., because it is not the immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not the basis of their arising.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not their cause.üîΩThe body is not the object of the mind, etc., because it is not the object of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc., because it is not the immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not the basis of their arising.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not their cause.

original: lus sam gzhan yang rung ba rten ni sems la sogs pa'i las gzhan pa nye bar gnod pa'i rgyu rnams kyis gnod pa ma yin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: lus sam gzhan yang rung ba rten ni sems la sogs pa'i las gzhan pa nye bar gnod pa'i rgyu rnams kyis gnod pa ma yin pa kho na yin te /
translated: The body is not the object of the mind, etc., because it is not the object of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc., because it is not the immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not the basis of their arising.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not their cause.üîΩThe body is not the object of the mind, etc., because it is not the object of the mind, etc.

original: sems dang mtshungs pa'i chos gzhan gzugs dang ro la sogs pa dang rid pa la sogs par @255a * //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs pa'i chos gzhan gzugs dang ro la sogs pa dang rid pa la sogs par @255a * //
translated: The body is not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc., because it is not the immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc.üîΩThe body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not the basis of their arising.

original: mthong ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo gang kho nas de rnams kyi rten yin pa de kho nas sems kyi yan lag gzhan du ni ma yin no //üîΩrang gi ngo bo tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa yin te de tha dad pa ni de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i phyir rang gi ngo bo gang kho nas de rnams kyi rten yin pa de kho nas sems kyi yan lag gzhan du ni ma yin no // rang gi ngo bo tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa yin te de tha dad pa ni de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is not the support of the mind, etc., because it is not their cause.üîΩThe body is not the object of the mind, etc., because it is not the object of the mind, etc.

original: de lta yin na gzhan gyi 'dod par ltung ba yin te lus las gzhan pa de'i rigs de'i rten nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan gyi 'dod par ltung ba yin te lus las gzhan pa de'i rigs de'i rten nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is not the similar and immediately antecedent condition of the mind, etc., because it is not the immediately

original: thal bar mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thal bar mtshungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is explained by the verse:

original: shi ba nyes pa mnyam 'gyur tshe //
analyzed: shi ba nyes pa mnyam 'gyur tshe //
translated: ‚ÄúDeath would be the same as when one is alive.‚Äù

original: zhes bya bas shin tu bshad pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas shin tu bshad pa yin pa'i phyir zlos pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the present argument is not redundant.

original: de ni sems la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de ni sems la sogs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the entities of mind, etc.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni gzhan med na de nye bar gnod pa med na yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni gzhan med na de nye bar gnod pa med na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúDestruction‚Äù means the nonexistence of something else, even when it is not being destroyed.

original: de'i med par yang de dang mthun pa'i chos gzhan mthong ba las shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i med par yang de dang mthun pa'i chos gzhan mthong ba las shes pa yin no //
translated: One knows this from seeing other phenomena that are similar to it.

original: de'i phyir sems la ni gnas pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams la nus pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la ni gnas pa'i rgyur mngon par 'dod pa'i lus la sogs pa rnams la nus pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body, etc., which are asserted to be the causes of the mind‚Äôs persistence, are not capable of producing the mind,

original: snga rol du yang de yod kyang de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga rol du yang de yod kyang de med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because even when they exist, the mind does not exist.

original: 'on te shi ba'i gnas skabs na yang sems yod pa kho na yin te gnas pa'i rgyu ma nyams par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te shi ba'i gnas skabs na yang sems yod pa kho na yin te gnas pa'i rgyu ma nyams par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if the mind exists at the time of death, then the causes of its persistence are not impaired, and therefore it should not perish.

original: nad la sogs pas phra mo nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma dmigs pa yin la rang gi bya ba mi byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa na /
analyzed: nad la sogs pas phra mo nyid du 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig ni ma dmigs pa yin la rang gi bya ba mi byed pa thal bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa na /
translated: But it is not observed that a mere subtle particle becomes subtle due to disease and so on.üîΩIf you think that the reversal of its cause would reverse it, then it would not be destroyed because the basis of the establishment of endurance would not be harmed by another basis.

original: de'i rgyu log na ldog pa yin no snyam du sems pa la gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i rten yang rten gzhan gyis mi gnod pa'i phyir 'jig pa ma yin la de'i tshe yang mi ldog par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rgyu log na ldog pa yin no snyam du sems pa la gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'i rten yang rten gzhan gyis mi gnod pa'i phyir 'jig pa ma yin la de'i tshe yang mi ldog par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: At that time, it would not reverse. This is taught:

original: rten bcas thams cad gnas ldan dang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rten bcas thams cad gnas ldan dang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All that has a basis endures.

original: rten la nye bar gnod pas sam rten log pas brten pa ldog pa yin la de yang de'i rten la nye bar gnod pas sam /
analyzed: rten la nye bar gnod pas sam rten log pas brten pa ldog pa yin la de yang de'i rten la nye bar gnod pas sam /
translated: If the basis is harmed or the basis is reversed, the dependent is reversed.

original: rten log pas de yang de bzhin du yin no //
analyzed: rten log pas de yang de bzhin du yin no //
translated: That is also like that.

original: mtha'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi nye bar gnod pa'am 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba can ma lus pa'i rjes su 'jug ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha'i rdul phra rab rnams kyi nye bar gnod pa'am 'jig pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir skye ba can ma lus pa'i rjes su 'jug ba kho nar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would follow that it would be the cause of the arising of all things that are produced, since it would not be the case that it is destroyed or damaged by the ultimate atoms.

original: gnas pa dang ldan ba gang yin pa de rten dang bcas par khas blangs pa yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /üîΩrten la nye bar gnod pa kho nar byed par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni de yod pas sbyar ba'i de'i yod pa ma yin par bstan pa yin la /üîΩgnyis pas ni @255b de'i med pas sbyar ba'i de'i med pa ma yin par ro //üîΩde'i phyir gnas par byed pa'i su pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ldan ba gang yin pa de rten dang bcas par khas blangs pa yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /üîΩrten la nye bar gnod pa kho nar byed par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni de yod pas sbyar ba'i de'i yod pa ma yin par bstan pa yin la /üîΩgnyis pas ni @255b de'i med pas sbyar ba'i de'i med pa ma yin par ro //üîΩde'i phyir gnas par byed pa'i su pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it would follow that it would be

original: da ltar ni gnas bya'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'jig pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du brtags nas gnas par byed pa'i nus pa mi srid pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ltar ni gnas bya'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'jig pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid du brtags nas gnas par byed pa'i nus pa mi srid pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, it is taught that it is impossible for the present to endure by imagining its own nature, which is to be endured, as having the nature of destruction or non-destruction.

original: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag /
analyzed: gal te rang 'jig ngang tshul bdag /
translated: If it has the nature of self-destruction,

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: it is said.

original: 'jig pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa nyid ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: Destruction itself is not momentariness,

original: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos chos nyid ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because destruction is taught to be the intrinsic nature of things.

original: 'o na ci zhe na dus ji srid pa yin pa pha rol po 'dod pa'i phyir gang yang zlos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na dus ji srid pa yin pa pha rol po 'dod pa'i phyir gang yang zlos pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is asked, What is it then? it is not a repetition, because the opponent asserts it to be for as long as it endures.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni 'di rnams bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni 'di rnams bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The author of the commentary teaches this with a summarizing verse.

original: mar me la sogs pa rten yin pa dang / 'od la sogs pa brten pa yin par 'dis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa rten yin pa dang / 'od la sogs pa brten pa yin par 'dis bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that the lamp, etc. are the basis, and the light, etc. are the based.

original: gang la 'gro ba'i gegs srid pa yin yang /
analyzed: gang la 'gro ba'i gegs srid pa yin yang /
translated: Even though it is possible for there to be an obstruction to going somewhere,

original: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid ma gtogs pa'i rten dang rten can nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rgyu nyid ma gtogs pa'i rten dang rten can nyid ma yin na /
translated: if it is not the case that they are basis and based except for being cause and effect,üîΩthen what is the use of positing them as basis and based?

original: de la srid pa med pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: de la srid pa med pa lta ci smos /
translated: How much less so for existence!

original: mar me dang 'od gnyis po 'di ni de'i 'am gnyis las 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mar me dang 'od gnyis po 'di ni de'i 'am gnyis las 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The lamp and light are either from that or from both,üîΩbut they do not mutually benefit each other.

original: phan tshun phan pa byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag tsam ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun phan pa byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de dag tsam ni tshad ma'i yul ma yin no //
translated: That is merely the domain of valid cognition.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / sems dang lus kyang de bzhin no //üîΩde rgyu lhan cig byed pa las //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems dang lus kyang de bzhin no // de rgyu lhan cig byed pa las //
translated: the mind and body are also like that.üîΩThe effect of arising is simultaneous with

original: skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas //
translated: its cause and co-originating factors.

original: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin //
analyzed: me dang zangs ma'i zhu nyid bzhin //
translated: Like a lamp and the illumination of copper.

original: zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: This is established.

original: de'i dus su mar me 'od kyi rten yin du zin kyang de yod na yod pa'i phyir te de sbrul la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin yang de la brtan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus su mar me 'od kyi rten yin du zin kyang de yod na yod pa'i phyir te de sbrul la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba yin yang de la brtan pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though at that time the lamp is the support of light, it exists when it exists. Even though it is the transformation of a snake, etc., it is not stable in that.

original: mar me med na de yod kyang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mar me med na de yod kyang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the lamp does not exist, it exists but does not exist.

original: lus ni sems kyi de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: lus ni sems kyi de lta ma yin no //
translated: The body is not like that for the mind.

original: lus yod kyang mar me la 'od bzhin du sems ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus yod kyang mar me la 'od bzhin du sems ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even though the body exists, it is not the mind, like the light of a lamp.

original: smras pa / lus kyi phul byung 'grib med par //
analyzed: smras pa / lus kyi phul byung 'grib med par //
translated: The body is not the best, nor is it permanent.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is said.

original: ma mthong ba tsam yin pa kho na las de'i 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam yin pa kho na las de'i 'bras bu nyid 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not only the case that it is merely not seen, but it is also not its effect.

original: ma bag mar len pa rigs pa'i yul du byung ba'i pandi khar rdzur ma bag mar len par rigs pa nyid med na ma mthong ba yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa rigs pa'i yul du byung ba'i pandi khar rdzur ma bag mar len par rigs pa nyid med na ma mthong ba yang de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not proper to take a maiden as a wife, then even if one does not see her, it is not known that she is the effect of that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?üîΩBecause it is distinguished by the particular action of that.

original: de'i bya ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro / de lta mod kyi de nyid la the tshom za na de la dpyod pa ni shes rab yin la shes rab can yin pa'i phyir de nyid las rig pa yin zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par can yin pa'i phyir ro / de lta mod kyi de nyid la the tshom za na de la dpyod pa ni shes rab yin la shes rab can yin pa'i phyir de nyid las rig pa yin zhes bstan pas so //
translated: Even so, if there is doubt about that, then the investigation of that is wisdom. Because one has wisdom, it is taught that it is knowledge itself.

original: ji ltar bzung ba @256a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bzung ba @256a * //
translated: How is it grasped?

original: rnams de kho na bzhin du nye bar ston pa ni yid gzhungs pa yin la de yang blo 'di 'dzin pa dang dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi rigs goms pa'i 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad pa can yin na
analyzed: rnams de kho na bzhin du nye bar ston pa ni yid gzhungs pa yin la de yang blo 'di 'dzin pa dang dran pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rang gi rigs goms pa'i 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid kyi khyad pa can yin na
translated: The faculty of memory is the faculty of intelligence, which is the nature of the retention and recollection of those things just as they were experienced. It is the special quality of the mind that is cultivated by its own type, and it is characterized by the decrease of the inferior and the increase of the superior.

original: 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grib pa dang phul du byung ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with decrease and increase.

original: lus kyi khyad par gyi bskyed bya blo ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus kyi khyad par gyi bskyed bya blo ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the mind a product of the special quality of the body?

original: de lta yin na lus med na med pa'i phyir mar me la brten pa'i 'od bzhin du de la brten pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /üîΩ'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs //
analyzed: de lta yin na lus med na med pa'i phyir mar me la brten pa'i 'od bzhin du de la brten pa yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la / 'di ni mar me'i 'od la sogs //
translated: If that is so, then like the light that is dependent on a lamp, it would be dependent on the body.

original: brten pa rnams la yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brten pa rnams la yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThis is not the case for the light of a lamp, etc.‚Äù

original: 'od ni mar me'i byed pa'i dbye ba'i rjes su 'brang bar byed pas de nyid la brten pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'od ni mar me'i byed pa'i dbye ba'i rjes su 'brang bar byed pas de nyid la brten pa yin gyi gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: The light of a lamp is dependent on the lamp because it is produced by the lamp‚Äôs action. It is not dependent on anything else.

original: de bzhin du blo yang shes rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni blo'i bde pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pas de la brten pa kho nar shes pa yin gyi lus la brten pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo yang shes rab la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni blo'i bde pa'i khyad par gyi rjes su byed pas de la brten pa kho nar shes pa yin gyi lus la brten pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Likewise, the mind is known to be dependent on wisdom and so on, because it is modified by the special pleasure of wisdom and so on, and not on the body.

original: 'di ni gzhan la ma brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la ma brten pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is not dependent on anything else.

original: gal te dus tha dad pa'i blo ji ltar blo gzhan gyi rten yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dus tha dad pa'i blo ji ltar blo gzhan gyi rten yin zhe na /
translated: If the mind that exists at one time is the basis of the mind that exists at another time, how can the mind that exists at another time be the basis of the mind that exists at another time?

original: bag chags kyi sgo nas blo phyi ma la nye ba yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyi sgo nas blo phyi ma la nye ba yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error, because the later mind is proximate to the earlier mind by way of the latent impressions.

original: de'i dus su byung ba'i sems las byung ba la ni sems de nyid yod pa yin la de ltar bshad pa ni //üîΩgang zhig yod pas phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: de'i dus su byung ba'i sems las byung ba la ni sems de nyid yod pa yin la de ltar bshad pa ni // gang zhig yod pas phan 'dogs byed //
translated: The mind that exists at that time is the cause of the mental factor that exists at that time.

original: ces bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthat which exists is the benefit‚Äù is understood by this.

original: de la yang sems kho na sems gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la yang sems kho na sems gzhan gyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Moreover, the mind itself is the cause of another mind,

original: de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i rjes su 'brang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of the activity of the other mind.

original: lus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na don yin no //
analyzed: lus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di kho na don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the body is not the basis of the activity of the mind.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du brjod pa ni gal te dngos po'i rgyun de ltar skye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rten yin na lus kyang sems kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du brjod pa ni gal te dngos po'i rgyun de ltar skye ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i phyir rten yin na lus kyang sems kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir rten yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the opponent says, if the continuum of things is the basis because it arises with a cause, then the body is the basis because it is the cause of the mind.

original: de rgyu nyid yin par ni /üîΩde rgyu lhan cig byad pa las //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid yin par ni / de rgyu lhan cig byad pa las //
translated: He thinks that this is stated by the following:üîΩ‚ÄúThe effect of the cause that is born

original: skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'bras bu lhan cig gnas //
translated: coexists with the cause.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'dis smras pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis smras pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: To this, the author of the commentary says,

original: blo yi byed pa'i khyad par gyis //üîΩzhas bya ba smos te /
analyzed: blo yi byed pa'i khyad par gyis // zhas bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚Äúdue to the special activity of the mind.‚Äù

original: lus kyi rgyu ni de la sred ba dang bcas pa'i las kyi ming can sems kyi rgyu sems gzhan rang gi 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa po dang lhan cig tu rang gi 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa po yin te de la brten pa yin
analyzed: lus kyi rgyu ni de la sred ba dang bcas pa'i las kyi ming can sems kyi rgyu sems gzhan rang gi 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa po dang lhan cig tu rang gi 'bras bu la bya ba byed pa po yin te de la brten pa yin
translated: The cause of the body is the mind that is the cause of the mind that possesses the name of karma together with craving. It is the cause of the body because it is the agent that performs its function in relation to its effect.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the body because it is supported by it.

original: de'i phyir lus dang lhan cig pa yin gyi des sam de'i rgyus sems byed pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang lhan cig pa yin gyi des sam de'i rgyus sems byed pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is simultaneous with the body, but it is not the case that the mind is the cause of the body or that the body is the cause of the mind.

original: gang gi @256b phyir sems ni shes rab la sogs pa yin la sems nyid kyi khyad par la rang gi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi @256b phyir sems ni shes rab la sogs pa yin la sems nyid kyi khyad par la rang gi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yin gyi lus la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: because the mind is wisdom and so on, and the mind itself is the special basis of its own special qualities, not the body and so on.

original: de'i phyir de la brten pa kho na yin gyi lus la sogs pa la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la brten pa kho na yin gyi lus la sogs pa la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only based on that, not based on the body and so on.

original: ri mo la sogs pa la yang shes rab la sogs pa'i sems kyi khyad par la rang gi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa la yang shes rab la sogs pa'i sems kyi khyad par la rang gi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And the special qualities of the mind such as wisdom do not follow their own special qualities in paintings and so on.

original: de la brten pa yang ma yin te rtsig pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa yang ma yin te rtsig pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are not based on that, because they are based on walls.

original: de bzhin du mar me la mar me'i 'od yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar me la mar me'i 'od yin no //
translated: In the same way, the light of a lamp is the lamp itself.

original: de bzhin du sems kyang sems gzhan gyi rjes su byed pa ni lus la brten par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la 'di ni mar me'i 'od la la sogs zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyang sems gzhan gyi rjes su byed pa ni lus la brten par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la 'di ni mar me'i 'od la la sogs zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: In the same way, the mind that follows another mind would become based on the body. To think this, he says, ‚ÄúThe light of a lamp is not the lamp itself.‚Äù

original: gal te yang ri mo dang mar me dang mar me'i 'od la sogs pa yang sems kyi khyad par byed pa yin yang de bzhin du rtsig pa la sogs pa legs bar sbyangs pa'i khyad par yang yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang ri mo dang mar me dang mar me'i 'od la sogs pa yang sems kyi khyad par byed pa yin yang de bzhin du rtsig pa la sogs pa legs bar sbyangs pa'i khyad par yang yin no //
translated: If, however, the picture, the lamp, the light of the lamp, etc. are also the special causes of the mind, then the special cause of the wall, etc. is also like that.

original: legs par sbyar ba'i rtsig pa la ni mkhas pa yang ri mo phun sum tshogs pa la dbang byed pa med do //
analyzed: legs par sbyar ba'i rtsig pa la ni mkhas pa yang ri mo phun sum tshogs pa la dbang byed pa med do //
translated: But in a well-constructed wall, the expert has no power over the excellence of the picture.

original: de'i phyir sems kho na rten byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩsems ni ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pas sems gzhan yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kho na rten byed pa ni ma yin no // sems ni ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pas sems gzhan yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind alone is not the special cause.üîΩThe mind is different from the body, as has been demonstrated by the arguments.

original: brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems las tha dad par rjes su sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: brten pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems las tha dad par rjes su sgrub par byed pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù shows that the mind is the special cause of the body, which is different from the mind.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la mi rten pa 'di de rnams la yod pa ma yin te de nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la mi rten pa 'di de rnams la yod pa ma yin te de nyid du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not dependent on another, it is not found in those, because it is perceived as just that.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni mar me gzhan las gzhan pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan du yang zhes bya ba ni mar me gzhan las gzhan pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot that, but rather something else‚Äù means that something other than a lamp is a pot, etc.

original: blo rten du gyur pa la rten shes rab la sogs pa brten pa yin te de rnams rten dang brten can nyid yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo rten du gyur pa la rten shes rab la sogs pa brten pa yin te de rnams rten dang brten can nyid yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The support of the mind is the support of the wisdom, etc., and they are the supported.

original: ji ltar mar me la brten pa yin yang sbrul gyis 'od rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar mar me la brten pa yin yang sbrul gyis 'od rnam par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Just as the light of a lamp is supported by the lamp, but the light of a snake is not,

original: lus la brten pa'i sems kyang sems kyi 'gyur bas 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: lus la brten pa'i sems kyang sems kyi 'gyur bas 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: so the mind is supported by the body, but the mind of a god is not.üîΩIf you think that the light of a lamp is supported by the lamp,

original: gal te mar me'i 'od kyang zhes bya'o //üîΩsprul las 'od rnam par 'gyur ba yin pas /
analyzed: gal te mar me'i 'od kyang zhes bya'o // sprul las 'od rnam par 'gyur ba yin pas /
translated: but the light of a snake is not,üîΩand that the body is supported by the mind, but the mind of a god is not,üîΩthen the light of a lamp is supported by the lamp, but the light of a snake is not.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.

original: mar me'i 'gyur ba rtogs pa bzhin du sems 'gyur ba las de'i 'gyur bas lus kyi 'gyur ba rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩblo'i byed pa tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mar me'i 'gyur ba rtogs pa bzhin du sems 'gyur ba las de'i 'gyur bas lus kyi 'gyur ba rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩblo'i byed pa tha dad pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is not seen when the snake is not seen.üîΩThe light of a lamp is supported by a lamp, because it is not seen when the lamp is not seen.üîΩThe light of a snake is not supported by a snake, because it is

original: bcud kyis len pa dang bza' ba'i khyad par nye bar mkho ba las ji ltar goms pa nyid kyi shes rab la sogs pa rnams brjod nas de las bzlog pa la skyon bstan pa ni /üîΩbcud @257a * //
analyzed: bcud kyis len pa dang bza' ba'i khyad par nye bar mkho ba las ji ltar goms pa nyid kyi shes rab la sogs pa rnams brjod nas de las bzlog pa la skyon bstan pa ni / bcud @257a * //
translated: Having described the wisdom, etc. that come from the practice of the special elixirs and foods, he shows the fault in their opposites:

original: kyis len pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyis len pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The elixirs, etc. are not the cause of wisdom, etc.

original: 'on te blo tsam ni bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa nye bar mkho ba las byas pa'i lus las 'byung ba yin pa /
analyzed: 'on te blo tsam ni bcud kyis len pa la sogs pa nye bar mkho ba las byas pa'i lus las 'byung ba yin pa /
translated: But if you think that the mere intellect comes from the body that is made by the practice of the elixirs, etc.,

original: de'i khyad par ni goms pa las yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni goms pa las yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: and that its special qualities come from practice, he says:

original: mngon sum dran pa ma gtogs pa //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dran pa ma gtogs pa // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Except for memory, there is no direct perception.

original: de bzhin mngon spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin mngon spyod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Similarly, the one who practices the rites

original: dran pa'i rjes su 'jug pa med kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dran pa'i rjes su 'jug pa med kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that even without the practice of the elixirs, etc.,

original: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa dag gi mtshan nyid gzhan bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab dang yid gzhungs pa dag gi mtshan nyid gzhan bstan pa ni /
translated: he shows the other characteristics of wisdom and a sharp memory:

original: so so so sor zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: so so so sor zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Each one

original: de'i rigs kyi don yin pas te goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par gyi rigs kyi don las so //
analyzed: de'i rigs kyi don yin pas te goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par gyi rigs kyi don las so //
translated: Because it is the meaning of that type, i.e., the meaning of the type of the special object generated by cultivation.

original: de ltar 'gyur na dbang po'i rnam shes ni dbang po'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur na dbang po'i rnam shes ni dbang po'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi khyad par gyi rjes su byed pa yin la /
translated: If that were so, then the sense consciousness would be the special body that is of the nature of the sense faculty.

original: de las byung ba nyid kyis yid kyi rnam shes bskyed pa yin no //üîΩde'i phyir de yang brgyud pas lus la brten pa yin la de log na ldog par 'gyur ba ni dbang po'i rnam shes bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de las byung ba nyid kyis yid kyi rnam shes bskyed pa yin no // de'i phyir de yang brgyud pas lus la brten pa yin la de log na ldog par 'gyur ba ni dbang po'i rnam shes bzhin du 'jig rten pha rol ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: And the mental consciousness would be generated from that, i.e., from the sense consciousness.üîΩTherefore, that mental consciousness would also be indirectly based on the body, and when that body ceases, it would also cease, just as the sense consciousness does. But the next world would not be so.

original: de las kyang ste lus las 'di ste sems kyi khyad par gyi sems nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin la de ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nges pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang ste lus las 'di ste sems kyi khyad par gyi sems nyid las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pa yin la de ltar na 'jig rten pha rol nges pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But this, i.e., the mental consciousness, is not from that, i.e., the body, but from the special mind itself. This is the assertion of others, and in that case, the next world would not be certain.

original: kyang gi sgra ni rang kho na'i don yang yin te des na rang kho na las zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra ni rang kho na'i don yang yin te des na rang kho na las zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúalso‚Äù means ‚Äúonly‚Äù and thus the root text states ‚Äúonly from itself.‚Äù

original: re zhig yid gzhungs pa ni ji ltar gzung ba dran pa yin la /
analyzed: re zhig yid gzhungs pa ni ji ltar gzung ba dran pa yin la /
translated: First, a sharp mind is the memory of what is apprehended.üîΩAlso, the faculty of apprehension is the action of the sense faculty.üîΩWisdom is either the apprehension or the memory of what is apprehended.üîΩIn all cases, it is only from that.üîΩCultivation is the engagement that precedes that.

original: 'dzin pa yang dbang po'i las yin la shes rab ni 'dzin pa'am dran pa yang yin rung thams cad du de kho na las yin la goms pa ni de sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba 'di phan 'dogs med par min zhes bya ba dang
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang dbang po'i las yin la shes rab ni 'dzin pa'am dran pa yang yin rung thams cad du de kho na las yin la goms pa ni de sngon du 'gro bas 'jug pa yin zhes bya ba 'di phan 'dogs med par min zhes bya ba dang
translated: This is connected to the phrase ‚Äúit is not without benefit.‚Äù

original: sbyar ro // gang gi tshe yin zhe na /
analyzed: sbyar ro // gang gi tshe yin zhe na /
translated: When is it not without benefit?

original: sems la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i ngang tshul gang gis yin pa de'i tshe ste phan 'dogs pa'i sems kho na la dbang po'i shes pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sems la phan 'dogs pa med pa'i ngang tshul gang gis yin pa de'i tshe ste phan 'dogs pa'i sems kho na la dbang po'i shes pa yang yin te /
translated: When it is in a state of not benefiting the mind, then the sense faculty consciousness is only the mind that benefits.

original: snga ma'i rnam shes rnam par g-yeng ba dang cig shos dag las phyi ma'i rnam shes rnam par g-yeng ba dang cig shos mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma'i rnam shes rnam par g-yeng ba dang cig shos dag las phyi ma'i rnam shes rnam par g-yeng ba dang cig shos mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the subsequent distracted or undistracted consciousnesses see the previous distracted or undistracted consciousnesses.

original: snga ma yang de bzhin du yin la de las kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma yang de bzhin du yin la de las kyang de bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol grub pa yin no //
translated: Because the former is just like that, and because that is just like that, a world beyond this one is established.

original: yang na de las kyang ste dbang @257b po'i ngo bo lus las khyad par te rnam shes ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa la nges pa'i ngo bo ni rjes su byed pa'i sems la 'gyur ba min pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na de las kyang ste dbang @257b po'i ngo bo lus las khyad par te rnam shes ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa la nges pa'i ngo bo ni rjes su byed pa'i sems la 'gyur ba min pa kho na ste /
translated: Or, it is also like that, because the consciousness, which is the special nature of the sense faculty, the body, is definitely the nature of apprehending form and so on, and it is not that the mind that follows it changes.

original: sems dang dbang po la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi gcig las ma yin te /
analyzed: sems dang dbang po la sogs pa las rnam par shes pa'i khyad par du 'gyur ba yin gyi gcig las ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness is a special nature that arises from the mind, the sense faculty, and so on, but it does not arise from one alone,

original: chos can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because there is no basis for that.

original: blo dang dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed byar mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par yin la de yang de la goms pa'i khyad par las dbang po la sogs pa'i bya ba la yang gnyid log pa la sogs pa dang sad pa la yang ri la sogs pa sna
analyzed: blo dang dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed byar mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par yin la de yang de la goms pa'i khyad par las dbang po la sogs pa'i bya ba la yang gnyid log pa la sogs pa dang sad pa la yang ri la sogs pa sna
translated: The special nature that is asserted to be produced by the mind, sense faculty, and so on is also a special nature that arises from the mind that is habituated to that, and that is also a special nature that arises from the sense faculty, and so on.

original: tshogs par 'gyur la sems la ni phan 'dogs pa ma yin pas goms pa'i sgo nas dbang po las kyang mi 'byung la phan pa byed pa yin na de la dbang po yang phul du byung bar 'gyur te de kho na las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs par 'gyur la sems la ni phan 'dogs pa ma yin pas goms pa'i sgo nas dbang po las kyang mi 'byung la phan pa byed pa yin na de la dbang po yang phul du byung bar 'gyur te de kho na las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it does not benefit the mind, it does not arise from the sense faculty through the process of habituation. If it benefits the mind, then the sense faculty would be the most important factor because it arises from that alone.üîΩEven though a special inner body does not arise from the elixir of life or special meditative concentration, attachment and so on and wisdom and so forth that did not exist previously arise when it exists through enhancement and so on.

original: nye bar mkho ba'i bcud kyis len pa las sam ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las nang gi lus khyad par can du 'byung ba ma yin du zin kyang rgyas pa la sogs pas chags pa la sogs pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa yang rung ba snga na med pa de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid du shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba'i bcud kyis len pa las sam ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par las nang gi lus khyad par can du 'byung ba ma yin du zin kyang rgyas pa la sogs pas chags pa la sogs pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa yang rung ba snga na med pa de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir de'i bskyed bya nyid du shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it understood that it is the product of that?

original: de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid kyis sems kyi bskyed bya nyid kho na yin no zhes zer na yang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa'i bskyed bya nyid kyis sems kyi bskyed bya nyid kho na yin no zhes zer na yang lan ma yin te /
translated: Even if you say that at that time it is the product of the mind because it is the product of pleasure and so on, that is not an answer.

original: rang gi rigs goms pa las byung ba nyid kyis sems kyi bskyed bya nyid du khas len pa yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rigs goms pa las byung ba nyid kyis sems kyi bskyed bya nyid du khas len pa yin na de yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that the mind is the product of its own kind, that also does not exist.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni chags sogs 'phel ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni chags sogs 'phel ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Here, we say:

original: bcud kyis len la sogs pas rgyas ba yin na /
analyzed: bcud kyis len la sogs pas rgyas ba yin na /
translated: If it is increased by alchemical potions, etc.,üîΩthen sometimes attachment, wisdom, etc.

original: rgyas pa'am gzhan gyis kyang chags pa dang / shes rab sogs pa 'phel ba ni res 'ga' yin gyi thams cad du ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyas pa'am gzhan gyis kyang chags pa dang / shes rab sogs pa 'phel ba ni res 'ga' yin gyi thams cad du ma yin te /
translated: are increased, but not always.

original: rgyas pa yod kyang res 'ga' 'bras bu mthong ba las de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de rang gi rigs goms pa kho na chags pa dang shes rab la sogs pa rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rgyas pa yod kyang res 'ga' 'bras bu mthong ba las de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir de rang gi rigs goms pa kho na chags pa dang shes rab la sogs pa rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Even though there is increase, sometimes the effect is seen, but not the cause that produces it. Therefore, the increase of attachment, wisdom, etc. is due to the mind‚Äôs habituation to its own kind.

original: rang gi rigs goms pa yang bcud kyis len la sogs pas bskyed pa'i 'byung ba'i khyad par 'dzin par byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes rab la sogs pa'i ngo bos bag @258a * //
analyzed: rang gi rigs goms pa yang bcud kyis len la sogs pas bskyed pa'i 'byung ba'i khyad par 'dzin par byed pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes rab la sogs pa'i ngo bos bag @258a * //
translated: and the special elements generated by elixirs and so on, and so on, because the seeds of wisdom and so on are activated by the power of pleasure and so on that grasps them.

original: chags sad pa yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid yin na thams cad de rten par bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags sad pa yin pa'i phyir de tsam gyi bskyed bya nyid yin na thams cad de rten par bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that alone were the product, then everything would be the support, since there would be no distinction.

original: 'dis ni sman gyi bye brag las nad zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu res 'ga' ba ni ma mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan go bar byed par bshad pa yin te 'bras bu thams cad de tsam las yin par mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan du rtogs par byedüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sman gyi bye brag las nad zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu res 'ga' ba ni ma mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan go bar byed par bshad pa yin te 'bras bu thams cad de tsam las yin par mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu gzhan du rtogs par byedüîΩpa yin no //
translated: This explains that the occasional result, such as the pacification of disease due to the specific medicine, is understood to be another unseen cause, because it is impossible that all results are just that, so another cause is understood.

original: yang na bcud kyis len pa la sogs pas 'byung ba'i khyad par nang gi reg bya'i ngo bo skye ba yin la phyi rol bzhin du shes pa la yang bag chags sad pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba na chags pa dang shes rab la
analyzed: yang na bcud kyis len pa la sogs pas 'byung ba'i khyad par nang gi reg bya'i ngo bo skye ba yin la phyi rol bzhin du shes pa la yang bag chags sad pa'i dbang gis bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba na chags pa dang shes rab la
translated: Or else, the special elements arise from the essence of internal tactile objects, such as elixirs, and pleasure and so on arise from the power of the activation of latent potentialities in consciousness, just as external objects do.

original: sogs pa ni rang gi sa bon smin pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir khams mnyam pa la sogs pa'i rgyas pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni de yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa ni rang gi sa bon smin pa las byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir khams mnyam pa la sogs pa'i rgyas pa la sogs pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni de yin no //
translated: Attachment, wisdom, and so on are not generated from the ripening of their own seeds. That is the reason for the equalizing of the elements and so on.

original: nang gi reg bya de yang reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa bzung ba yin la de las kyang bde ba la sogs pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gi reg bya de yang reg pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa bzung ba yin la de las kyang bde ba la sogs pa de nyid yin no //
translated: That internal tactile object is also the object of the consciousness generated from the tactile faculty, and from that arises pleasure and so on.

original: don ni dmigs pa yin la de log kyang shes pa ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don ni dmigs pa yin la de log kyang shes pa ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: The object is the focal object, and even when that is stopped, consciousness is not stopped.

original: rten yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rten yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the object is the support,

original: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba yin //
translated: it is transformed by the object.

original: zhes bya ba dar go bar byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dar go bar byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de yang khams mnyam pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras mi mnyam pa yin la nges kyang rang gi shes pa yin zhing de las kyang sdug bsngal yin te de'i bag chags sad pa'i las de kho na mi mnyam pa'i 'dzin byed yin la 'dzin
analyzed: de yang khams mnyam pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras mi mnyam pa yin la nges kyang rang gi shes pa yin zhing de las kyang sdug bsngal yin te de'i bag chags sad pa'i las de kho na mi mnyam pa'i 'dzin byed yin la 'dzin
translated: The sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.

original: byed kyang thams cad sngar goms pa kho na las 'byung ba yin la dbang po ni de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin te /üîΩyul 'dzin pa la so sor nges pa tsam gyis bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩrang gi sdug bsngal las rjes su dpag pa las gzhan sdug bsngal ba yin par shugs kyis go pa yin la /
analyzed: byed kyang thams cad sngar goms pa kho na las 'byung ba yin la dbang po ni de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin te / yul 'dzin pa la so sor nges pa tsam gyis bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs par sbyar bar bya'o // rang gi sdug bsngal las rjes su dpag pa las gzhan sdug bsngal ba yin par shugs kyis go pa yin la /
translated: The sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.

original: de'i phyir gzhi la rgyu ni zhe sdang phyir gzhil pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi la rgyu ni zhe sdang phyir gzhil pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is that which engages in that.üîΩThe sense faculty is that which engages in the apprehension of the object, and it arises from only previous habituation. The sense faculty is

original: phyi rol gyi ches yid du 'ong pa'i yul na dmigs pa na nang gi don nye ba las bde ba skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ches yid du 'ong pa'i yul na dmigs pa na nang gi don nye ba las bde ba skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: When one focuses on an external object that is very pleasant, doesn‚Äôt pleasure arise from the proximity of the internal object?

original: de de la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that pleasure arises from focusing on that object.

original: bden te rten kho na de 'di'i yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩgang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bden te rten kho na de 'di'i yin par bstan pa ni / gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is true, but it is taught that the basis itself is the cause of that pleasure.üîΩWhen one focuses on that object, at that time, pleasure arises from the proximity of the internal object.

original: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de'i tshe rten ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dmigs pa de'i tshe rten ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that when one does not focus on that object, at that time, pleasure does not arise from the proximity of the internal object.

original: de log pas ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de log pas ldog pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not that pleasure ceases when one stops focusing on that object.

original: 'dus pa la sogs pa mi mnyam pa ni khyad par @258b nyid yin la de nas ni reg pa'i bskyed pa de'i shes pa yin la de las kyang bag chags sad pa las sam /
analyzed: 'dus pa la sogs pa mi mnyam pa ni khyad par @258b nyid yin la de nas ni reg pa'i bskyed pa de'i shes pa yin la de las kyang bag chags sad pa las sam /
translated: The inequality of the assembly and so on is the specific characteristic. From that, the consciousness generated by contact arises. From that, imprints are activated.

original: gti mug la sogs pa kho na las sam /
analyzed: gti mug la sogs pa kho na las sam /
translated: Or, from delusion and so on,

original: reg pa'i dbang po las 'dus pa'i yul 'dzin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: reg pa'i dbang po las 'dus pa'i yul 'dzin par byed pa ni /
translated: the faculty of contact that apprehends the object of the assembly arises.

original: ri mo dang glur bya ba la sogs pa'i dran shes bzhin du /
analyzed: ri mo dang glur bya ba la sogs pa'i dran shes bzhin du /
translated: Like the memory consciousness of a painting, a song, and so on,

original: goms pa las byung ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang sbyar bar bya ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It should be applied to such things as ‚Äúarising from habituation.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'dus pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dus pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is indicated by ‚Äúby this, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa la sogs pa'i sgras bzung ba'i phyir bcud kyis len la sogs pa dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus pa la sogs pa'i sgras bzung ba'i phyir bcud kyis len la sogs pa dran pa nyams pa la sogs pa'i sgrub byed yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: Since the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as ‚Äúcollection,‚Äù etc., it explains that such things as ‚Äúelixir‚Äù are the means of accomplishing such things as ‚Äúloss of memory.‚Äù

original: der yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in such things as ‚Äúelixir.‚Äù

original: bcud kyis len la sogs pa'i dbang gis nang gi don khams mnyam pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bcud kyis len la sogs pa'i dbang gis nang gi don khams mnyam pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor dmigs pa'o //
translated: The internal object is observed in the form of a balanced constituent, etc., by the power of such things as ‚Äúelixir.‚Äù

original: 'di su zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'di su zhig ce na /
translated: Who is this?

original: bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa nyams pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba'i dran pa nyams pa ni /
translated: It is one whose memory is impaired by latent impressions.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi rnam par dbye ba mi shes pa'o //
translated: He does not know the distinction between self and other.

original: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúBodily transformation‚Äù

original: nang gi 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi 'byung ba yongs su 'gyur pa'o //
translated: is the transformation of the internal elements.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rten nyid dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rten nyid dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the negation of the very support.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mi mnyam pa'i dpe'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as, etc.‚Äù is an example of inequality.

original: thams cad rgyu yin par thal lo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi goms pa sad par byed pa nyid khas mi len na thams cad kyi byed pa po shes rab la sogs pa thams cad du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu yin par thal lo zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi goms pa sad par byed pa nyid khas mi len na thams cad kyi byed pa po shes rab la sogs pa thams cad du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúit would follow, absurdly, that everything would be the cause‚Äù is that if one does not accept that it is the awakening of previous habituation, then it would follow, absurdly, that the creator of everything, such as wisdom, would be everything.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúJust so‚Äù is a summary of the situation.

original: bzung ba'i dngos po yang bde ba dang rmongs pa la sogs pa skyed par byed par mthong ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bzung ba'i dngos po yang bde ba dang rmongs pa la sogs pa skyed par byed par mthong ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following is stated to show that the object that is grasped is seen to be the producer of pleasure, confusion, and so on.

original: dper rgyud khyad par la la la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper rgyud khyad par la la la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For example, in some special continuum.

original: phan pa byed pa'i sems kho na la sems kyi dbang po las sam goms pa las khyad par yin par ni bden na /
analyzed: phan pa byed pa'i sems kho na la sems kyi dbang po las sam goms pa las khyad par yin par ni bden na /
translated: It is true that only the helpful mind is the cause of the special mind, either from the faculty or from habituation.

original: de ni ma la sogs pa'i rgyud las dang po skyes pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur ba las goms pa las sam dbang po las khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni ma la sogs pa'i rgyud las dang po skyes pa ni phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyur 'gyur ba las goms pa las sam dbang po las khyad par du 'gyur ro //
translated: But that which is produced first in the continuum of a mother, and so on, becomes the cause of the later ones. It becomes special from habituation or from the faculty.

original: gang la yang dang po nyid du khyad par can gyi shes rab la sogs pa'am nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam shes yin la /
analyzed: gang la yang dang po nyid du khyad par can gyi shes rab la sogs pa'am nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam shes yin la /
translated: First of all, it is the mental consciousness that is associated with special wisdom and so on, or it is the mental consciousness that is associated with pride.

original: de la yang ma la sogs pa goms pa kho na rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la yang ma la sogs pa goms pa kho na rgyu yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cause of that is the mere habit of mother and so on.üîΩIf that does not exist, then the cause is the grandmother and so on.üîΩThe cause of that is the great grandmother and so on.

original: de ni de med na mes po'i yin la de'i yang de med na yang mes kyi yin par rtogs par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni de med na mes po'i yin la de'i yang de med na yang mes kyi yin par rtogs par bya ba yin te /
translated: The cause of that is the great great grandmother and so on.üîΩThe cause of that is the great great great grandmother and so on.üîΩThe cause of that is the great great great great grandmother and so on.üîΩThe cause of that is the great great great great great grandmother and so on.

original: thag ring ba la rgyu yin pa sngon po'i shes pa'i ser po'i shes pa la sogs pa @259a * //üîΩthag ring po sngon po'i shes pa bzhin du 'dod pa kho na yin no //üîΩdrod gsher las skyes pa ma la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar yin na zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: thag ring ba la rgyu yin pa sngon po'i shes pa'i ser po'i shes pa la sogs pa @259a * // thag ring po sngon po'i shes pa bzhin du 'dod pa kho na yin no // drod gsher las skyes pa ma la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar yin na zhes bya ba 'di ni khyed la yang mtshungs so //

analyzed: de'i khyad par rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de'i nyid kyi phyir rgyud gzhan gyi sems la brten pa ma yin no //

analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i khyad par yang nges pas rjes su 'jug pa ma yin no // de bzhin du rgyud gcig la byis pa'i nyams su myong ba lang tsho la sogs pa na lus tha dad kyang dran pa yin gyi de'i tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa dag ni ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pas sems la phan 'dogs par byed
translated: Because the mind does not follow the special nature of that mind either.

original: pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, in one continuum, even though the body is different in childhood, youth, and so on, there is memory. But the difference and nondifference of the body and mind are not helpful to the mind, as has been explained by the reasoning.
