original: ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the memory of the body in the various states of youth, etc., which is due to the influence of the formative forces of the mind of another continuum.

original: skye ba'i dang por rang nyid rgyud kyi 'du byed pa rjes su 'jug pa yang med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: skye ba'i dang por rang nyid rgyud kyi 'du byed pa rjes su 'jug pa yang med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that at the beginning of birth, there is no influence of one‚Äôs own formative forces?

original: der nyams su myong ba yang mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der nyams su myong ba yang mi dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not remember that.

original: mngal gyi gnas su khyad par can gyi sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir de'i tshe mi dran pa yin la 'di la ni de mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: mngal gyi gnas su khyad par can gyi sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed pa nyid nyams pa'i phyir de'i tshe mi dran pa yin la 'di la ni de mi srid pa yin no //
translated: It is not remembered at that time because the formative forces of the special suffering in the womb have been lost, but this is not possible here.

original: 'di la yang gang nyid kyi zhes bya ba nges pa'i don la nyid kyi sgra yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yang gang nyid kyi zhes bya ba nges pa'i don la nyid kyi sgra yin no //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù in ‚Äúthat very‚Äù has the meaning of determination.

original: gang kho na tshig brjod pa de'i kho na rtog gi ngan pa bzhin du nges pas zhes rjes su 'jug pa'i khyad par can gyi de yang ma yin pa las log pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang kho na tshig brjod pa de'i kho na rtog gi ngan pa bzhin du nges pas zhes rjes su 'jug pa'i khyad par can gyi de yang ma yin pa las log pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to rule out the possibility that the mind is produced by the body alone, as in the case of the body being produced by food, etc.üîΩOr, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to rule out the possibility that the mind is produced by the body alone, as in the case of the mind being produced by the body in the meditative development of the mental concomitants that have been taught.üîΩThe mind of the wise is not produced by the body in the meditative development of the mental concomitants, as is the case with the mind of the fool.

original: yang na bsgom par bstan pa'i 'du byed gang gi rgyud yin pa'i bsgom pa las sems kyang rjes su 'jug par byed pa de'i khyad par gyi khyad par can nyid kyis yin gyi mkhas pa'i rgyud kyis goms pa la de'i sems bzhin du bu'i sems kyang rjes suüîΩ'jug pa ma yin te /üîΩres 'ga' ba'i rjes su 'jug pa cig shos kyi 'du byed pa 'byung ba bkag pa ma yin pa ni de'i 'du byed pa'i bskyed bya'i bdag @259b nyid du nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsgom par bstan pa'i 'du byed gang gi rgyud yin pa'i bsgom pa las sems kyang rjes su 'jug par byed pa de'i khyad par gyi khyad par can nyid kyis yin gyi mkhas pa'i rgyud kyis goms pa la de'i sems bzhin du bu'i sems kyang rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te / res 'ga' ba'i rjes su 'jug pa cig shos kyi 'du byed pa 'byung ba bkag pa ma yin pa ni de'i 'du byed pa'i bskyed bya'i bdag @259b nyid du nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The mind of the fool is not produced by the body in the meditative development of the mental concomitants, as is the case with the mind of the wise.

original: de'i phyir ma la sogs pa'i sems kyang lus bzhin du rten ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma la sogs pa'i sems kyang lus bzhin du rten ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind of the mother, etc. is not the basis, like the body.

original: de la khyad par med kyang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la khyad par med kyang khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Although there is no difference in the nature of the two, there is a difference in their function.üîΩ

original: blo yi byed pa'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: blo yi byed pa'i khyad par gyis //
translated: Although there is no difference in the nature of the mind, there is a difference in its function.üîΩThe difference in the function of the mind

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is due to the difference in the object.

original: de'i phyir nges pa gang nyid kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa gang nyid kyi /
translated: Therefore, the mind is the same in all beings,

original: 'du byed ces bya ba ni de'i khyad par la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba ni de'i khyad par la yang khyad par yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but the mind is different due to the difference in its function.

original: sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'am bkres pa la sogs pa bzhin du thag ring po'i goms pa las byung ba nyid yin na'ang sems pa la sogs pa'i goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid du shes pa ni ma yin te
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du 'am bkres pa la sogs pa bzhin du thag ring po'i goms pa las byung ba nyid yin na'ang sems pa la sogs pa'i goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid du shes pa ni ma yin te
translated: Even though it is like the cognition of blue, etc., or like hunger, etc., and arises from the cultivation of remote causes, it is not known to be the product of the cultivation of volition, etc.

original: / pha'i goms pa yin na yang bu'i ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / pha'i goms pa yin na yang bu'i ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though it is the cultivation of the father, the son is the opposite of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang goms pa tsam las mthong ba'i phyir rang goms pa kho nar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang goms pa tsam las mthong ba'i phyir rang goms pa kho nar gnas pa yin no //
translated: And because inference is seen to arise from mere cultivation, it remains only as one's own cultivation.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang bkres pa la sogs pa rnams kyang 'di kho nar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa dang bkres pa la sogs pa rnams kyang 'di kho nar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Also, consciousness of blue, etc., and hunger, etc., are understood in just this way.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu yang bdag nyid goms pa pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu yang bdag nyid goms pa pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the cause of those is just the repeated experience of the self.

original: mes pa'i goms pa kho na goms pa yang ma yin te /üîΩmes po gson pa na yang de'i goms pa'i khyad par gyis /
analyzed: mes pa'i goms pa kho na goms pa yang ma yin te / mes po gson pa na yang de'i goms pa'i khyad par gyis /
translated: But the repeated experience of the ancestor is not the repeated experience of the grandson,

original: 'di'i sems khyad par du ma mthong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i sems khyad par du ma mthong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when the ancestor is alive, the grandson‚Äôs mind is not seen to be different, due to the difference in his repeated experience.

original: rang gi goms pa ni khyad par gyi rgyur la lar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi goms pa ni khyad par gyi rgyur la lar mthong ba yin no //
translated: But the repeated experience of the grandson is seen to be the cause of the difference.

original: yang na lus bzhin du gzhan gyi sems kyang rten ma yin te de la khyad par med kyang rang goms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na lus bzhin du gzhan gyi sems kyang rten ma yin te de la khyad par med kyang rang goms pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, like the body, the mind of another is not the basis of the repeated experience of the self, because, although there is no difference in that, there is no difference in the repeated experience of the self due to the difference in the repeated experience of the other.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúdue to the difference in the function of the mind‚Äù indicates that the mind of the grandson is not the basis of the repeated experience of the self, because the mind of the grandson is not the same as the mind of the ancestor.

original: blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni 'di kho nas bstan pa yin par rgyud gcig la yang blo rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes lhag par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: blo'i byed pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ni 'di kho nas bstan pa yin par rgyud gcig la yang blo rnams mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes lhag par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the minds in one continuum are the same‚Äù indicates that the mind of the grandson is not the basis of the repeated experience of the self, because the minds in one continuum are the same.

original: de'i phyir nges pa gang nyid kyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa gang nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, by whatever certaintyüîΩ

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩWhatever mind and mental factors engage blue, etc.,üîΩthat is their basis, but not all of them.

original: gang dang gang gi sems dang sems gang dang gang yin par sngon po la sogs pa nyid du 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa de dang de ni de dang de ni de'i rten yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi sems dang sems gang dang gang yin par sngon po la sogs pa nyid du 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa de dang de ni de dang de ni de'i rten yin te /
translated: Whatever mind and mental factors engage blue, etc., that is their basis, but not all of them.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not all of them.

original: gang gi phyir lus dang gzhan gyi sems dang sems gzhan rnams la bye brag med kyang khyad par can gyi sems gang phul du byung na gang phul du byung bar 'gro ba de ni de la brten pa yin zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus dang gzhan gyi sems dang sems gzhan rnams la bye brag med kyang khyad par can gyi sems gang phul du byung na gang phul du byung bar 'gro ba de ni de la brten pa yin zhes nye bar bsdu ba ni /
translated: Because there is no distinction between the body and other minds and mental factors, whatever mind is superior, that is superior. That is its basis. The summary is:

original: de'i phyir sems la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i phyir sems la brten pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par @260a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems la brten pa yin zhes bya ba'o // de'i phyir sems la brten pa yin no zhes bya bar rnam par @260a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be based on the mind.

original: 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary is:

original: de phyir sems nyid log na sems ldog go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de phyir sems nyid log na sems ldog go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, when the mind is reversed, the mind is reversed.

original: gong du lus de dang de la brten pa dang dbang po tsam la brten pa nyid kyang bkag pa yin la gal te dbang po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dbang po'i shes pa nyid kyis brgyud pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyadüîΩpar yin no //üîΩbrgyud pas 'byung ba dngos su 'byung ba kho na yin te de nyid du ngo shes pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba la sel bar byed pa yin te dbang po'i shes pa ma gtogs par yid kyi rgyal srid dang dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i rang rig pa'i rtog pa rab 'byams dgag par mi
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba la sel bar byed pa yin te dbang po'i shes pa ma gtogs par yid kyi rgyal srid dang dbang phyug dang gtso bo la sogs pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i rang rig pa'i rtog pa rab 'byams dgag par mi
translated: The opponent says that the sense consciousnesses are the direct cause of the arising of the thought consciousness.

original: nus so // don yul ma yin pa'i phyir sel ba'i yul la yin te /
analyzed: nus so // don yul ma yin pa'i phyir sel ba'i yul la yin te /
translated: The opponent says that the sense consciousnesses are the direct cause of the arising of the thought

original: rung ba po rnams kyis ma shes pa rang gis shes pa'i phyir shes pa tsam ni snga ma snga ma las byung ba nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pha rol po yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rung ba po rnams kyis ma shes pa rang gis shes pa'i phyir shes pa tsam ni snga ma snga ma las byung ba nyid kyi phyir 'jig rten pha rol po yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because those who are suitable vessels know what is not known by others, mere consciousness is produced from the former, therefore, the world is other than the world.

original: du ba'i bskyed bya kho na de nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir me'i bskyed bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: du ba'i bskyed bya kho na de nyid du gtogs pa'i phyir me'i bskyed bya yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning is that the product of fire is smoke, because it is included in that.

original: du ba me las ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: du ba me las ci 'dra ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is the product of fire like?

original: yid ni shes rab la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni shes rab la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind is wisdom and so on.

original: thams cad la khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad la khyab pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is omnipresent.

original: rang rig pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa tsam las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from mere self-awareness.

original: me'i bskyed bya yin pa'i du ba ni rgyun yin la shes rab la sogs pa yang lus kyi bskyed bya yin pas rgyun yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: me'i bskyed bya yin pa'i du ba ni rgyun yin la shes rab la sogs pa yang lus kyi bskyed bya yin pas rgyun yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The product of fire is smoke, which is a continuum. Wisdom and so on are also the product of the body, so they would be a continuum.

original: du ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: du ba ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is Smoke is not like that.

original: me'i bskyed bya'i du ba bzhin du lus kyi bskyed bya shes rab la sogs pa'i rgyun ma yin te /
analyzed: me'i bskyed bya'i du ba bzhin du lus kyi bskyed bya shes rab la sogs pa'i rgyun ma yin te /
translated: The product of fire is not like the continuum of wisdom and so on, which is the product of the body.

original: 'on kyang goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid do //
translated: However, it is the product of the faculty.

original: dbang po'i shes pa'i bskyed bya nyid kyi rnam shes yin du zin kyang dbang po nyid las dbang po'i rnam shes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa'i bskyed bya nyid kyi rnam shes yin du zin kyang dbang po nyid las dbang po'i rnam shes ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though consciousness is the product of the sense faculty, the sense consciousness is not from the sense faculty itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: snga ma pa'i rnam shes nyid las yin te de'i bya ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: snga ma pa'i rnam shes nyid las yin te de'i bya ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir yin la /
translated: It is from the consciousness of the prior moment, because it conforms to the action of that.

original: dbang po ni nges pa tsam gyis de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po ni nges pa tsam gyis de'i rjes su 'jug par byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The sense faculty is taught to be merely the determiner that causes it to engage in that action.

original: gal te rnam shes 'ga' zhig ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam shes 'ga' zhig ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If any consciousness were to ariseüîΩfrom the sense faculty alone,üîΩthen it would arise even from the sense faculty alone in the absence of the object and the prior consciousness.

original: rnam shes snga ma'i bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yang ste /
analyzed: rnam shes snga ma'i bya ba dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yang ste /
translated: It is also in conformity with the action of the prior consciousness.

original: dbang po dang snang ba dang yul tsam nyid las de skye ba yin yang ma nges pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bzhin du tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po dang snang ba dang yul tsam nyid las de skye ba yin yang ma nges pa'i phyir ma skyes pa bzhin du tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even though it arises from the sense faculty, the object, and the mere appearance, because it is not definite, it is not conventionally designated as arisen.

original: ji ltar sngon po'i rnam par rig pa yang ma nges pa'i phyir sngon po zhes @260b brjod pa ma yin la nges par yin na ni de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po'i rnam par rig pa yang ma nges pa'i phyir sngon po zhes @260b brjod pa ma yin la nges par yin na ni de ltar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Since the cognition of blue is not ascertained, it is not said to be blue. But if it were ascertained, it would be.

original: de ni skyes mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni skyes mod kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what you think, but that is not so.

original: de ltar na thams cad du rig pa med pa ni nges pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad du rig pa med pa ni nges pa med pa kho na'i phyir zhes tha snyad du byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in all cases, the expression ‚Äúthere is no cognition‚Äù is used only because there is no ascertainment,

original: rang med pas ni ma yin pa de lta min na /
analyzed: rang med pas ni ma yin pa de lta min na /
translated: not because there is no cognition itself. If that were not so,

original: rig pa la the tshom za bas 'gar yang bum pa la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rig pa la the tshom za bas 'gar yang bum pa la sogs pa med par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: then because of doubt about cognition, it would not be the case that a pot, etc., would not exist anywhere.üîΩThe demonstration that this is so is as follows:üîΩIf consciousness,

original: gal te rnam shes zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni rnam shes so //
analyzed: gal te rnam shes zhes bya ba ste / de yang zhes bya ba ni rnam shes so //
translated: that is, consciousness,üîΩis not ascertained,

original: de zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu rig pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu rig pa'o //
translated: then the cause of ascertainment, cognition, would not exist.

original: de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the cause of cognition, the sense faculties, etc., would be impaired.

original: de de ltar snga ma'i rnam shes dang lhan cig pa'i dbang po ni rang gi shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan nas da ltar ni snga ma'i rnam shes nyid las 'dir 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de de ltar snga ma'i rnam shes dang lhan cig pa'i dbang po ni rang gi shes pa'i rgyu yin par bstan nas da ltar ni snga ma'i rnam shes nyid las 'dir 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Having thus taught that the sense faculty that is simultaneous with the former consciousness is the cause of its own consciousness, now he teaches that it is not the cause of the sense faculty because it arises here from the former consciousness alone.üîΩThe sense faculty arises from the power of habit.

original: goms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ste mi 'khrul ba nyid ni mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ste mi 'khrul ba nyid ni mi slu ba yin te /
translated: Nondeceptive means undeceiving.

original: don yod pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa nyid la ni de med pa'i phyir dbang po yod pa dang med pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don yod pa'i phyir dang / 'khrul pa nyid la ni de med pa'i phyir dbang po yod pa dang med pas byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because the object exists, and because that does not exist in error, the sense faculty is not produced by the presence or absence of the sense faculty.

original: dbang po yod kyang rab rib can gyis slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po yod kyang rab rib can gyis slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Because even when the sense faculty is present, there is deception for those with cataracts.üîΩThe sense faculty arises from the existence or nonexistence of the object.

original: don yod pa dang med pa las zhes bya ba ste sad pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po 'di'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: don yod pa dang med pa las zhes bya ba ste sad pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po 'di'i khyad par ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúawakened‚Äù is a particular of this sense faculty.

original: gnyid log pa'i dbang po ni goms pa las byung ba yin yang sad pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i dbang po ni goms pa las byung ba yin yang sad pa ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that the sense faculty of one who is asleep arises from habit, but is not awakened?

original: rang gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /üîΩ'bras bu dbang po tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par nyid ni sad pa'i dbang po la yang yod pa'i phyir goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la / 'bras bu dbang po tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par nyid ni sad pa'i dbang po la yang yod pa'i phyir goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Because it has no cause.üîΩIn response to that, it is said that the result is not different from the sense faculty and the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development exists even when the sense faculty is dormant.

original: 'bras dngos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras dngos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The result is the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development.

original: goms pa las byung ba'i dbang po la ni ma la sogs pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba'i dbang po la ni ma la sogs pa'i rgyu lhan cig byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sense faculty that arises from development has a cause that is a coemergent cause, such as a mother.

original: rnam shes 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam shes 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not consciousness alone that is the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development.

original: dbang po yang goms pa'i bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po yang goms pa'i bskyed bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The sense faculty is also the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development.

original: rnam shes kyi bskyed bya yin par nye bar bsdu pa ni /
analyzed: rnam shes kyi bskyed bya yin par nye bar bsdu pa ni /
translated: The sense faculty is included in the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development.

original: des na dbang po nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na dbang po nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that the sense faculty is the specific result of the faculty‚Äôs development.

original: de yang 'di ltar sems 'byung ba la brten pa nyid kyi 'jig rten pha rol po ma yin pa'i sems kyi rten nyid du sgrub pa la gtan tshigs dbang po'i bskyed bya nyid ma grub pa yin la 'gal bar yang bstan nas da ni skye ba snga maüîΩpa'i rang gi @261a * //üîΩsems rten nyid du sgrub pa la /üîΩ'du byed pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa can nyid ni ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar sems 'byung ba la brten pa nyid kyi 'jig rten pha rol po ma yin pa'i sems kyi rten nyid du sgrub pa la gtan tshigs dbang po'i bskyed bya nyid ma grub pa yin la 'gal bar yang bstan nas da ni skye ba snga ma pa'i rang gi @261a * // sems rten nyid du sgrub pa la / 'du byed pa tsam gyi rjes su byed pa can nyid ni ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.üîΩThe reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.üîΩThe reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.

original: skye ba 'di pa tsam la sogs pa'i sems kyi rten nyid la yang yod pa'i phyir la de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa can nyid du ma grub par bstan pa ni /üîΩ'jig rten pha rol po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba 'di pa tsam la sogs pa'i sems kyi rten nyid la yang yod pa'i phyir la de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa can nyid du ma grub par bstan pa ni / 'jig rten pha rol po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.

original: de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa nyid gtan tshigs yin pas ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.üîΩThe reason that the sense faculty is the effect of the elements is not established because the world beyond is not established as the support of the mind that depends on the arising of the mind.

original: nges bas sems kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nges bas sems kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the seeing is definitely subsequent to the mental disposition.

original: pha dang ma yi rang bzhin gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma yi rang bzhin gyis // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The seeing is not the same as the mental disposition of the father and mother.

original: de 'gyur yang zhes bya ba 'di las bzlog pa'i skyon bstan pa ni gal te de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de 'gyur yang zhes bya ba 'di las bzlog pa'i skyon bstan pa ni gal te de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The fault of the opposite of that is shown in the phrase ‚Äúif it were so.‚Äù

original: pha dang ma'i sems kyi 'du byed pa 'ba' zhig las ni bu'i sems kyi 'du byed pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: pha dang ma'i sems kyi 'du byed pa 'ba' zhig las ni bu'i sems kyi 'du byed pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the mental disposition of the son is not from the mental disposition of the father and mother alone?

original: de lta mod kyi der sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa las yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi der sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i lhan cig byed pa las yin no //
translated: That is so, but it is from the cooperating cause that superimposes that.

original: ji ltar de dag nyid de las gzhan pa'i lhan cig byed pa las yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag nyid de las gzhan pa'i lhan cig byed pa las yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: How is it that they think that it is from the cooperating cause that is different from that?

original: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it were so‚Äù is stated.

original: de dag gi 'du byed pa gang yin pa der sgro 'dogs pa 'don pa po'am 'chad pa po lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de de'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: de dag gi 'du byed pa gang yin pa der sgro 'dogs pa 'don pa po'am 'chad pa po lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de de'i rang bzhin nyid ni /
translated: The mental disposition of those two is the superimposition of that. The one who recites or explains is the cooperating cause. That which is its nature is not the nature of the other.

original: de ste pha dang / de'i ste ma dang 'brel pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste pha dang / de'i ste ma dang 'brel pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: That is, it would be related to the father, and the is related to the mother.

original: 'don pa po ni ma la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin te de'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te /üîΩde yang de'i rgyu yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'don pa po ni ma la sogs pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin te de'i ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhe na ma yin te / de yang de'i rgyu yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reciter is the co-operating cause of the mother, etc. , but not by way of its own nature.üîΩThis is not so, because that is also its cause, without distinction.

original: 'du byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed pa yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that.

original: 'don pa bos rag las par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: 'don pa bos rag las par bya ba la'o //
translated: The reciter is dependent on the recitation.

original: res 'ga' ni mngon pa 'dod pa med na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mngon pa 'dod pa med na'o //
translated: Sometimes, when there is no desire to recite,

original: de rnam par 'gyur ba med kyang 'gyur ba //
analyzed: de rnam par 'gyur ba med kyang 'gyur ba //
translated: it would change, even though it does not change.

original: zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on this is:

original: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not so,

original: ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin du zin kyang mkhan po'i 'du byad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yang rang gi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la 'gal ba med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug pa ma yin du zin kyang mkhan po'i 'du byad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yang rang gi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa la 'gal ba med pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Even though it does not follow the nature of the mother, etc. , it is not contradictory that it follows the reciter, because it follows its own reciter.

original: mkhan po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhan po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe master‚Äù is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

original: rang gi rnam shes sngon du 'gro ba mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par kho na las de 'byung ba'i phyir skyon med pa yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam shes sngon du 'gro ba mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par kho na las de 'byung ba'i phyir skyon med pa yin par bstan pa ni / ma yin te /
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

original: de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

analyzed: de rnam par 'gyur ba med kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir zhas bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten pha rol sgrub par byed pa'i mchog @261b yin par bstan pa ni / des na 'jig rten pha rol med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

original: 'du byed rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed rjes su 'jug ces bya ba ni /
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

original: pha'i'o zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no //üîΩci las shes she na /
analyzed: pha'i'o zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin no // ci las shes she na /
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.

original: pha'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di res 'ga' zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin te de rgyu ma yin na res 'ga' yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: pha'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di res 'ga' zhes bya ba la ltos pa yin te de rgyu ma yin na res 'ga' yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The master of the house is the one who is the master of the house.üîΩThe master of

original: de bzhin du rgyu de'i 'bras bu gzhan las kyang ji ltar 'byung bar bstan pa ni pha'i rang bzhin thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu de'i 'bras bu gzhan las kyang ji ltar 'byung bar bstan pa ni pha'i rang bzhin thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Likewise, in order to show how the effect of that cause arises from another, it says, ‚Äúall the nature of the father.‚Äù

original: rang gi sems kyi bskyed bya kho na yin na /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi bskyed bya kho na yin na /
translated: If it is only produced by one‚Äôs own mind,

original: ji ltar res 'ga' pha'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug par byed ces pa sel ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar res 'ga' pha'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'jug par byed ces pa sel ba bstan pa ni /
translated: how is it that sometimes it follows the nature of the father? In order to dispel this doubt, it says,

original: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste pha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste pha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äúthe nature of that,‚Äù that is, the nature of the father.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad rang gi rgyud kho na'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad rang gi rgyud kho na'i 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that all sentient beings follow only the formative forces of their own continuum, and not of another.

original: de skad du yang de'i phyir nges par bdag nyid kyi 'du byed kyi ni rjes su 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad du yang de'i phyir nges par bdag nyid kyi 'du byed kyi ni rjes su 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it says, ‚Äútherefore, it follows the formative forces of its own self.‚Äù

original: 'di kho nas rang gi rgyud kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nges pas rnam shes gcig srog chags thams cad kyi rnam shes rnams kyi skye gnas yin no zhes ma la sogs pa'i rnam shes bzhin du gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di kho nas rang gi rgyud kyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nges pas rnam shes gcig srog chags thams cad kyi rnam shes rnams kyi skye gnas yin no zhes ma la sogs pa'i rnam shes bzhin du gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the verse is clear, like the consciousness of a mother, etc.

original: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But how?üîΩIf it is the cause of the consciousness of the self, it must be the cause of the consciousness of the self in all its aspects.

original: gal te 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur grang na de'i rang bzhin bzhin du cig shos kyang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'gyur grang na de'i rang bzhin bzhin du cig shos kyang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: But it is not the cause of the consciousness of the self in all its aspects, because it is not the cause of the consciousness of the self in the form of the other, as it is in the form of the self.

original: 'jig rten pha rol tu smra ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol tu smra ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the verse is clear, like the consciousness of a mother, etc.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par la sogs pa re zhig rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par la sogs pa re zhig rjes su 'jug pa yin la /
translated: The consciousness of the self in the form of the other is not the cause of the consciousness of the self in the form of the self, because it is not the consciousness of the self in the form of the self.

original: des de'i bskyed bya yin par shes pas rang bzhin gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan yin par brtag par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des de'i bskyed bya yin par shes pas rang bzhin gzhan gyi rjes su 'jug pa la rgyu mtshan gzhan yin par brtag par bya ba yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not taught that the reason for the other‚Äôs engagement in the nature of the self is to be examined, because it is known that the other is the product of the self.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'am zhes bya ba ste /üîΩma la sogs pa dang rgyud gcig yin na ru'i rang gi nyams su myong ba'i nyams su myong ba dran pa ni de'i lus la yang 'gyur ro zhes de'i rgyud nyid la 'bras bu med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'am zhes bya ba ste / ma la sogs pa dang rgyud gcig yin na ru'i rang gi nyams su myong ba'i nyams su myong ba dran pa ni de'i lus la yang 'gyur ro zhes de'i rgyud nyid la 'bras bu med par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú Or else, distraction‚ÄùüîΩIf the mother and so on were of the same continuum as the self, then the memory of the experience of the mother‚Äôs experience would also be the memory of the experience of the self‚Äôs body.

original: de nyid kyi lus bzhin du ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi lus bzhin du ces bya ba'o //
translated: The absence of a result in the continuum of the other is taught: ‚ÄúJust as in the body of the other.‚Äù

original: dug gi srin bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /üîΩpha rol po'i bsam pa'i dpe yin la de'i ni sems thams cad de kho @262a * //
analyzed: dug gi srin bu bzhin no zhes bya ba ni / pha rol po'i bsam pa'i dpe yin la de'i ni sems thams cad de kho @262a * //
translated: ‚Äú Like a worm in poison‚Äù

original: na'i tshe 'byung ba yin gyi skye ba gzhan la ni de 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: na'i tshe 'byung ba yin gyi skye ba gzhan la ni de 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: is an example of the opponent‚Äôs opinion. The meaning is that all the minds of the other arise only at that time, and they do not arise in another life.

original: byis pa nyid la 'bras bu'i khyad par med pas sems gsal por ma gyur pa yin la de khyad par yin na ni /
analyzed: byis pa nyid la 'bras bu'i khyad par med pas sems gsal por ma gyur pa yin la de khyad par yin na ni /
translated: Since there is no difference in the result of a child, the mind does not become clear.üîΩIf that is a difference, then does it not become clear in youth and so on?

original: lang tsho la sogs pa na gsal por 'gyur ba ma yin nam bza' ba'i khyad par las 'byung ba chen po khyad par skye ba'i phyir lus kyi khyad par las khyad par yang ma yin te /üîΩbcud kyis len bzhin du 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i bde ba'i reg pa'i khyad par gyis bag chags kyi khyad par sad pa las sems kyi khyad par 'byung bar mngon par brjod pa'i phyir /üîΩ'ga' cho chags sogs rgyas sogs kyis //üîΩ'phel pa bde sdug las skyes yin //
analyzed: lang tsho la sogs pa na gsal por 'gyur ba ma yin nam bza' ba'i khyad par las 'byung ba chen po khyad par skye ba'i phyir lus kyi khyad par las khyad par yang ma yin te / bcud kyis len bzhin du 'byung ba'i khyad par gyis bskyed pa'i bde ba'i reg pa'i khyad par gyis bag chags kyi khyad par sad pa las sems kyi khyad par 'byung bar mngon par brjod pa'i phyir / 'ga' cho chags sogs rgyas sogs kyis // 'phel pa bde sdug las skyes yin //
translated: Also, it is not a difference due to a difference in the body, because a difference in the great elements arises from a difference in food.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Because it is stated:üîΩThe difference in the mind arises from the difference in the latent potentialitiesüîΩthat are awakened by the difference in the feeling of pleasure

original: de'i phyir bza' ba'i bye brag med kyang lus yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par kho na las blo'i khyad par skye bar mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' ba'i bye brag med kyang lus yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par kho na las blo'i khyad par skye bar mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: generated by the difference in the elements,üîΩlike the difference in elixir.üîΩSome say: The difference in the mind arises from the difference in the latent potentialities of the mind that are awakened by the difference in the feeling of pleasure generated by the difference in the elements that are generated by the difference in food.üîΩThe difference in the elements is generated by the difference in karma.

original: de'i bskyed bya yin pa ni goms pas khyad par du yin yin no snyam du sems pa la ji ltar thos sogs kyi yul du byed pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bskyed bya yin pa ni goms pas khyad par du yin yin no snyam du sems pa la ji ltar thos sogs kyi yul du byed pa ni goms pa'o //
translated: The object of hearing, etc. is the cause of the body‚Äôs excellence, and the cause of the mind‚Äôs excellence is cultivation.

original: sems la byas pa ni shes rab la sogs pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yin la de bzhin du lus kyi bdag nyid kyis kyang gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems la byas pa ni shes rab la sogs pa'i sems kyi bdag nyid kyis gsal bar byed pa yin la de bzhin du lus kyi bdag nyid kyis kyang gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is made clear by the nature of the mind of wisdom, etc., and in the same way, the body is made clear.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dbye ba phul du byung ba las byung ba'i shes pa la goms pa las 'byung ba tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i sems las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dbye ba phul du byung ba las byung ba'i shes pa la goms pa las 'byung ba tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not different from the mind that follows it, the excellence of the body is not different from the excellence of the knowledge that arises from cultivation.

original: de'i phyir de yang de bzhin du lus phul du byung ba'i rjes su byed pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin gyi byis pa nyid la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang de bzhin du lus phul du byung ba'i rjes su byed pa kho nar 'gyur ba yin gyi byis pa nyid la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body also follows the excellence of the mind, but not childishness, etc.,

original: goms pas phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pas phul du byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no excellence due to cultivation.

original: 'on te sems tsam ni lus las yin la goms pa las ni de'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sems tsam ni lus las yin la goms pa las ni de'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Or, the mind is from the body, and its excellence is from cultivation.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: khyad par las gzhan pa'i de tsam ni ma mthong pa'i phyir dang khyad par thams cad kyang goms pa las byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par las gzhan pa'i de tsam ni ma mthong pa'i phyir dang khyad par thams cad kyang goms pa las byung ba'i phyir /
translated: because we do not see any such thing apart from the distinctive qualities, and because all distinctive qualities arise from cultivation.

original: lus las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: lus las byung ba ma yin pa nyid kyi shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: It is only a cognition that does not arise from the body,

original: goms pa'i bskyed byar mngon par 'dod pa las 'di khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed byar mngon par 'dod pa las 'di khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it is produced by cultivation, and because it is not different from that.

original: yon tan zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas yon tan nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yon tan zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi 'dod pas yon tan nyid du mngon par 'dod pa yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúquality‚Äù is that what is accepted as a quality by others would be just like that.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni sems bzhin du lus kyang gsal bar 'gyur ba ste @262b dmigs par 'gyur ba ni lus la tha mi dad pa'i phyir te yon tan nyid kyis de'i dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni sems bzhin du lus kyang gsal bar 'gyur ba ste @262b dmigs par 'gyur ba ni lus la tha mi dad pa'i phyir te yon tan nyid kyis de'i dmigs pa yin na /
translated: The author of the commentary says, ‚ÄúJust as the mind is clear, the body also becomes clear, that is, it is perceived, because it is not different from the body. If it is the object of that because it is a quality,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dmigs bar 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du dmigs bar 'gyur ba zhig na dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it would be perceived like form and so on, but it is not perceived.

original: de'i phyir lus nyid blo ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus nyid blo ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is taught that the body itself is not cognition.‚Äù

original: ji ltar thos sogs 'du byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar thos sogs 'du byed pa //
translated: The compound ‚Äúmental activity consisting of hearing, etc.‚Äù

original: sems la byas ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni blo'i khyad par the tshom gyi yul yin par bstan pa ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sems la byas ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni blo'i khyad par the tshom gyi yul yin par bstan pa ni tha dad pa sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúmental activity consisting of‚Äù indicates that the object of doubt is a particular kind of awareness.

original: de yang de grub na yang blo'i khyad par la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de yang de grub na yang blo'i khyad par la the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Moreover, even when that is established, there is still doubt about the particular kind of awareness.

original: dngos po grub kyang mi rtag pa nyid du ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po grub kyang mi rtag pa nyid du ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that even though the thing is established, its impermanence is not established?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba'i dngos po dmigs pa kho na mi rtag pa nyid mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam par dbye ba dang bral ba'i dngos po dmigs pa kho na mi rtag pa nyid mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the very observation of a thing that is devoid of the distinction of prior and subsequent states clearly expresses its impermanence.

original: de ltar lus rig pas gzugs la sogs pa rig pa bzhin du blo'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus rig pas gzugs la sogs pa rig pa bzhin du blo'i khongs su gtogs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the body is not included among the awarenesses, just like form, etc., are not.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa'i bskyed bya lus kyi gnas skabs las phul du byung ba'am /
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed pa'i bskyed bya lus kyi gnas skabs las phul du byung ba'am /
translated: The compound ‚Äúmental activity consisting of hearing, etc.‚Äù refers to the body that is produced by the formative forces consisting of hearing, etc., and that is superior to the ordinary body.

original: skye ba'i dang po la byung ba'i khyad par gyi khyad par las de'i bskyed byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: skye ba'i dang po la byung ba'i khyad par gyi khyad par las de'i bskyed byar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the first arising that is the special effect of the special cause?

original: 'di las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa'i sems pa can tsam byung ba tsam las byung ba yin pa ma yin la khyad par yang goms pa las gzhan pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba snga ma las 'dir 'ongs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa'i sems pa can tsam byung ba tsam las byung ba yin pa ma yin la khyad par yang goms pa las gzhan pa las mi 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba snga ma las 'dir 'ongs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The mere arising of the mere mind, which is neither different nor not different from that, is not the effect of that. And since a special effect does not arise from a cause that is not special, the mind arises from the mind of a previous birth.

original: blo dang ldan pa 'di rang dbang du 'di yin par mi rigs te gang gi phyir blo dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal du ma can gyi skye ba'i rgyun rang dbang du mngon par 'dod pa ma yin te /üîΩlas kyi dbang gis yin no zhe na /

translated: It is not logical that the wise would voluntarily assume this mind, because the wise do not voluntarily assume the continuum of birth, which is full of many sufferings.üîΩIf you say that they do so through the power of karma,

analyzed: las sam de'i rgyu las yang ji ltar 'jug pa yin 'di ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //

original: de'i phyir de bzhin du skye ba'i 'chi ba khas len pa la de'i rgyu ni da ltar ba bzhin du dbang phyug yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin du skye ba'i 'chi ba khas len pa la de'i rgyu ni da ltar ba bzhin du dbang phyug yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in the same way, the cause of birth and death is God, just like the cause of the present world.

original: 'dzud byed yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par ni 'di tsam yin te de da ltar ba ni ma nyes pa yin na de'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: 'dzud byed yin pa'i phyir ro // khyad par ni 'di tsam yin te de da ltar ba ni ma nyes pa yin na de'i rgyu yin /

analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan du yin no // 'chi ba gang yang la la'i thabs kyis yin gyi gzhan gyi ni gzhan du yin te /
translated: The only difference is that the cause of the present world is God, but the cause of the other world is another.üîΩThe cause of death is one thing, but the cause of birth is another.üîΩThe cause of death is one thing, but the cause of birth is another.üîΩThe cause of death is one thing, but the cause of birth is another.

analyzed: bden mod kyi goms pa'i bskyed bya'i sems 'ching ba'i ming can las 'dzud byed rjes su dpog pa yin no mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par can kho na yin pa ni thos pa goms pa bzhin du mthong bar rjes su dpog pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te / goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Indeed, that is true, but it is inferred that the instigator is the special mind generated by cultivation, which is called ‚Äúthe fetter.‚ÄùüîΩIt is inferred that the instigator is the special mind generated by cultivation, which is called ‚Äúthe fetter,‚Äù just as it is inferred that seeing is cultivated by hearing, but not otherwise.

original: phan tshun 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is inferred that it is the special mind generated by cultivation because it is the mutual fetter.

original: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa //üîΩzhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyis bkri min pa // zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The line ‚Äúnot led by other sentient beings‚ÄùüîΩrefutes the assertion by others that the instigator is

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'dzud byed bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'i 'dzud byed bkag pa yin te /
translated: This is a refutation of the position that the appropriator is that which causes the appropriated to come together.üîΩ

original: des goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad pa nyid la ma khyab pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par de grub ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad pa nyid la ma khyab pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par de grub ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that the special mind generated by cultivation is established by the special mind that is desired.

original: bdag @263b la chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag @263b la chags pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The line ‚Äúendowed with attachment to self‚ÄùüîΩrefutes the assertion by others that the instigator isüîΩ.

original: ji ltar bdag la chags pa 'dzud byed yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag la chags pa 'dzud byed yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse shows how attachment to the self is the cause of bondage.üîΩOne who can abandon happiness and suffering

original: bde sdug 'dor thub ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde sdug 'dor thub ces bya ba ste /
translated: is not attached to either.

original: bdag la mngon par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: bdag la mngon par 'dod pa ni /
translated: One who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.

original: bdag la phan pa byed pa'i phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa la'am /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa byed pa'i phreng ba dang tsan dan la sogs pa la'am /
translated: which are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.üîΩOne who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.

original: sbyin ba la sogs pa la 'bras bu mthong ba dang / cig shos la mngon par dga' bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin ba la sogs pa la 'bras bu mthong ba dang / cig shos la mngon par dga' bar byed pa yin la /
translated: which are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.

original: de la mngon bar dga' bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: de la mngon bar dga' bar byed pa ni //
translated: One who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.üîΩwhich are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.üîΩOne who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.üîΩwhich are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.

original: de don du mi gnyer ba 'joms pa yin la mngon par 'dod pa dang / slar gnod pa dag rab tu sbyor bas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i las rnams 'phel bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de don du mi gnyer ba 'joms pa yin la mngon par 'dod pa dang / slar gnod pa dag rab tu sbyor bas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i las rnams 'phel bar byed pa yin la /
translated: One who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.

original: de rnams kyi bde 'gro'am ngan 'gror skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bde 'gro'am ngan 'gror skye ba yin no //
translated: which are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.üîΩOne who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.üîΩwhich are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.üîΩOne who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.üîΩwhich are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.

original: bdag nyid shes na gnod pa byed pa de la mngon par 'dod par mi 'gyur la sgrub byed sbyin pa la sogs pa la mngon par dka' bar 'gyur gyi ngan 'gro la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid shes na gnod pa byed pa de la mngon par 'dod par mi 'gyur la sgrub byed sbyin pa la sogs pa la mngon par dka' bar 'gyur gyi ngan 'gro la ni ma yin te /
translated: One who is attached to the self is attached to the self's benefit.üîΩThis is like being attached to a rosary or sandalwood, etc.üîΩwhich are thought to benefit the self, or like being attached to the results of generosity, etc.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i phyir la gnod pa byed pa la ni mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i phyir la gnod pa byed pa la ni mngon par dga' ba ma yin no //
translated: because they are harmful, and one does not delight in what is harmful.

original: 'dir brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa ni /
translated: Here we say:

original: ngan 'gro la yang bdag la chags pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba rnams goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir rang gi rigs goms pa la ltos pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro la yang bdag la chags pas bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang sngon po la sogs par snang ba rnams goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir rang gi rigs goms pa la ltos pa kho na yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Even in the unfortunate planes of existence, the appearance of pleasure, pain, etc., and blue, etc., are produced by the special development of the habit-energy of attachment to self. Therefore, it should be understood that they are dependent only on the development of their own kind.

original: gnod pa byed pa de rnams bdag nyid dang ldan pa ji ltar goms par byed ce na /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa de rnams bdag nyid dang ldan pa ji ltar goms par byed ce na /
translated: How can one develop the habit of being attached to those who harm oneself?

original: bdag la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of attachment to self.

original: de ni de ltar chags par 'gyur bas gnod pa byed pa la gnod pas bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel bar byed la 'phel ba de rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du de de lta bu'i srid pa yin bar lung las go ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar chags par 'gyur bas gnod pa byed pa la gnod pas bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel bar byed la 'phel ba de rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du de de lta bu'i srid pa yin bar lung las go ba yin no //
translated: Since that attachment is like that, the development of demerit through harming those who harm oneself increases. And from the increase of that, one is born in that way. This is understood from the scriptures.

original: goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
analyzed: goms pa'i bskyed bya nyid yin na /
translated: If it is the special development of the habit-energy,

original: ji ltar las rgyu mtshan yin de lta yin na dbang phyug kyang 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar las rgyu mtshan yin de lta yin na dbang phyug kyang 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: If the reason for karma is that way, then even God would be the reason.

original: dbang po rnams sam shes pa'am shes rab la sogs pa rnams goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams sam shes pa'am shes rab la sogs pa rnams goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the faculties, consciousnesses, wisdom, and so on are the special effects of cultivation.

original: dge ba'i sems pa la dang pa'i rjes su 'jug pa las byung ba rnams bde bar gshegs pa rnams la mngon par gsal bar 'gyur la /üîΩmi dge ba'i sems la ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir goms pa las byung ba nyid dge ba dang cig shos kyi bsgom pa @264a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems pa la dang pa'i rjes su 'jug pa las byung ba rnams bde bar gshegs pa rnams la mngon par gsal bar 'gyur la / mi dge ba'i sems la ni de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir goms pa las byung ba nyid dge ba dang cig shos kyi bsgom pa @264a * //
translated: Those that arise from engagement in virtuous intention manifest in the sugatas.üîΩThose that arise from nonvirtuous intention are the opposite of that.

original: las byung ba rnams la khyad par med pa yin te de 'dra ba dang mthun pa yin zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: las byung ba rnams la khyad par med pa yin te de 'dra ba dang mthun pa yin zhes byas nas so //
translated: Cultivation is the same for both virtue and nonvirtue.

original: gzhan ni yul te snod yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu mthun pa dang lhan cig pa'i dus su rgyu de las byung ba yin par brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan ni yul te snod yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rgyu mthun pa dang lhan cig pa'i dus su rgyu de las byung ba yin par brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The other is the object, such as the transformation of the environment, which is said to arise from that cause at the time of the external cause and effect.

original: de tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by that alone.üîΩIt is not reasonable to conceive of God, etc. as the cause of the world, because the ripening of dissimilar results is the ripening of karma.

original: dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa ni mi rigs te mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes byas nas rgyu mthun pa sgrub par byed pa nyid de dang lhan cig byung ba'i rnam par smin pa sgrub par byed pa nyid du
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs par rtogs pa ni mi rigs te mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir zhes byas nas rgyu mthun pa sgrub par byed pa nyid de dang lhan cig byung ba'i rnam par smin pa sgrub par byed pa nyid du
translated: The establishment of the cause of the concordant result is reasonable as the establishment of the cause of the simultaneous result,

original: rigs pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa yin gyi dbang phyug la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of God, etc.

original: phyogs gcig la yang nus pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig la yang nus pa yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that their power over even a single thing is not fully understood.

original: dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dman pa'i gnas yongs su 'dzin pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of the possession of an inferior state.

original: 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma ni /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma ni /
translated: The prior position is that it would be the cause of the origination of the elements.

original: ji ltar thos sogs 'du byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad bar nyid bsal nas /
analyzed: ji ltar thos sogs 'du byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad bar nyid bsal nas /
translated: The distinction of being the product of cultivation is refuted by such statements as ‚ÄúHow could the formative forces such as hearing, etc.

original: 'dis bsal bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis bsal bar bya ba ni /
translated: The refutation by this is as follows.

original: de phyir 'o na gal te 'byung ba chen po tsam las byung ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan ba'i rjes su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de phyir 'o na gal te 'byung ba chen po tsam las byung ba ma yin gyi zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan ba'i rjes su brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the response beginning with ‚ÄúIt is not maintained that the self arises from the great elements alone‚Äù up to ‚ÄúIt is not maintained‚Äù is stated.

original: dbang phyug gis bskul bar yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs snang ma yin par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis bskul bar yang mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i phyogs snang ma yin par shes par bya'o /
translated: It should be understood that the position ‚ÄúIt is not maintained that the self is impelled by ƒ™≈õvara‚Äù is also not tenable.

original: bdag tu lta ba yin yang chags par ma byas na mi 'ching pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba yin yang chags par ma byas na mi 'ching pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúEven though it is the view of the self, if one does not generate attachment, one is not bound,‚Äù

original: brjod pa / sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa la rgyu mtshan las byung ba la rgyu mtshan du tha snyad 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ni rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa yin la de las bzlog pa ni rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa / sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa la rgyu mtshan las byung ba la rgyu mtshan du tha snyad 'dod pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ni rang bzhin gyis mi rtag pa yin la de las bzlog pa ni rtag pa yin te /
translated: we respond: Since it is asserted that the cause of suffering and impermanence is the cause of arising, suffering is naturally impermanent, and the opposite of that is permanent.

original: de yang bde ba'i ngo bo'i khongs su gtogs pa yin la de la blo gros te bdag go zhes bya ba ni blo yin la de kho na chags pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i ngo bo'i khongs su gtogs pa yin la de la blo gros te bdag go zhes bya ba ni blo yin la de kho na chags pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that is included in the essence of happiness, and the mind that is called ‚Äúthe self‚Äù is the mind, and that is attachment.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the nature of that which is manifestly desired.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni rtag pa dang bde ba bdag nyid kyi yul yin pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni rtag pa dang bde ba bdag nyid kyi yul yin pa nyid kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The view of self is the nature of that which is manifestly desired because it has as its object the self that is permanent and blissful. The other views are not like that.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa la skye ba'i dang po la sred pa yang de la chags pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis po de 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs par byed pa la skye ba'i dang po la sred pa yang de la chags pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyis po de 'ching ba'i rgyu yin gyi dbang phyug ni ma yin te /
translated: Craving for the first moment of birth in a life that benefits the self arises from attachment to the self. Therefore the two are the cause of bondage, but not God,

original: nus pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because his power is not known.üîΩThat one comes here from a past life and goes from this life to a future life is not something produced from a place to another place, but it is something that occurs.

original: 'das pa'i srid pa las @264b 'dir 'ongs pa dang 'di las kyang ma 'ongs par 'gro ba ni yul nas yul gzhan bzhin du 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin na rtogs bar 'gyur la dmigs pa'i yul yin yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'byung bya kho na nyid yin
analyzed: 'das pa'i srid pa las @264b 'dir 'ongs pa dang 'di las kyang ma 'ongs par 'gro ba ni yul nas yul gzhan bzhin du 'byung ba'i bskyed bya ma yin na rtogs bar 'gyur la dmigs pa'i yul yin yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir 'byung bya kho na nyid yin
translated: It is not something produced because it is not observed, even though it is an object that can be observed.

original: te de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes ba ni /
analyzed: te de yod na 'byung ba'i phyir zhes ba ni /
translated: It is like the existence of a place that is not observed.

original: gal te 'gro 'ong ma thod na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'gro 'ong ma thod na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not understand going and coming,üîΩthen one does not understand the world.

original: de 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: snga ma bzhin du goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad pa nyid la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'gro ba la sogs pa ma mthong pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus btsud pas myur du 'phangs pa'i bong ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du goms pa'i bskyed bya'i khyad pa nyid la sogs pa las 'byung ba'i bskyed bya nyid yin pa gsal ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'gro ba la sogs pa ma mthong pa ni nus pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bus btsud pas myur du 'phangs pa'i bong ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: because, as before, the specific effect of the cause of habituation is clearly seen.

original: dbugs 'byin par byed pa bzhin du shugs dang ldan pa kho na'i phyir nye bar mtshon par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin par byed pa bzhin du shugs dang ldan pa kho na'i phyir nye bar mtshon par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the non-perception of going to another world, etc., is not a valid reason, because it is like the swift throwing of a clod, etc., by a powerful man, or like the exhalation of breath.

original: bdag la chags pa dang srid pa dag kho na 'dzud byed nying du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang srid pa dag kho na 'dzud byed nying du brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is said that only attachment to self and craving impel.

original: bden te / de gnyis kyang 'gro ba la sogs par nye bar mtshon pa ma yin par mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: bden te / de gnyis kyang 'gro ba la sogs par nye bar mtshon pa ma yin par mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This is true, but these two are not valid reasons for the non-perception of going to another world, etc.

original: skul byed kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skul byed kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse means that

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong bar mthong ba'i shugs dang ldan pa'i 'dzud byed sngon du 'gro ba can ni phan byed kyi khyad par 'phen par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩyang na ma rig pa dang sred pa dag gis btsud pas 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i lus la yod pa'i phyir de med na skye ba snga ma las 'jig rten 'di dang 'di las kyang pha rol du ji ltar 'ongs pa dang 'gro ba yang yin rnam shes
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong bar mthong ba'i shugs dang ldan pa'i 'dzud byed sngon du 'gro ba can ni phan byed kyi khyad par 'phen par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yang na ma rig pa dang sred pa dag gis btsud pas 'gro ba ni mthong ba'i lus la yod pa'i phyir de med na skye ba snga ma las 'jig rten 'di dang 'di las kyang pha rol du ji ltar 'ongs pa dang 'gro ba yang yin rnam shes
translated: The meaning is that the world is propelled by the force of being seen to come and go, and it is propelled by the special assistance of the cooperative conditions.üîΩOr, the world is propelled by ignorance and craving, and it is seen to come and go in the body. If that were not so, how could it come from a previous birth to this world and go from here to the next world?

original: las gzhan nye bar brten pa med na 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: las gzhan nye bar brten pa med na 'gro ba'am /
translated: Consciousness is not the world, because it is not seen to come and go.

original: gzhan yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it anything other than consciousness,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang lus la sred pa dang bcas pa ni nge med na skye ba snga ma mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir dang lus la sred pa dang bcas pa ni nge med na skye ba snga ma mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary and because it does not endure without craving for the body.

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong ba'i phyir rnam shes 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag mthong ba'i phyir rnam shes 'jig rten pha rol pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because coming and going are seen, consciousness is not the world beyond.

original: 'on kyang bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: But the self is not the world,üîΩbecause it is not seen to come and go.

original: rtag pa dang khyab bdag nyid dag gi lus gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir la de yang nyin zhag gzhan la mthong ba nyin zhag gzhan la bdag 'di mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes shes pa las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang khyab bdag nyid dag gi lus gzhan dang 'brel pa'i phyir la de yang nyin zhag gzhan la mthong ba nyin zhag gzhan la bdag 'di mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhes shes pa las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the body of the permanent and all-pervading self is connected to another, and because it is seen on one day and seen again on another day, the self exists.

original: skad cig ma'i shes pa rnams la ni de lta bu mi srid do //üîΩde'i phyir de rnams ni gcig ma yin la bdag de ni 'jig rten pha rol pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i shes pa rnams la ni de lta bu mi srid do // de'i phyir de rnams ni gcig ma yin la bdag de ni 'jig rten pha rol pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: But that is not possible for momentary consciousnesses.üîΩTherefore, they are not one, and the self is the next world.

original: gal te 'gro 'ong zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlan ni / dbang po mi gsal phyir mi @265a * //
analyzed: gal te 'gro 'ong zhes bya ba'o // lan ni / dbang po mi gsal phyir mi @265a * //
translated: If you say that the self is the next world because it goes and comes,üîΩthe response is:

original: mthong // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not seen because the sense faculties are unclear.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi ma mthong ba ni shugs sam 'phen byed yin par go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang bdag la chags pas 'phangs pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi dbang pos rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi ma mthong ba ni shugs sam 'phen byed yin par go bar byed pa ma yin gyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yang bdag la chags pas 'phangs pa 'ba' zhig kho na yin gyi dbang pos rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The non-seeing of going and coming is not understood to be an impetus or a projection, but going and coming are projected by attachment to the self alone, they are not understood by the sense faculties.

original: gsal po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na don gyis go ba la nus pa med do //
analyzed: gsal po ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di yod na don gyis go ba la nus pa med do //
translated: Because it is not clear, i.e., because the meaning is not clear.

original: 'dzud byed gzhan yin par smra ba po yang gsal po nyid la skur pa 'debs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzud byed gzhan yin par smra ba po yang gsal po nyid la skur pa 'debs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And the one who maintains that the one who is the introducer is different from the one who is the speaker does not deny clarity.

original: lus 'di bsregs pa'am bor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: lus 'di bsregs pa'am bor ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is not this body burned or discarded?

original: de ji ltar 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yin //
analyzed: de ji ltar 'gro ba dang 'ong ba yin //
translated: How can it go and come?

original: lus gzhan kho na ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i rnam pa can ni de'i tshe 'byung ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: lus gzhan kho na ma 'ongs pa'i srid pa'i rnam pa can ni de'i tshe 'byung ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because another body, which has the form of the future existence, arises at that time.

original: 'di ni sad pa'i lus las gzhan pha'i lus rmi lam na mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sad pa'i lus las gzhan pha'i lus rmi lam na mthong ba yin no //
translated: This is the body of the father, which is different from the body of the one who is awake, and which is seen in the dream.

original: de kho na la ji ltar 'pho ba yin zhen /
analyzed: de kho na la ji ltar 'pho ba yin zhen /
translated: How is there transference to that very one?

original: rmi lam lus kho na lta bu yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: rmi lam lus kho na lta bu yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no fault, because it is like the body in a dream.

original: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught:

original: skad cig ma'i rnam shes ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam pas dben pa'i dmigs pa ni de dang lhan cig pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i don byed par rnam par gzhag par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rnam shes ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rnam pas dben pa'i dmigs pa ni de dang lhan cig pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i don byed par rnam par gzhag par byed pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo dang 'gal bas ni ma yin no //
translated: The momentary consciousness is defined as the object that is devoid of the prior and subsequent aspects, and as the agent that apprehends the object as coexistent with itself, not as the agent that apprehends the object as contradictory with itself.

original: goms pas nye bar bskyed pa'i khyad par ni rang gi rigs la ltos pa ni de med pas dus gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: goms pas nye bar bskyed pa'i khyad par ni rang gi rigs la ltos pa ni de med pas dus gzhan la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The difference that is generated by practice is dependent on its own type, and is dependent on another time, since it is not present.

original: de ji ltar rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa ni mthong pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin la /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyur gyur pa de bzhin du brtag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa ni mthong pa'i rjes su 'brang ba yin la /
translated: Since it is to be imagined just as it is the cause, imagination follows after seeing.

original: mthong ba yang nyin zhag re re la rmi lam gyi lus kyang lus kyi bar du chod pa'i sad pa'i lus so //
analyzed: mthong ba yang nyin zhag re re la rmi lam gyi lus kyang lus kyi bar du chod pa'i sad pa'i lus so //
translated: And seeing is the waking body that is obstructed by the dream body, day by day.

original: de bzhin du 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu byung ba'i lus dag gi bar du 'byung ba ni yul gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di la yang 'jig rten 'di dang pha rol tu byung ba'i lus dag gi bar du 'byung ba ni yul gzhan yin no //
