translated: In the same way, here also, the bodies that arise in this world and the next are obstructed by other objects.

original: ji ltar yang gnyid log pa na dgag pa'i sems ni lus gzhan na sad pa'i sems la gzhan med kyang skyed byed yin pa de bzhin du skye ba gzhan gyi sems ni yul dang dus kyis bar du chod pa'i sems kyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang gnyid log pa na dgag pa'i sems ni lus gzhan na sad pa'i sems la gzhan med kyang skyed byed yin pa de bzhin du skye ba gzhan gyi sems ni yul dang dus kyis bar du chod pa'i sems kyi'o //
translated: Just as when one falls asleep, the mind of sleep arises from the mind of waking, even though the mind of waking is not different from the mind of sleep, so too, the mind of another birth arises from the mind that is separated by time and place.

original: de ltar yang yul thag ring po'i zla ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar yang yul thag ring po'i zla ba ni /
translated: In the same way, the moon in the skyüîΩappears in the water of a pond, but it is not the moon itself, for the moon is in the sky.

original: chu snod rnams kyi chu la bdag nyid snang bar byed la de ni gzugs brnyan yin par brjod kyi chu las gzhan pa nyid gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin te /üîΩthogs pa dang bcas pa dag ni gcig @265b la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid gser la dngul chu bzhin du dngos po gzhan yin la rang gi yul la gzugs 'dzin pa ni so sor snang ba dang 'gal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chu snod rnams kyi chu la bdag nyid snang bar byed la de ni gzugs brnyan yin par brjod kyi chu las gzhan pa nyid gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bo ni ma yin te / thogs pa dang bcas pa dag ni gcig @265b la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro // yang na thogs pa dang bcas pa nyid gser la dngul chu bzhin du dngos po gzhan yin la rang gi yul la gzugs 'dzin pa ni so sor snang ba dang 'gal ba yin gyi /
translated: The moon‚Äôs reflection is not different from the water, for the reflection is seen in the water.üîΩThe reflection is not the same as the water, for the tangible qualities of the two are different.

original: gzhan dang gzhan pa tsam gyis khas blangs par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan pa tsam gyis khas blangs par 'os pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The reflection is not different from the moon, for the reflection is not seen when the moon has set.üîΩThe reflection is not the same as the moon, for the moon is seen even when the pond is dry.

original: de la dbang po las 'das pa'i du ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang po las 'das pa'i du ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the smoke that is imperceptible.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: thogs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ni /
translated: It is not obstructed.

original: ri la sogs pa gang la yang thogs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ri la sogs pa gang la yang thogs pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is not obstructed by any mountain, etc.

original: gser la dngul chu lta bu ni phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser la dngul chu lta bu ni phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like mercury on gold, because it is subtle.

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ma mthong pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that its going and coming are not seen,

original: gang gi phyir srid pa bar do'i lus ni med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa bar do'i lus ni med pa kho na yin no //
translated: because the body of the intermediate being is not at all existent.

original: de lta yin yang skye ba snga ma'i mtha'i sems kyis skye ba 'di'i dang po'i sems thag ring ba yin yang gnyid log par rtsom pa'i sems kyis sad pa'i sems bzhin dang zla bas gzugs brnyan bzhin du bskyed ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don toüîΩ// yang na lus la me long la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin yang skye ba snga ma'i mtha'i sems kyis skye ba 'di'i dang po'i sems thag ring ba yin yang gnyid log par rtsom pa'i sems kyis sad pa'i sems bzhin dang zla bas gzugs brnyan bzhin du bskyed ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yang na lus la me long la sogs pa la /
translated: Even though that is so, the mind at the end of the previous birth produces the mind at the beginning of this birth, even though it is far away, just as the mind that is beginning to fall asleep produces the mind of one who is already asleep, and just as the moon produces its reflection.üîΩOr else, in the body,

original: lus kyi gzugs brnyan yod pa 'di //
analyzed: lus kyi gzugs brnyan yod pa 'di //
translated: this reflection of the body exists in a mirror, etc.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is seen in another in the same way.

original: gang gi phyir lus can yin yang phra pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus can yin yang phra pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is subtle, even though it has a body,

original: 'ga' zhig la lar thogs med de //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la lar thogs med de //
translated: it is unimpeded in some places.

original: ji ltar bum par chu bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu bzhin mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum par chu bzhin dang / gser la dngul chu bzhin mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is like water in a vase or quicksilver in gold.

original: 'grel ba mdzad pas ni phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas srid pa bar ma do ma mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: 'grel ba mdzad pas ni phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas srid pa bar ma do ma mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: The Subcommentary states that the reason it is not seen is because it is subtle, and so on.üîΩThe commentary refutes this by saying that it is not so, because it is not seen.

original: ma yin zhes bya bas 'gegs par byed pa yin te gang gi phyir ma mthong ba'i phyir de gzhan du yang rmi lam bzhin dang gzugs brnyan bzhin du srid pa gzhan mtshams sbyor ba rigs pa nyid kyis med pa'am ni srid pa bar ma'i lus yin par bstan
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya bas 'gegs par byed pa yin te gang gi phyir ma mthong ba'i phyir de gzhan du yang rmi lam bzhin dang gzugs brnyan bzhin du srid pa gzhan mtshams sbyor ba rigs pa nyid kyis med pa'am ni srid pa bar ma'i lus yin par bstan
translated: Since it is not seen, it is reasonable that it connects with another existence, like a dream or a reflection.

original: pa ni / 'on kyang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa ni / 'on kyang zhes bya'o //
translated: The commentary states that it is the body of the intermediate existence.

original: 'gal zhig tu 'gro bar 'dod pa'i sems lus med na 'gro ba'i yul thag ring por ji ltar 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: 'gal zhig tu 'gro bar 'dod pa'i sems lus med na 'gro ba'i yul thag ring por ji ltar 'gro ba yin /
translated: If the mind that wishes to go to another place does not have a body, how can it go to a distant place?

original: lus med pa nyid du 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus med pa nyid du 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to go without a body.

original: lus yod pa yin na thag ring por yang de 'gro ba kho nas /üîΩyul pa ta li pu tra nas /
analyzed: lus yod pa yin na thag ring por yang de 'gro ba kho nas / yul pa ta li pu tra nas /
translated: If the body exists, it would go even to a distant place.üîΩFor example, a person from the country of Pataliputra

original: yul p'a na di dang / ma thu rar 'gro ba lta bu yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: yul p'a na di dang / ma thu rar 'gro ba lta bu yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: goes to the country of Pandya or Mathura.

original: de ltar 'dir ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But it is not so here.

original: dus kyis bar du chod pa ni @266a * //
analyzed: dus kyis bar du chod pa ni @266a * //
translated: The interval is due to time.

original: gnyid kyis chod kyang sang ba na 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis chod kyang sang ba na 'byung ba'o //
translated: Even though sleep is an interval, it occurs the next day.

original: 'di la yul gyis bar du chod pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la yul gyis bar du chod pa bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, the interval due to place is taught:

original: gang zhig ni grong dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ni grong dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSome are in this village, some in that village, some in this country, some in that country.‚Äù

original: yul gyis bar du chod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yul gyis bar du chod par bstan pa ni /
translated: The interval due to place is taught:

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'di na 'dug pa nyid ces bya ba ste rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'di na 'dug pa nyid ces bya ba ste rgyun gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúSome are right here.‚Äù

original: rmi lam na ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But it is not so in a dream.

original: gang las gang du 'di 'gro ba de dag gi par na lus dang sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las gang du 'di 'gro ba de dag gi par na lus dang sems kyi rgyud dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The continuum of body and mind is not perceived between where one is and where one goes in a dream.

original: de med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: bag chags brtan po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags brtan po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no stable latent impression.

original: so sor snang bzhin pa'i gzugs brnyan med pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor snang bzhin pa'i gzugs brnyan med pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not because the reflected image that appears separately does not exist.

original: dmigs pa ni yod par brjod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni yod par brjod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it has been shown that the object exists.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam bzhin du 'pho ba ni 'jig rten pha rol tu 'byung ba mi bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam bzhin du 'pho ba ni 'jig rten pha rol tu 'byung ba mi bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like a dream, the arising of the other world is not false.

original: 'on te sad pa'i shes pa ni rmi lam du mthong ba las bzlog par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir des rtogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rnam shes kyi nus pa yin pa'i phyir de snang ba yin no snyam du sems pa la //
analyzed: 'on te sad pa'i shes pa ni rmi lam du mthong ba las bzlog par 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir des rtogs pa med pa'i bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ni rnam shes kyi nus pa yin pa'i phyir de snang ba yin no snyam du sems pa la //
translated: But if you think that the consciousness of the waking state is the opposite of what is seen in a dream, and that the manifestation of the non-conceptual nature of consciousness is the potentiality of consciousness, and that therefore it is that which appears,

original: sad pa'i so sor snang ba yang bdag nyid kho na'i ma yin te /
analyzed: sad pa'i so sor snang ba yang bdag nyid kho na'i ma yin te /
translated: we reply that the separate appearance of the waking state is not of that nature.

original: mi bden pa'i rmi lam du de las bzlog par 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mi bden pa'i rmi lam du de las bzlog par 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: For in the false dream, the opposite of that is seen to appear. This is shown by the following:

original: gal te snang ba gzhan thob pas //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te snang ba gzhan thob pas // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were the case that the appearance of something elseüîΩis the cause of the non-appearance of something else,

original: des na skye ba gzhan pa yang //
analyzed: des na skye ba gzhan pa yang //
translated: then the arising of another birth

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: would also be like that.

original: sad pa na mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sad pa na mthong ba'o //
translated: and when one awakens, one sees the absence of the object.

original: gal te bzung ba nyid du snang bzhin pa yang mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te bzung ba nyid du snang bzhin pa yang mi bden pa yin no //
translated: If the object that appears to be apprehended is not real,

original: bye brag med par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag med par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then there would be no difference between the two, because there would be no distinction between them.

original: gnyi ga yang gnyis ka la ltos pas bzlog pa nyid kyis phan tshun gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang gnyis ka la ltos pas bzlog pa nyid kyis phan tshun gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are dependent on the other, they are mutually exclusive, since one excludes the other.

original: gegs byed pa stobs mnyam pa dag ma yin nam /
analyzed: gegs byed pa stobs mnyam pa dag ma yin nam /
translated: But are not the two mutually exclusive states of equal strength?

original: rmi lam du mthong ba ni rgyu med pa yin te skyed byed med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdmigs par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir glo bur du dmigs bzhin pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba ni rgyu med pa yin te skyed byed med pa'i phyir ro // dmigs par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir glo bur du dmigs bzhin pa ni /
translated: The object seen in a dream is without a cause, because it is not produced.üîΩThe object that appears suddenly without the sense faculties that perceive it

original: sad pa na mthong ba dang ldan pas mnyam pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: sad pa na mthong ba dang ldan pas mnyam pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: is not equal to the object seen when one awakens, because the object seen when one awakens is produced.

original: 'on te rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlan ni / sad pa'i bum pa la sogs kyang //
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam gyi zhes bya ba'o // lan ni / sad pa'i bum pa la sogs kyang //
translated: This is what you think.

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩskyed byed kyang ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / skyed byed kyang ngo //
translated: But the response is:üîΩThe pot, etc. that are seen when one is awakeüîΩare also like that.

original: de med kyang dmigs byed yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med kyang dmigs byed yod pa'i phyir /
translated: They are also without a cause, because they are not produced.üîΩAnd even though they do not exist, the sense faculties that perceive them exist.

original: de la dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the object of that,

original: rmi lam na yang bag chags la sogs pa dmigs byed yod pa kho na yin te de @266b med na med 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rmi lam na yang bag chags la sogs pa dmigs byed yod pa kho na yin te de @266b med na med 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: then even in a dream, the object of the latent potentialities and so on exists, because if it did not exist, it would not arise.

original: 'on te tshogs pa las ni 'byung bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te tshogs pa las ni 'byung bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúBut it is seen that it arises from a collection.‚Äù

original: skyed byed med par gnyis ka la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyed byed med par gnyis ka la yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same for both, that is, that there is no cause of arising.

original: de la skyed byed du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan res 'ga' ba'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de la skyed byed du rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan res 'ga' ba'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: The reason for conceiving of it as a cause is the object of the occasional

original: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in a dream.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa gnyid log kyang rmi lam bzhin du de rnams la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa gnyid log kyang rmi lam bzhin du de rnams la khyad par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: The uncommon [reason] is that, even though one is asleep, like a dream, there is no difference between them.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúBy another.‚Äù

original: thun mong pa kho na ri la sogs pa rnams ma yin nam /
analyzed: thun mong pa kho na ri la sogs pa rnams ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the common [objects] just the mountains and so on?

original: dmigs byed kyi tshogs pa dang bral bas long ba bzhin du 'ba' zhig dmigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dmigs byed kyi tshogs pa dang bral bas long ba bzhin du 'ba' zhig dmigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: The thought is that, because of being devoid of the collection of the object of observation, like a blind person, it is not observed alone.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba yang thun mong ba yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba yang thun mong ba yin te /
translated: The dream experience is common to all.

original: rmi lam gyi tshogs pa dang bral bas 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi tshogs pa dang bral bas 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the dream experience is not due to the absence of the dream experience.

original: de'i phyir de yang bden pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang bden pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that it is true, he says:

original: ji ltar 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrmi lam du mthong ba nyid kyis rgyu'i skyon gyis 'byung ba yin la des na mi bden pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba'i zhes bya ba'o // rmi lam du mthong ba nyid kyis rgyu'i skyon gyis 'byung ba yin la des na mi bden pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as in cyclic existence‚Ä¶‚ÄùüîΩSince the dream experience is due to the fault of the cause, is it not false?

original: sad pa na mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sad pa na mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the dream experience is due to the fault of the cause, because the dream experience is not due to the fault of the cause.

original: gang gi phyir gnyid dang bral ba'i sems ni rang rig pa yin par bdag nyid rig pa ni sad pa'i gnas skas su brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyid dang bral ba'i sems ni rang rig pa yin par bdag nyid rig pa ni sad pa'i gnas skas su brjod do //
translated: The mind free from sleep is self-awareness, and self-awareness is called the waking state.

original: de'i phyir de ni de'i gnod byed yin no snyam du sems pa ni sad par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de'i gnod byed yin no snyam du sems pa ni sad par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the waking state is the refutation of the dream experience.

original: gnyid dang bral ba rang nyid rig pa de ni rmi lam du mngon par 'dod pa la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni /üîΩrmi lam du yang sad pa'i blo //
analyzed: gnyid dang bral ba rang nyid rig pa de ni rmi lam du mngon par 'dod pa la yang mtshungs par bstan pa ni / rmi lam du yang sad pa'i blo //
translated: The dream experience is similar to the waking state, because the waking state is self-awareness free from sleep.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says:üîΩ‚ÄúThe dream experience is like the waking experience.‚Äù

original: bden pa dang / cig shos nyid ni da ltar yang gnyis ka la gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa dang / cig shos nyid ni da ltar yang gnyis ka la gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: and the other is not present in both now.

original: gsal bar snang ba'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba'i khyad par gyis //
translated: Because of the difference in the appearance of clarity,

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: as has been taught.

original: sad par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sad par 'dod pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The one who desires to be awake

original: sad par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs la rmi lam du mthong ba med do zhes bya bar shes pa yin te /
analyzed: sad par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs la rmi lam du mthong ba med do zhes bya bar shes pa yin te /
translated: knows that what was seen in a dream does not exist in the state of being awake.

original: des na mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi bden pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not real.

original: de'i phyir khyad par med pa ma grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par med pa ma grub po //
translated: Therefore, the non-difference is not established.

original: snga ma la ni gnod med na /
analyzed: snga ma la ni gnod med na /
translated: If the former is not impaired,

original: phyi ma skye ba grub pa ni snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma skye ba grub pa ni snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: the arising of the latter is established.

original: 'on te 'di ni mi bden no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni mi bden no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But this is not real.

original: gang gi phyir 'di med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa de @267a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa de @267a * //
translated: The cognition that this does not exist

original: ni de'i rmi lam na yang de dang bral pa'i dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ni de'i rmi lam na yang de dang bral pa'i dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: is the existence of an object that is devoid of that even in a dream.

original: goms pa med pa 'ga' zhig las ni de las byung ba de ma yin la /
analyzed: goms pa med pa 'ga' zhig las ni de las byung ba de ma yin la /
translated: For some who are not accustomed to it, it does not arise from that.

original: de'i phyir 'di la yang khyad par med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la yang khyad par med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the non-difference in this case is taught.

original: sad pa'i rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba sta /
analyzed: sad pa'i rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba sta /
translated: ‚ÄúAnd in the realization of the waking state‚Äù means:

original: de ltar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa kho nas so //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa nyid kyis ni med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa kho nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way, by the very realization‚Äù means: by the very realization that it does not exist.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni med pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means non-existence.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid de med pa nyid shes byar gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid de med pa nyid shes byar gnas pa yin na /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the characteristic of that‚Äù means by the nature of that, by the non-existence that is the object of knowledge.

original: de'i shes pa rgyu nyid las de 'byung ba ma yin te /üîΩthal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i shes pa rgyu nyid las de 'byung ba ma yin te / thal ches pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat knowledge does not arise from the cause of that‚Äù means:üîΩit is not the case that it arises from that, because that is absurd.

original: 'on te med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa las de nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te med do zhes bya ba'i shes pa las de nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is not that from the knowledge that it does not exist, then it is not that itself,

original: so sor snang ba gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer pa la gzhan yang mi bden no snyam pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: so sor snang ba gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes zer pa la gzhan yang mi bden no snyam pa'i bya ba ste /
translated: because the appearance of each is clear.‚Äù

original: bden las zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa yin la bden med de 'dir dgag pa yin zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa'o //
analyzed: bden las zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa yin la bden med de 'dir dgag pa yin zhes bya ba ni med par dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the truth‚Äù is a negative prefix, and ‚Äúthe truthlessness that is negated here‚Äù is a non-affirming negative.

original: de'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts nature‚Äù means:

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i gsal ba ni de dang 'gal ba ni dmigs pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i gsal ba ni de dang 'gal ba ni dmigs pa'i phyir gnyis ka yang mi rigs so //
translated: The clarity of what is seen in a dream is not reasonable because it is observed to be contrary to that.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable indicates an external negation. The phrase is not reasonable indicates an internal negation.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.

original: 'thad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa bstan pa yin la zhes bya bar mi 'thad do zhes bya bas ni med par dgag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa bstan pa yin la zhes bya bar mi 'thad do zhes bya bas ni med par dgag pa yin no //
translated: The phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.

original: snga ma la 'thad pa ni de las gzhan nyid ces bya ba'o //üîΩphyi ma la ni /
analyzed: snga ma la 'thad pa ni de las gzhan nyid ces bya ba'o // phyi ma la ni /
translated: The phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.

original: med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.

original: yun ring nas dmigs pa'i ltos pa tsam khyad par ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yun ring nas dmigs pa'i ltos pa tsam khyad par ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.

original: skyed mos tshal gyis zhes bya ba'i ste rang gi rnam pa nyid la phyir rol tu mngon par sems pa ni rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩji ltar mngon par sems pa la mi slu ba can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal gyis zhes bya ba'i ste rang gi rnam pa nyid la phyir rol tu mngon par sems pa ni rtog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // ji ltar mngon par sems pa la mi slu ba can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe phrase is not reasonable refers to the latter.üîΩThe phrase is not nonexistent refers to the latter.

original: gnod pa med par bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnod pa med par bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: The phrase is not tenable refers to the former.üîΩThe

original: rmi lam du mthong bas gnod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong bas gnod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The meaning is that it is not harmed by being seen in a dream.

original: gal te rmi lam du dmigs pa'i bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam du dmigs pa'i bum pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that the vase seen in a dream is not deceptive,

original: mi slu ba can nyid kho na yin zhes zer ba ni bkrus ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o //üîΩlan ni / rmi lam mthong ba bag chags pa'i //
analyzed: mi slu ba can nyid kho na yin zhes zer ba ni bkrus ma thag tu zhes bya ba'o // lan ni / rmi lam mthong ba bag chags pa'i //
translated: because it is not deceptive in the sense of not being a vase,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the response is:üîΩThe seeing of a dream is the result of a latent impression.üîΩThe seeing of a dream is the result of a latent impression.

original: rab tu dga' ba la longs spyod pa'o//
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la longs spyod pa'o//
translated: It is enjoyed in the Joyous.

original: @267b de la mi slu pa la gnod pa can med pa ni rnal ma yin no //
analyzed: @267b de la mi slu pa la gnod pa can med pa ni rnal ma yin no //
translated: There, the nondeceptive is the real, because it is not harmed by the nondeceptive.

original: ci las she no /
analyzed: ci las she no /
translated: What is it?

original: rmi lam du slar yang de nyid la 'am gzhan la yong ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam du slar yang de nyid la 'am gzhan la yong ngo //
translated: It is the very thing seen in the dream, or something else.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: rab tu dga' ba la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: it is enjoyed in the Joyous.

original: rig phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe kho na don byed par nyams su myong bas mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe kho na don byed par nyams su myong bas mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of knowledge, because it is not deceptive at that time, since it is experienced as functioning.

original: de'i phyir sad pa dang rmi lam yang mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gis tshad ma dang cig shos dag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir sad pa dang rmi lam yang mi slu ba dang cig shos dag gis tshad ma dang cig shos dag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the waking state and the dream state are distinguished as non-deceptive and deceptive, respectively.

original: rmi lam dang cig shos nyid la mthong ba nyid kyis de dag gis mi bden pa dang cig shos nyid du rnam par phye ba kho na yin na rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: rmi lam dang cig shos nyid la mthong ba nyid kyis de dag gis mi bden pa dang cig shos nyid du rnam par phye ba kho na yin na rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If the dream state and the waking state are distinguished as non-deceptive and deceptive, respectively, by perception itself, then what other cause of distinction is necessary?

original: rmi lam cig shos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam cig shos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The waking state and the dream state are distinguished as non-deceptive and deceptive, respectively, by perception itself.

original: so sor snang ba nyid ni de nyid dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba nyid ni de nyid dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere appearance of the object is not the cause of the distinction of the real and the unreal,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the two.

original: slu ba dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slu ba dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ma grub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The distinction of the non-deceptive and the deceptive is not established.

original: skyes mos kyis 'di la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skyes mos kyis 'di la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it unreasonable to say that the object is not perceived because it does not exist?

original: gang gi phyir med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni dmigs pa ma yin te //
translated: The object is not perceived because it does not exist.

original: med do zhes bya ba 'di dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba 'di dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-existence of the object is the objective support of that cognition.

original: nye bar brten pa dang bral na shes na cung zad skye mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: nye bar brten pa dang bral na shes na cung zad skye mi 'gyur snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it is thought that when one is separated from the object of apprehension, nothing whatsoever is produced,

original: 'di ni med ces shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni ste /
analyzed: 'di ni med ces shes pa ni zhes bya ba ni ste /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition that this is non-existent,‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis rtogs par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum na ma rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum na ma rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: and so on. The word ‚Äúelsewhere‚Äù means that it is not by direct perception, but by inference.

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni der snang ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa ni der snang ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The form, taste, etc. are cognized by direct perception that appears as that.

original: des na yod pa nyid ni gzhan las dben pa dang bral bas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na yod pa nyid ni gzhan las dben pa dang bral bas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, existence is not seen because of being separated from being isolated from another.

original: de des bden pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir shes pa yin te de la rung ba'i yul can rnams kyis mi shes kyang rang nyid shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de des bden pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir shes pa yin te de la rung ba'i yul can rnams kyis mi shes kyang rang nyid shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is cognized by that, because it is the nature of truth. Even though it is not cognized by those whose domain is suitable to it, it is cognized by itself.

original: de dang bral ba'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig ni mngon sum gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes pa ni bdag gi rnam pa'i skyed byed du mngon par sems pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral ba'i ngo bo 'ba' zhig ni mngon sum gyi rjes su 'brang bas shes pa ni bdag gi rnam pa'i skyed byed du mngon par sems pa yin no //
translated: The mere nature that is separated from that is cognized by the subsequent direct perception, and it is thought that it is the producer of the aspect of the self.

original: des na 'di'i dmigs bya ni mngon par sems pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'di'i dmigs bya ni mngon par sems pa ma gtogs pa gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the object of this is taught to be nothing other than the manifest mind.

original: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, in that way.

original: bag chags las byung ba yang de khyad par @268a * //
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba yang de khyad par @268a * //
translated: It arises from habitual tendencies.

original: gang gis nges pa can gyi phyi rol gyi ngo bo la mngon par rlom pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis nges pa can gyi phyi rol gyi ngo bo la mngon par rlom pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: It is thought, By what distinction is it certain that it is the manifest mind that is the external nature?

original: khyad par gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par gang gis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is said, By what distinction.

original: 'di'i mngon par rlom pa'i bya ba 'di phyi rol gyis byas pa'i phyir rol yul yin pas de la dmigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: 'di'i mngon par rlom pa'i bya ba 'di phyi rol gyis byas pa'i phyir rol yul yin pas de la dmigs pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The meaning is that because this activity of the manifest mind is done by the external, it is an external object, and therefore it is said that it is not an object of observation.

original: lan ni de la sems gtan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de la sems gtan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is the mind is directed there.

original: dran bzhin pa'i dgag bya la gtad pas ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed kyi dmigs pa med pas te /
analyzed: dran bzhin pa'i dgag bya la gtad pas ma rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed kyi dmigs pa med pas te /
translated: Because it is directed to the object of negation while being mindful, it is not confused. It is said that it is not an object of observation of the formative force of mindfulness.

original: gzhan dmigs pas rmi lam las khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dmigs pas rmi lam las khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: It is distinguished from dreams by the observation of something else.

original: 'dis sad pa yang yin la bdag nyid kyang yin pa de la mngon par rlom pa de 'di la yod pa des rmi lam gyis so //
analyzed: 'dis sad pa yang yin la bdag nyid kyang yin pa de la mngon par rlom pa de 'di la yod pa des rmi lam gyis so //
translated: This is the one who is awake and also the self, and he has the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in regard to that.

original: de lta bu'i dmigs pa'i bskyed bya shes pa de ni der rlom pa yin pa de 'dzin byed ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dmigs pa'i bskyed bya shes pa de ni der rlom pa yin pa de 'dzin byed ni ma yin la /
translated: The consciousness that is produced by such an object is the one that has the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in regard to that, but it is not the apprehender.

original: de'i med pa nyid 'dzin yid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i med pa nyid 'dzin yid 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind that apprehends the nonexistence of that is not the apprehender.

original: de'i ngo bo snang ba bzhin du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo snang ba bzhin du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not appear as if it were the entity that appears.

original: de nyid sad pa yin par dbye ba gang gis mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sad par mngon par rlom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid sad pa yin par dbye ba gang gis mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba la sad par mngon par rlom pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In what way is it asserted that it is the one who is awake?

original: nyal ba'i lus ni rmi lam na'o //
analyzed: nyal ba'i lus ni rmi lam na'o //
translated: The body that is lying down is in a dream.

original: gzhan la ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'i khyad par yin no //
translated: The difference is that in the other case, it is different.

original: ma nges pa nyid ni ma nges pa can no //
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid ni ma nges pa can no //
translated: The one who is uncertain is the uncertain one.

original: rjes su sgrub pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med kyang de'i rtsa ba dben pa dmigs pa yod pas /
analyzed: rjes su sgrub pa med pa ni rnam par rtog pa med kyang de'i rtsa ba dben pa dmigs pa yod pas /
translated: The one who is without subsequent confirmation is the one who is without conceptual thought. However, because the root of that is the existence of the object of perception,

original: de'i 'bras bu the tshom med par 'gro ba'i tha snyad ni /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu the tshom med par 'gro ba'i tha snyad ni /
translated: The expression ‚Äúit is certain that it will go to its effect‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ni rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir gtso bo ni rtsa ba yin te /
translated: is the characteristic of non-apprehension. Therefore, the principal is the root.

original: med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The conceptual thought ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is also valid knowledge because it is a subsequent cognition.

original: de dang bral ba tshad ma ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de dang bral ba tshad ma ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: But is not the absence of that valid knowledge?

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called a conceptual thought.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba ni skad cig ma dang / de ma yin pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam dang de ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba ni skad cig ma dang / de ma yin pa dang rnam par rig pa tsam dang de ma yin pa dag go //
translated: Mutually contradictory are the momentary and the non-momentary, the representation-only and the non-representation-only.

original: de'i phyir so sor snang bzhin pa ni rmi lam mam gzhan du yang brdzun ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor snang bzhin pa ni rmi lam mam gzhan du yang brdzun ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, what appears individually is not false, either in a dream or elsewhere.

original: de lta yin na mi bden pa nyid ji ltar yin /
analyzed: de lta yin na mi bden pa nyid ji ltar yin /
translated: If that is so, how can it be unreal?

original: tha snyad pa rnams ni rmi lam du mthong ba la mngon par rlom pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams ni rmi lam du mthong ba la mngon par rlom pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that those who are conventionalists are conceited about what they see in a dream is:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yin no @268b zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma nges pa nyid mi snang ba mi dmigs pa yin no @268b zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the non-observation of the non-appearance of the body is a non-observation of the body as a non-apprehension.üîΩThe body is the appropriation of the mind.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.

original: sems kyi nye bar len pa nyid lus yin la shi ba lus la yang yod pas /
analyzed: sems kyi nye bar len pa nyid lus yin la shi ba lus la yang yod pas /
translated: The body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.

original: lus ni gnas pa yin par sems //üîΩldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni gnas pa yin par sems // ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan nas da ltar ni gang gi tshe yang yod pa de'i tshe yang de nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan nas da ltar ni gang gi tshe yang yod pa de'i tshe yang de nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.

original: bzlog par dmigs pa ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bzlog par dmigs pa ma yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The body is the basis of the mind,

original: gzhan yang rig pa lus las tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rig pa lus las tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,

original: lus nye bar len pa ni tha mi dad pa yin na 'ji ba dang bum pa dag gis nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bya bzhin du mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can du smra ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rdul phra rab
analyzed: lus nye bar len pa ni tha mi dad pa yin na 'ji ba dang bum pa dag gis nye bar len pa dang nye bar blang bya bzhin du mngon par gsal ba'i sems pa can du smra ba po'i mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rdul phra rab
translated: because it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of the body.üîΩThe body is the basis of the mind,üîΩbecause it is the mind that is the appropriator of

original: kyis lus kyi phyogs kyi skyon ni yan lag can gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kyis lus kyi phyogs kyi skyon ni yan lag can gyi phyogs la yang mtshungs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: But if the whole is prior to the parts,

original: 'on te yan lan can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te yan lan can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then the whole would be without parts.

original: rdul phra rab rnams yod na yan lag can rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams yod na yan lag can rdul phra rab gnyis pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the atoms exist, then the whole, which is composed of two atoms and so on, arises gradually.

original: re zhig rdul phra rab gnyis pa ni rdul phra rab la gnas pa yin la rgyu la yon tan gyi rim gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i sems pa rdul phra rab kyi sems pa can du 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu las s'a lu'i khyad par bzhin du med pa
analyzed: re zhig rdul phra rab gnyis pa ni rdul phra rab la gnas pa yin la rgyu la yon tan gyi rim gyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i sems pa rdul phra rab kyi sems pa can du 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu las s'a lu'i khyad par bzhin du med pa
translated: First, the second atom is located in the atom. But the whole, which is endowed with the order of qualities of the cause, does not exist as the effect of the thought of the atom endowed with the thought of the atom, like the difference of rice.

original: kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just that.

original: de mi mthong ba'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin par ni mi rigs te mi mthong ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi mthong ba'i dbang gis 'byung ba yin par ni mi rigs te mi mthong ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable that it arises by the power of not seeing it, because non-seeing is not accepted.

original: de nyid kyis na myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du rnam shes ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du rnam shes ni ma yin te /
translated: By that very fact, consciousness is not like the power of intoxication.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu 'og ma rnams la yang rgyu'i rim gyis rdul phra rab 'dzin pa'i nye bar mtshon pa'i don nyid kyi phyir sems pa can brjod bya yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu 'og ma rnams la yang rgyu'i rim gyis rdul phra rab 'dzin pa'i nye bar mtshon pa'i don nyid kyi phyir sems pa can brjod bya yin no //
translated: Likewise, the terms ‚Äúsentient being‚Äù and ‚Äúliving being‚Äù are used to indicate the subtle particles that are the cause of the lower effects.

original: 'o na te de dag las skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis lus las sems pa can tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'o na te de dag las skyes pa zhes bya ba 'dis lus las sems pa can tha dad pa yin la /
translated: If the term ‚Äúborn from them‚Äù means that the sentient being is different from the body,

original: rgyu'i don ni nye bar len pa'i don du yin te sems pa can gyi lus yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i don ni nye bar len pa'i don du yin te sems pa can gyi lus yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then the meaning of ‚Äúcause‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúappropriator,‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúthe body of the sentient being‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúappropriated.‚Äù

original: phyogs 'di la yang de'i 'dzin byed med pa'i phyir de dag las so zhes 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs 'di la yang de'i 'dzin byed med pa'i phyir de dag las so zhes 'dzin pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: In this case, the term ‚Äúfrom them‚Äù indicates that the body is the appropriator of the subtle particles.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that were so,

original: shes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa ni rang dang gzhan gyi rig pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then consciousness would not be the awareness of itself and others.

original: rang rig pa ni gzhan rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni gzhan rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe awareness of itself is not the awareness of others‚Äù is as follows.

original: shes pa ni rang la yod par rig pa'i bya ba yin na /
analyzed: shes pa ni rang la yod par rig pa'i bya ba yin na /
translated: If the action of awareness is the awareness of itself,

original: ji ltar phyi rol la rnam par gcod pa yin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol la rnam par gcod pa yin tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like external objects, it would follow that consciousness would be divided.

original: gal te shes pa rang nyid kho na rig bya yin na gzhal bya yang de bzhin du @269a * //
analyzed: gal te shes pa rang nyid kho na rig bya yin na gzhal bya yang de bzhin du @269a * //
translated: If consciousness itself were the object of awareness, then the object of comprehension would be the same as the means of comprehension.

original: 'gyur ro // de'i phyir 'di ni rig byed gzhan yin pa kho nar rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de'i phyir 'di ni rig byed gzhan yin pa kho nar rig pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is known that consciousness is definitely known by another.

original: gsal byed mar me la yang de yod do snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gsal byed mar me la yang de yod do snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that a lamp illuminates itself and others,

original: 'on te gzhan rig pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan rig pa nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: then the object of awareness is like form and so on.

original: bde ba nyid kyang rig bya yin pa'i phyir gzhan kho nas yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba nyid kyang rig bya yin pa'i phyir gzhan kho nas yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: If you say that pleasure is the object of awareness, then it is definitely known by another.

original: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äútransformation.‚Äù

original: lan ni gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni gzhan du gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is called ‚Äútransformation.‚Äù

original: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa thams cad gzhan du gyur pa kho na rig pa yin pa'i phyir rnam shes med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa thams cad gzhan du gyur pa kho na rig pa yin pa'i phyir rnam shes med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because all blue, pleasure, and so on are definitely known by transformation, consciousness does not exist.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa gzhan don gyis go bas sam /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa gzhan don gyis go bas sam /
translated: The apprehender of pleasure and so on is understood by implication.

original: bdag dang yid phrad pa las byung ba'i mngon sum gyis rig pa kho na ma yin na ma snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bdag dang yid phrad pa las byung ba'i mngon sum gyis rig pa kho na ma yin na ma snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If it is thought that the self is not only known by the direct perception arising from the contact of the self and the mind,

original: gang la rig pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang la rig pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is known?‚Äù

original: rig bya nyid du thams cad snang ba yin na rig byed nyid du 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
analyzed: rig bya nyid du thams cad snang ba yin na rig byed nyid du 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba'o don to //
translated: The meaning is that if everything appears as the object of knowledge, it is contradictory that it is the instrument of knowledge.

original: 'on te reg par bye pa nyid kyis rig par byed pa ni de gang yin lus la sogs pa yang ma yin la bde ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te reg par bye pa nyid kyis rig par byed pa ni de gang yin lus la sogs pa yang ma yin la bde ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But if it is said that the instrument of knowledge is that which is known by contact, then it is not the body, etc., nor is it pleasure.

original: rig bya yin te /
analyzed: rig bya yin te /
translated: It is the object of knowledge.

original: rig bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of knowledge.

original: gzhan yang ma yin te /üîΩmi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma yin te / mi snang ba'i phyir ro zhes zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Nor is it anything else.

original: bde ba dang sdo sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdo sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it does not appear. This is taught by ‚Äúpleasure, pain, etc.‚Äù

original: snang ba ma yin par ni bde na mod kyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba ma yin par ni bde na mod kyi rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is not an appearance but is known,

original: rtogs bzhin pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs bzhin pa ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then what is being known is not a horn of a rabbit because it is not a sign.

original: med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: med pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it does not exist.

original: mig sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúeye, etc.‚Äù

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas mig la sogs pa'i byed pa'i ngo bo bdag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i blor brtags pa yin pa'i phyir rtags med pa yin par bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas mig la sogs pa'i byed pa'i ngo bo bdag gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i blor brtags pa yin pa'i phyir rtags med pa yin par bstan pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Thus he thinks that the reason is nonexistent.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang kho na 'bras bu'i shes pa'i rtags yin ba de kho na bsgrub byar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o // gang kho na 'bras bu'i shes pa'i rtags yin ba de kho na bsgrub byar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says, ‚ÄúThe reason is not established.‚Äù

original: de yang nus pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang nus pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: He also thinks that the reason is not established.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i bya ba yin na /üîΩres 'ga'i ngo bo yin la shes pa de phyis kyang mi 'byung ba des na dbang po la yod pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi mig la sogs pa'i bya ba yin na / res 'ga'i ngo bo yin la shes pa de phyis kyang mi 'byung ba des na dbang po la yod pa'am /
translated: If form and so on are the activity of the eye and so on,üîΩthen since the nature of the eye and so on is sometimes not the cause of consciousness, consciousness does not arise later. Therefore the activity of the eye and so on is either in the sense faculty or in the self.

original: bdag la yod pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin la de ni nus pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni dmigs pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la yod pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i ngo bor rtogs pa yin la de ni nus pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni dmigs pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus he thinks that the reason is nonexistent.üîΩHe also thinks that the reason is not established.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i 'gyur pa'i dbang gis @269b dmigs bya'i ngo bo rdul phra rab re rer 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i 'gyur pa'i dbang gis @269b dmigs bya'i ngo bo rdul phra rab re rer 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The demonstration that the nature of the object of perception changes due to the influence of the sense-faculty, etc., is as follows:

original: rdul phra rab re rer zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdul phra rab re rer zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe atom changes.‚Äù

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes pa 'byung ba kho nar dbang po rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang gis shes pa 'byung ba kho nar dbang po rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it just the arising of consciousness due to the influence of the sense-faculty, etc., that is the very understanding of the sense-faculty?

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir sngar ji lta ba'i ngo bo yin pa de lta bu kho na yin gyi de la khyad par ni med do snyam du sems pa la khyad par med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar ji lta ba'i ngo bo yin pa de lta bu kho na yin gyi de la khyad par ni med do snyam du sems pa la khyad par med par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, thinking that it is just the nature that it was before and that there is no difference in it, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no difference.‚Äù

original: khyad par med na shes pa yod kyang ci las gzugs rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: khyad par med na shes pa yod kyang ci las gzugs rtogs pa yin /
translated: If there is no difference, then even if consciousness exists, what is the understanding of form?üîΩBecause form is not the conception of the blind, ‚ÄúThis is form.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gzugs ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i long ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs ni gzugs so zhes bya ba'i long ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the seeing of blue, etc.

original: gzugs dang shes pa dag lhan cig pas skye ba kho na khyad par yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzugs dang shes pa dag lhan cig pas skye ba kho na khyad par yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the difference is just the simultaneous arising of form and consciousness.

original: lhan cig pa yin pa bzhin du lhan cig pa la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig pa yin pa bzhin du lhan cig pa la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between that which is simultaneous and that which is not simultaneous.

original: rang nyid la yod pa'i khyad par med na de rig pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid la yod pa'i khyad par med na de rig pa zhes bya ba ma yin no //
translated: If there is no difference in the nature of the object itself, it is not called cognition.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: lhan cig nyid na nus dpog cing //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig nyid na nus dpog cing // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When it is simultaneous, it is inferred.

original: rjes su dpog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir nus pa dmigs pa ni ma yin la khyad par med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i lhan cig pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir nus pa dmigs pa ni ma yin la khyad par med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i lhan cig pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is to be inferred, the capacity is not perceived. Because it is the nature of nondifference, the nonestablished simultaneity is not a reason. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rig bya nyid yin na rig byed med pa de'i phyir rang rig pa kho na rig par byed pa yin gyi sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa ni rig pa las gzhan pa ma yin la de nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin du rig bya nyid yin na rig byed med pa de'i phyir rang rig pa kho na rig par byed pa yin gyi sngon po dang bde ba la sogs pa ni rig pa las gzhan pa ma yin la de nyid rig pa'i bdag nyid
translated: Because it is thus to be cognized, it is not cognized. Therefore, only reflexive awareness is the cognizer. Blue, pleasure, and so on are not different from cognition. Because they are the nature of cognition itself,

original: yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: they are taught to be consciousness.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore.

original: de ni sems tsam yang yin la rang rig pa yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sems tsam yang yin la rang rig pa yang yin pa'o //
translated: It is mind only and it is reflexive awareness.

original: rnam shes kyi bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa ni rig pa can gyis ma rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam shes kyi bde ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa ni rig pa can gyis ma rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the NaiyƒÅyikas do not understand that pleasure and so on are consciousness?

original: sangs rgyas pas ni rtogs pa yin par de dag tsam gyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pas ni rtogs pa yin par de dag tsam gyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: The Buddhists say that they do understand that, but they express it in that way because they are not skilled in the use of language.

original: gsor ma mdung rnams khyer la shog ces bya ba bzhin du shes pa ni bde ba zhes bya bar nye bar btags par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la gzhi mthun pa ni gtso bo dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsor ma mdung rnams khyer la shog ces bya ba bzhin du shes pa ni bde ba zhes bya bar nye bar btags par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la gzhi mthun pa ni gtso bo dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Just as one says, ‚ÄúBring the spear and shield,‚Äù consciousness is designated as pleasure.

original: skyes bu sems pa zhes bya ba bzhin du gtso bo kho na yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu sems pa zhes bya ba bzhin du gtso bo kho na yin te /
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas think that pleasure is the primary nature, just as a person is the primary nature.

original: dbye ba ma dmigs pas gsor mdung can bzhin du nye bar btags par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro @270a * //
analyzed: dbye ba ma dmigs pas gsor mdung can bzhin du nye bar btags par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro @270a * //
translated: Since the divisions are not observed, just as the spear and shield are not observed, the designation is not observed.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ste rgyu'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas blang bya yin gyi phan tshun bsres pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dang cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba ste rgyu'i rjes su 'brangs nas khas blang bya yin gyi phan tshun bsres pa'i 'bras bu ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù indicates the distinction between the primary and secondary, the meaning being that the object is accepted as following from the cause, but not as a result that is a mixture of the two.

original: me long gzhag pa la bzhin du blo gcig pu la sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzugs brnyan 'pho ba nyid du snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: me long gzhag pa la bzhin du blo gcig pu la sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi gzugs brnyan 'pho ba nyid du snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: In a mirror, is not the reflection of another thing, such as blue, seen to move in a single cognition, as the mirror is placed down?

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa dang tha dad pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa dang tha dad pa kho na yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is thought that it is only different from the apprehender.

original: goms las de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: goms las de lta bur gyur pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is like that due to habituation.‚Äù

original: sngon po la sogs pa nyid sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rmi lam du rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ni gzhan dang gzhan du yang 'gyur gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa nyid sngon gyi bag chags kyi dbang gis rmi lam du rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ni gzhan dang gzhan du yang 'gyur gyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Blue, etc., itself, due to the power of prior latent propensities, is the nature of what is realized in a dream, and it is different from another, but the nature of what is realized is not different.

original: de yod kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it exists, there is no difference in the nature of blue, etc.

original: khyad par yod na yang dmigs pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang dmigs pa las gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'i don to //
translated: If there is a difference, it is not other than the object.

original: gal te sngon po'i khongs su gtogs pa yin pa de lta na ser po ni de ma yin pa'i phyir de rig pa ma yin la ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyi blo'i phreng ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te sngon po'i khongs su gtogs pa yin pa de lta na ser po ni de ma yin pa'i phyir de rig pa ma yin la ngo bo gcig pa nyid kyi blo'i phreng ba yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that since it is included in blue, yellow is not that, and therefore it is not cognized, and that it is a series of cognitions that are the same in nature, then:

original: gzugs sogs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs sogs gzhan dang gzhan dag tu // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Cognition of form and so on is not different.

original: sngon po rig pa bzhin du ser po rig pa yang bag chags ji ltar ba bzhin du 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po rig pa bzhin du ser po rig pa yang bag chags ji ltar ba bzhin du 'byung ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as blue is cognized, yellow is also cognized, arising in accordance with its latent imprints.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa kho na lus la brten pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa kho na lus la brten pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If you think that cognition without an object does not depend on the body, then:

original: rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is not without a support.

original: gzhan de rten dang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan de rten dang ngo //
translated: The other is its support and nature.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: des na bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúpleasure and so on.‚Äù

original: nye ba las bag chags sad pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dres pa yang dang po de ltar skyes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nye ba las bag chags sad pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i shes pa dang 'dres pa yang dang po de ltar skyes pa kho na yin no //
translated: The awakening of latent impressions from a near-death experience is also just the initial arising of a consciousness mixed with pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang 'dres par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't it unreasonable that it would be mixed with the pleasure, etc., of another?

original: gang gi phyir mngon du ma byas pa'i shes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon du ma byas pa'i shes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur bar mi rigs pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: It is not unreasonable that it would be mixed with a consciousness that is not manifest.

original: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad kyi rtags 'dzin pas rnam pa thams cad rig pa yin la goms pas ni gsal ba yin zhing de'i tshe mngon du byed pas na mngon sum gyi shes pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba dang / sngon po bzhin du 'dre bar byed par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam pa thams cad kyi rtags 'dzin pas rnam pa thams cad rig pa yin la goms pas ni gsal ba yin zhing de'i tshe mngon du byed pas na mngon sum gyi shes pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba dang / sngon po bzhin du 'dre bar byed par brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni goms pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is a cognition of all aspects because it apprehends the signs of all aspects, and when it is clear due to familiarity, at that time it is called direct perception because it manifests. At that time, it is said that it is mixed with the pleasure, etc., of another, like blue. The statement that it is mixed is taught in the line ‚Äúthrough familiarity.‚Äù

original: rnam par dbye ba 'di ci las yin zhes bya ba ni rig pa @270b las ni ma yin la rig bya tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'di ci las yin zhes bya ba ni rig pa @270b las ni ma yin la rig bya tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: This analysis is based on what? It is not based on awareness, nor is the object of awareness different.

original: khyad par ni gzhan khyad par du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni gzhan khyad par du byed pa yin no //
translated: The difference is that which makes a difference.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol zhes 'dzin pa las tha dad par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol zhes 'dzin pa las tha dad par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that external is grasped as different from the grasping.

original: med par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for nonexistent,

original: rig pa zhes bya ba'i byed pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba'i byed pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: this is to be connected with the activity called awareness.

original: ltos pa yod min na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ltos pa yod min na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: As for without dependence,

original: de'i ngo bo'i ltos ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo'i ltos ba'o //
translated: this is dependence on its nature.

original: don dam du ste /
analyzed: don dam du ste /
translated: ultimately,

original: mngon sum du snang bas so //
analyzed: mngon sum du snang bas so //
translated: because it appears as direct perception.

original: kun rdzob ni rtag pa can gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par dpyod pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa kho na rang gi rnam pa la phyi rol pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin gyi 'di la gzung ba ni med do //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni rtag pa can gyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis rnam par dpyod pa ste rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa kho na rang gi rnam pa la phyi rol pa nyid du 'dzin pa yin gyi 'di la gzung ba ni med do //
translated: The conventional is the activity of conceptualization, which is the analysis by the pride of the permanent. The activity of conceptualization is the grasping of externality in its own aspects, but there is no object apprehended here.

original: yod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid las khyad bar med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid las khyad bar med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it existed, it would follow that there would be no difference from its own characteristics.

original: brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brjod bya ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it is not the object of expression.

original: khu khrag gi lus ni nur nur po la sogs pa yin gyi myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du nus ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khu khrag gi lus ni nur nur po la sogs pa yin gyi myos pa'i nus pa bzhin du nus ba ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: The body of semen and blood is the kalala and so on, but it is not the potential, like the potential for intoxication.

original: rnam shes lus la brten pa'i phyir shes pa'i nus pas rten lus g-yo ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam shes lus la brten pa'i phyir shes pa'i nus pas rten lus g-yo ba yin gyi /
translated: The body moves due to the potential of consciousness, because consciousness is based on the body.

original: de med na shi ba'i lus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de med na shi ba'i lus ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: But when it does not exist, the body of the dead person does not move.

original: reg pa'i rnam shes khyad par can ni 'bad pa ste nang gi reg bya'i rnam pa'i shes nyid yin la de yang ka ba la sogs pa la med do zhes ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg pa'i rnam shes khyad par can ni 'bad pa ste nang gi reg bya'i rnam pa'i shes nyid yin la de yang ka ba la sogs pa la med do zhes ba'i don to //
translated: The special consciousness of touch is the effort, which is the consciousness of the internal form of touch. And that does not exist in pillars and so on.

original: shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tsam gyi rig bya yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi la yang skyon mtshungs pa ma yin nam 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gzhan gyi 'dod chags rig pas 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro snyam duüîΩsems pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa ni bde ba la sogs pa dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tsam gyi rig bya yin pa'i phyir khyed kyi la yang skyon mtshungs pa ma yin nam 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gzhan gyi 'dod chags rig pas 'dod chags can du 'gyur ro snyam duüîΩsems pa ni /
translated: Since consciousness is known as mere pleasure and so on, and mere pain and so on, is it not the same fault for you? Even the detached person would be attached because he knows the attachment of others.

original: khyed la yang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩphyi rol nyid shes pa'i bdag nyid yin par ni kho bo cag 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: khyed la yang zhes bya ba'o // phyi rol nyid shes pa'i bdag nyid yin par ni kho bo cag 'dod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: You also.

original: phyi rol la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las de dang 'dra ba'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las de dang 'dra ba'i shes pa skye ba yin no //
translated: We do not accept that consciousness has the nature of external objects, but rather that consciousness arises in the aspect of an external object from the aggregation of such things as external objects.

original: de'i phyir de nyid yin par mi 'gyur la bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid yin par mi 'gyur la bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dra ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the same as that, nor is it similar in all aspects,

original: phyi rol dang cig shos la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phyi rol dang cig shos la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par yod pa yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it has distinctions like external objects and other things.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚Äúby its aspect.‚Äù

original: 'on te yan lag can nyid shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid kyi rten yin gyi rdul phra rab dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te yan lag can nyid shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dmigs pa nyid kyi rten yin gyi rdul phra rab dag ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, because the possessor of parts is not different from consciousness, the object is the basis of perception, but not the atoms.

original: shes pa'i dmigs pa'i 'bras bu las tha dad pas de rtogs bya ma yin pa'i phyir dang rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir de rnams rdul pra rab rnams med pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni med pa nyid bya ba'o //üîΩmi shes @271a * //
analyzed: shes pa'i dmigs pa'i 'bras bu las tha dad pas de rtogs bya ma yin pa'i phyir dang rtogs pa gzhan med pa'i phyir de rnams rdul pra rab rnams med pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni med pa nyid bya ba'o // mi shes @271a * //
translated: Since the result of the object of consciousness is different from it, it is not to be realized, and because there is no other realization, it is shown that those subtle particles do not exist.

original: pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang brtag bya ma yin par rtogs par 'dod pas de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus ni gzhan du mi 'thad pas kyang brtag bya ma yin par rtogs par 'dod pas de bstan pa ni /
translated: Since it is not the nature of consciousness, the nature of the body is not tenable as something else, and therefore it is to be understood that it is not to be imagined.

original: phra rab rdul rnams lus kyi ni //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phra rab rdul rnams lus kyi ni // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The subtle particles are not the body.

original: lus kyi de'i rigs su rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: lus kyi de'i rigs su rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the body were to be understood as their type,

original: rdul phra rab re re nas rig par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re nas rig par byed par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: then each subtle particle would be cognized,

original: rnam shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam shes kyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be the nature of consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i lus kyi de 'dra ba'i rigs su ci'i phyir rtog pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lus kyi de 'dra ba'i rigs su ci'i phyir rtog pa yin zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Why is the body imagined to be that type?üîΩIt is said:

original: phra rab rdul rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phra rab rdul rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The nature of the subtle particles.

original: phyed snga mas ni rnam shes kyi bdag nyid kyi rdul phra rab kyis byas pa'i phyir zhes rdul phra rab rnams rtogs bya nyid du brjod la phyi mas ni byed pa po rnams so //
analyzed: phyed snga mas ni rnam shes kyi bdag nyid kyi rdul phra rab kyis byas pa'i phyir zhes rdul phra rab rnams rtogs bya nyid du brjod la phyi mas ni byed pa po rnams so //
