translated: The first half states that the atoms are the objects of knowledge, since they are made of the atoms which are the nature of consciousness. The second half states that they are the agents.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab bkag pas yan lag ma lus pa bkag nas de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rdul phra rab bkag pas yan lag ma lus pa bkag nas de'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, since the atoms have been refuted in this way, and since all the parts have been refuted, he says, ‚ÄúTherefore.‚Äù

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i skyon kho nas sun 'byin pa yin na bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pas ci dgos snyam du sems ba la /
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i skyon kho nas sun 'byin pa yin na bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pas ci dgos snyam du sems ba la /
translated: If the refutation is by the fault of movement and non-movement, what need is there for the obscured and the unobscured, etc.?

original: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rdzas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi rang bzhin gyi rdzas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe nature of the whole, the substance,‚Äù etc.

original: phrad pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i 'du ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i 'du ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be the cause of the conjunction, etc.

original: bya ba can zhes bya ba ni yan lag can bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba can zhes bya ba ni yan lag can bsgribs pa na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe possessor‚Äù is the obscured whole.

original: yon tan can zhes bya ba ni gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na zhes bya bas sun phyung bar bstan ba ni /
analyzed: yon tan can zhes bya ba ni gcig tshon gyis bsgyur na zhes bya bas sun phyung bar bstan ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has qualities‚Äù is the one who is ‚Äúcolored by one color.‚Äù

original: tshon gyis bsgyur ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshon gyis bsgyur ba la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is colored‚Äù is the refutation.üîΩOr, if the body is the appropriated of the mind, then it would exist even after death, because the appropriated would exist.

original: yang na gal te sems kyi nye bar len pa lus yin na shi ba la yang 'gyur te nye bar len pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rigs la nye bar len pa yan lag can ni nyes pa mi mnyam ba la sogs pas ldog pa yin
analyzed: yang na gal te sems kyi nye bar len pa lus yin na shi ba la yang 'gyur te nye bar len pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar rigs la nye bar len pa yan lag can ni nyes pa mi mnyam ba la sogs pas ldog pa yin
translated: The body that is the appropriator is refuted by the argument that it is not the same, etc.

original: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na yang tsher mas phug pa la sogs pas lus kyi yan lag can ldog pas 'chi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi rigs te 'tsho ba'i gnas skabs na yang tsher mas phug pa la sogs pas lus kyi yan lag can ldog pas 'chi bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable‚Äù means that even in the living state, the body that is the appropriator would be refuted by such things as being pierced by a thorn, and so death would follow.

original: snang bar mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag can khyab byed ni nye bar dmigs pa yod pa ni ma yin la de'i yod par tha snyad byed pa yang nye bar dmigs par byed pa ma yin gyi 'di yod do zhes bya ba bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: snang bar mngon par 'dod pa'i yan lag can khyab byed ni nye bar dmigs pa yod pa ni ma yin la de'i yod par tha snyad byed pa yang nye bar dmigs par byed pa ma yin gyi 'di yod do zhes bya ba bkag pa yin no //
translated: The pervader of the desire for appearance is not observed as existent, and the expression of its existence is not observed as existent, but rather the negation ‚Äúit exists‚Äù is observed.

original: gcig tu 'dzin par yul rags pa rnams ma yin nam /
analyzed: gcig tu 'dzin par yul rags pa rnams ma yin nam /
translated: Aren‚Äôt gross objects apprehended as one?

original: ji ltar nye bar dmigs pa snang ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar dmigs pa snang ba yin /
translated: How is it that they appear as observed?

original: 'phen sel med pa ni steng 'og la sogs pa'i cha tha dad kyang gcig / tu snang @271b ba yin gyi du mar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phen sel med pa ni steng 'og la sogs pa'i cha tha dad kyang gcig / tu snang @271b ba yin gyi du mar ni ma yin te /
translated: Without the exclusion of projection, the different parts of above and below, etc., appear as one, but not as many.

original: rgya khyon che bar dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya khyon che bar dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni che ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for observing a great extent is that it is great.

original: ji ltar nags kyi phreng ba rgyu mtshan ma yin pa ni so so bar mi 'dzin ba ma yin nam de bzhin rdul phra rab kyi rgyu mtshan las sna tshogs pa nyid du mtshon pa'i tha dad pa rnams kho na gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul yin par mi
analyzed: ji ltar nags kyi phreng ba rgyu mtshan ma yin pa ni so so bar mi 'dzin ba ma yin nam de bzhin rdul phra rab kyi rgyu mtshan las sna tshogs pa nyid du mtshon pa'i tha dad pa rnams kho na gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul yin par mi
translated: Are not the individual parts of a garland of forest flowers not apprehended as the cause of the garland? In the same way, the various representations of the cause of a subtle particle are only apprehended as one object.üîΩ

original: rigs te / sna tshogs pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs te / sna tshogs pa nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it that a garland of trees is not a reason for not apprehending them individually? In the same way, it is not reasonable that the various representations of the subtle particles are the object of the apprehension of unity, because they are apprehended as various.

original: nags la sogs pa la ni nye ba na gnas pas de 'dzin par yin no snyam du sems pa la yan lag can 'dzin pa yin pa la gnod pa can bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nags la sogs pa la ni nye ba na gnas pas de 'dzin par yin no snyam du sems pa la yan lag can 'dzin pa yin pa la gnod pa can bstan pa ni /
translated: If you think that the apprehension of a garland of trees and so on is the apprehension of the whole because they are apprehended by being located nearby, then to show the fault in that, it is said:

original: lag sogs g-yo na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lag sogs g-yo na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the hand and so on move, the whole is not apprehended.

original: gang la dmigs pas sna tshogs pa nyid du nye bar mtshon pa de la dmigs pas tha mi dad par shes pa yin la de'i dmigs pa yang yan lag rnams kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa tha dad pa g-yo ba
analyzed: gang la dmigs pas sna tshogs pa nyid du nye bar mtshon pa de la dmigs pas tha mi dad par shes pa yin la de'i dmigs pa yang yan lag rnams kho na yin gyi gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa tha dad pa g-yo ba
translated: If the whole is apprehended by observing the various representations, then it is known as undifferentiated by observing that. And since the object of that is only the parts and not anything else, the moving of the different hands and so on

original: yin na thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur te de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin na thams cad g-yo bar 'gyur te de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, then everything would move, because it would not be different from that.

original: khyab bya las tha mi dad pas khas blangs pa yin pas khyab byed du khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab bya las tha mi dad pas khas blangs pa yin pas khyab byed du khas len pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not different from the pervaded, it is accepted as the pervader.

original: g-yo bzhin pa las tha mi dad pa g-yo ba kho nar snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar mi snang na tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med do //
analyzed: g-yo bzhin pa las tha mi dad pa g-yo ba kho nar snang bar 'gyur ba de ltar mi snang na tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med do //
translated: If movement, which is not different from that which is moving, were to appear as movement, but does not appear in that way, then it would be different, and there would be no pervader.

original: phyogs gcig 'dzin pas kyang yan lag can 'dzin pa kho na yin par dgongs pa yin par nye bar mtshon par byed pa g-yo ba dang cig shos mthong bas dmigs pa ni de bzhin du tha mi dad pa la yang gcig tu ma dmigs na thams cad maüîΩdmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs gcig 'dzin pas kyang yan lag can 'dzin pa kho na yin par dgongs pa yin par nye bar mtshon par byed pa g-yo ba dang cig shos mthong bas dmigs pa ni de bzhin du tha mi dad pa la yang gcig tu ma dmigs na thams cad ma dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The intention is that even by apprehending one part, the whole is apprehended. This is illustrated by the example of movement and its opposite. If the observed object is not observed as one in the case of non-difference, then all would not be observed.

original: nye bar dmigs pa yang yin na tha dad pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med par bstan pa ni gcig ces bya ba ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa yang yin na tha dad pa'i phyir khyab par byed pa med par bstan pa ni gcig ces bya ba ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Even if observed, because of difference, there would be no pervader. This is shown by the line ‚Äúone‚Äù refers to movement.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bos gcig pa yin pa'i phyir so sor snang ba tha dad par nye bar mtshon par byed pa rang gi 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bos gcig pa yin pa'i phyir so sor snang ba tha dad par nye bar mtshon par byed pa rang gi 'dod pas bstan pa ni /
translated: Because of being identical in terms of the entity of the former and the latter, the individual appearances are indicated as different.

original: tshon gyis zhes bya ba ste tshon gyis bsgyur ba gcig snang ba na de dang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin pa bzhin du snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshon gyis zhes bya ba ste tshon gyis bsgyur ba gcig snang ba na de dang tha mi dad pa yang ma yin pa bzhin du snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The statement of one‚Äôs assertion is ‚Äúthe color,‚Äù etc. When one appearance is transformed by the color, it is not different from that, but it appears as if it were.

original: tha mi dad pa khyab bya yin na ni der snang ba yod na ni snang ba'i khyab byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa khyab bya yin na ni der snang ba yod na ni snang ba'i khyab byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nondifference is the pervaded, then if the appearance exists, it would be the pervader of the appearance.

original: de med na yang khyab bya dang tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na yang khyab bya dang tha dad pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, then the pervaded would not be different.

original: 'on te yan lag rnams nyid g-yo ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin na gzhan dmigs pa ma yin la sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul la tha dad pa med par shes pa ma yin no
analyzed: 'on te yan lag rnams nyid g-yo ba la sogs pa dang ldan pa yin gyi yan lag can ni ma yin na gzhan dmigs pa ma yin la sna tshogs pa nyid du dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yul la tha dad pa med par shes pa ma yin no
translated: But if the parts themselves have movement, etc., and the possessor of the parts does not, then the other is not observed. And the object that is characterized by the observation of diversity is not a cognition that is not different.

original: // @272a * //  g-yo ba dang bsgribs pa la sogs pa ni khyab bya la 'jug pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa nyid du cig shos tha dad pa las ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: // @272a * //  g-yo ba dang bsgribs pa la sogs pa ni khyab bya la 'jug pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa nyid du cig shos tha dad pa las ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since movement, obstruction, etc. are included in the pervaded, is it not the case that the other is not different in possessing that?

original: bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du blo dang sgra la sogs pa zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: bdag dang nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin du blo dang sgra la sogs pa zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that cognition, sound, etc. are like the self, space, etc.

original: gcig nyid yin nam khyab par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir de 'phyir so sor snang ba phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pas rgya che ba ni tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin nam khyab par mi rigs pa'i phyir dang ngo bo gzhan med pa'i phyir de 'phyir so sor snang ba phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pas rgya che ba ni tha dad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is not reasonable that they are one or pervasive, and because they have no other nature, the individual appearances do not mutually engage. Therefore, the meaning of ‚Äúdifference‚Äù is ‚Äúextensive.‚Äù

original: so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i rigs pa 'di kho na las tshogs pa gcig pa ste phrad pa ni tshogs pa can ma rtogs pa gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad pa'i rigs pa 'di kho na las tshogs pa gcig pa ste phrad pa ni tshogs pa can ma rtogs pa gsal ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: From this very reasoning of individual appearances, the single collection‚Äîthe contact‚Äîis taught to be the manifestation of the unrealized collection.

original: gcig yod min zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: gcig yod min zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no single one‚Äù is said.

original: rdul phra rab re re rig par thal bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re rig par thal bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It follows that each atom would be cognized,

original: re re nus pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: re re nus pa nyid yin na /
translated: if each one were capable.

original: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: cig car mang po 'byung bar 'gyur // zhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: many things arise simultaneously.

original: ji ltar snga ma bzhin zhes rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar snga ma bzhin zhes rjod par byed ce na /
translated: How can you say that it is as before?

original: skyon med de /
analyzed: skyon med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: de'i phyir thams cad sa bon dngos shes par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad sa bon dngos shes par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that everything is a seed in reality.

original: rdul phra rab rnams re re nas dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams re re nas dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The atoms are not perceived individually,

original: ches phra ba'i phyir ro 'dus pa la yang de rnams nyid 'di dag yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba med pas dmigs pa med pa nyid yin la rten nyid ni de'i nye bar len pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni /üîΩkhyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /üîΩdmigs bya ma yin pa sha za la sogs pa rnams 'dus nas yang dmigs byar mi rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ches phra ba'i phyir ro 'dus pa la yang de rnams nyid 'di dag yin pa'i phyir phul du byung ba med pas dmigs pa med pa nyid yin la rten nyid ni de'i nye bar len pa nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni / khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste / dmigs bya ma yin pa sha za la sogs pa rnams 'dus nas yang dmigs byar mi rung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because they are too subtle. Even when they are combined, they are not perceived, because they are not superior to the individual atoms. But they are the basis, because they are the substantial cause.

original: khyad par can rnams zhes bshad pa ni rigs pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhas bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can rnams zhes bshad pa ni rigs pa'i gnas skabs na yang zhas bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbecause there is no difference‚Äù is that even when the atoms are combined, they are not suitable as the object of perception, just as the individual atoms are not.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúthe special ones‚Äù is that even when the atoms are combined, they are not suitable as the object of perception, just as the individual atoms are not.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúthe special ones‚Äù is that even when the atoms are combined, they are not suitable as the object of perception, just as the individual atoms are not.

original: dbang yul zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dbang yul zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the phrase ‚Äúthe sense-object of the sense-faculty‚Äù is:

original: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is the object-field.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas pha rol pos smras pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya bas pha rol pos smras pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no difference,‚Äù which means that the sense-object is not non-apprehensible.

original: 'dus ba'i gnas skabs na ni rdul phra rab kyi yul ma yin te /üîΩsnam bu la snal ma'i tha snyad bzhin du'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes slar sel ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dus ba'i gnas skabs na ni rdul phra rab kyi yul ma yin te / snam bu la snal ma'i tha snyad bzhin du'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o zhes slar sel ba bstan pa ni /
translated: In the state of aggregation, the sense-object is not the atom,üîΩjust as a cloth is not the sense-object of the threads.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is again refuted by the phrase ‚Äúfor that very reason,‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab kyi tha snyad kyi yul nyid ni 'di kho na yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tha snyad kyi yul nyid ni 'di kho na yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which means that the sense-object is only the atom, because there is no other sense-object.

original: tha snyad gzhan med na de nyid kho na 'dor ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad gzhan med na de nyid kho na 'dor ba yang ma yin no //
translated: And when there is no other sense-object, the atom is not abandoned.

original: de'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa la gegs mi byed pa nyid 'on rdul phra rab yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar dmigs pa la gegs mi byed pa nyid 'on rdul phra rab yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe atom is not the sense-object‚Äù is that the atom does not obstruct the apprehension of the sense-object.

original: yang na sems kyi nye bar len pa 'byung ba yin na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te thal ches @272b ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sems kyi nye bar len pa 'byung ba yin na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams la yang thal bar 'gyur te thal ches @272b ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'on te lus kyi rnam pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir phyi rol la sems pa can med de khyad par med pa las kyang rdul phra rab nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te lus kyi rnam pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir phyi rol la sems pa can med de khyad par med pa las kyang rdul phra rab nyid yin no //
translated: But if you think that the mind does not exist externally because there is no difference in the form of the body, and that the mind is the difference,

original: de'i phyir yang rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so, because

original: sems rten pa 'dzin par yod pa nyid kyis yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: sems rten pa 'dzin par yod pa nyid kyis yin no snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: the mind is held to exist by the existence of its support.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: lus kyi rnam pa ni shi ba'i lus la yang yod pa'i phyir sems su thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa ni shi ba'i lus la yang yod pa'i phyir sems su thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The form of the body exists even in a dead body, so it would follow that the mind exists.

original: shi ba'i lus la yang lus kyi rnam pa'i khyad par med par ma grub pa'i phyir gang la de'i khyad par med ba kho nas rdul phra rab nyid yin la de'i phyir sems kyi dmigs pa kho na nyid kyis brten pa nyid ces bya ba ni ma yinüîΩno zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: shi ba'i lus la yang lus kyi rnam pa'i khyad par med par ma grub pa'i phyir gang la de'i khyad par med ba kho nas rdul phra rab nyid yin la de'i phyir sems kyi dmigs pa kho na nyid kyis brten pa nyid ces bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Because the body of a dead person is not established as a particular aspect of the body, it is not the case that the mere absence of that particular aspect is the atom itself. Therefore, it is not the case that the object of observation of the mind is the atom itself.üîΩIn response to that, the text says, ‚ÄúThe particular ones,‚Äù

original: khyad par can rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyad par can rnams zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: phul du byung ba can rnams med kyang phyi rol gyi 'dus pa rnams dbang yul nyid de dbang po'i gzung ba nyid dmigs bya nyid yin no /
analyzed: phul du byung ba can rnams med kyang phyi rol gyi 'dus pa rnams dbang yul nyid de dbang po'i gzung ba nyid dmigs bya nyid yin no /
translated: Even though the particular ones, the superior ones, do not exist, external collections are the objects of the sense faculties, the objects of the sense faculties are the observed objects.

original: de'i phyir shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid du rdul phra rab nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid du rdul phra rab nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the text is that the atom itself is not the object of observation of consciousness.

original: dbang po'i gzung ba nyid rdul phra rab rnams so so la med kyang 'dus pa nyid la sgra la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin nam snyam du thogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzung ba nyid rdul phra rab rnams so so la med kyang 'dus pa nyid la sgra la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa ma yin nam snyam du thogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúEven though the objects of the sense faculties are not the atoms individually, they are the collections of the atoms, just as sound and so on are.‚Äù

original: chen pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the effect of the great one.

original: chen po gcig ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chen po gcig ni de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: One great one does not act in that way.

original: gseng med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gseng med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: Because it is not perforated.

original: gal te rdul phra rab tsam yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab tsam yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were the size of an atom,

original: snang ba nyid las tha dad pa phul du phyung ba gzhan la sgrib pa la sogs pa rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: snang ba nyid las tha dad pa phul du phyung ba gzhan la sgrib pa la sogs pa rgyu ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it would not be the cause of obscuration, etc., because it would be different from light and would not be superior to it.

original: 'dis ni sgrib byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrib byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúit would not obscure.‚Äù

original: snang ba nyid phul du byung ba kho nas thogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba gzhan med kyang mthong ba yin par bstan ba ni /
analyzed: snang ba nyid phul du byung ba kho nas thogs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba gzhan med kyang mthong ba yin par bstan ba ni /
translated: Even though there is no other effect such as obstruction, etc., the effect of light is seen to be superior.

original: dngul chu gser sogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngul chu gser sogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Mercury, gold, etc.

original: da dul chu gser la zhugs pa ni rdul phra rab kyi bar du tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yan lag can yin la gser yang rdzas su ma brtsams pa yin te /
analyzed: da dul chu gser la zhugs pa ni rdul phra rab kyi bar du tha dad pa ma yin pa'i yan lag can yin la gser yang rdzas su ma brtsams pa yin te /
translated: Mercury that has entered gold is a partless whole, and gold is not composed of substances.

original: rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs byar mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir thogs pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs byar mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not seen as the objective support of that which possesses resistance, because it is not of the same class.

original: de la phul du byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phul du byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not seen as the objective support of that which possesses resistance, because it is not of the same class.

original: de bzhin du rdo bsregs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo bsregs pa yang yin no //
translated: It is like a burnt piece of wood.

original: de 'dis ni rdo dang 'bar ba'i rdzas nyid ma zhig pa thogs pa dang bcas pa 'dres pa yin zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de 'dis ni rdo dang 'bar ba'i rdzas nyid ma zhig pa thogs pa dang bcas pa 'dres pa yin zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: This shows that the substance of the fire and the wood is not destroyed, but that they are mixed together and possess resistance.

original: yan lag so so ba yin no yan lag re re 'dres pa ma yin te @273a * //
analyzed: yan lag so so ba yin no yan lag re re 'dres pa ma yin te @273a * //
translated: The parts are not mixed, but are separate.üîΩThe parts are not mixed, but are separate, because the parts are not woven together like needles, etc.

original: khab la sogs pas bzhin du yan lag rnams drub pa ma yin pa'i phyir thogs pa med par brjod du gal te rdul phra rab tsam so sor ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na 'dus pa ji ltar dbang yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: khab la sogs pas bzhin du yan lag rnams drub pa ma yin pa'i phyir thogs pa med par brjod du gal te rdul phra rab tsam so sor ni dbang po las 'das pa yin na 'dus pa ji ltar dbang yul yin zhe na /
translated: If the atoms are individually beyond the senses, how is the collection an object of the senses?

original: dbang sogs so sor zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbang sogs so sor zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The collection is not beyond the senses, etc.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i dbang po yang dmigs bya'i shes pa skyed par byed pa mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i dbang po yang dmigs bya'i shes pa skyed par byed pa mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sense faculty, though beyond the senses, is seen to generate the consciousness of the object.

original: 'on te dbang po la sogs pa so sor nus pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po la sogs pa so sor nus pa med kyi /
translated: But if you think that the sense faculty and so on individually lack the capacity to produce a result,

original: dngos po gzhan phrad pa yod na nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan phrad pa yod na nus par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and that they become capable of producing a result when they contact another entity,

original: 'dir thal mtshungs zhes bya ba ste /üîΩphul du byung ba ma skyes na phrad pa nyid du mi byed la gzhan ni de rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir thal mtshungs zhes bya ba ste / phul du byung ba ma skyes na phrad pa nyid du mi byed la gzhan ni de rgyu ma yin te /
translated: then this is a similar consequence.

original: des byas pa nyid yin na 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des byas pa nyid yin na 'di'i zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the distinctive feature does not arise, then it does not cause contact, and the other is not its cause, because if it were produced by that, there would be no connection between this and that.

original: de dang 'du ba las yin no zhes na /
analyzed: de dang 'du ba las yin no zhes na /
translated: If you say that it is due to the contact of that,

original: de nyid 'di rgyu nyid yin ba'i phyir rtogs pa bzhin du de yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid 'di rgyu nyid yin ba'i phyir rtogs pa bzhin du de yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then that is the cause of this, and therefore it would not be like the understanding.üîΩSince gold, mercury, and so on are mutually different, the subtle particles of sweat do not commence the result, and therefore they are not beyond the senses.

original: gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pas rngul phra rab rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa ma yin nam mngon sum pa ni don gzhan phrad pa yin la des khas mi len na rig pa medüîΩpar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: gser dang dngul chu la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pas rngul phra rab rnams ni 'bras bu rtsom pa ma yin pa'i phyir dbang po las 'das pa ma yin nam mngon sum pa ni don gzhan phrad pa yin la des khas mi len na rig pa medüîΩpar thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: If you think that the contact of another object is directly perceptible, and if you do not accept that, it follows that it is not cognized.

original: phrad pa snang ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phrad pa snang ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The so-called ‚Äúcontact‚Äù of the appearance is taught.

original: mthong ba'i yul phrad pa med na gang yang med pa'i phyir de rnams la de'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin te dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i yul phrad pa med na gang yang med pa'i phyir de rnams la de'i nus pa rjes su dpog pa yin te dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If there were no contact with the object of seeing, there would be nothing at all. Therefore, the power of those is inferred. The meaning is that the power of the object of the sense organ is called ‚Äúthe power of the object of the sense organ.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa med na phrad pa med la rlung dang nags phrad pa bzhin pa de rnams mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa med na phrad pa med la rlung dang nags phrad pa bzhin pa de rnams mngon sum du 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If there were no power of the object of the sense organ, there would be no contact. Like the contact of wind and a forest, it is taught that those become manifest.

original: ga la rtogs zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ga la rtogs zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Where is the realization?

original: mi snang ba nyid ni don gzhan phrad pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid ni don gzhan phrad pa nyid la gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: The nonappearance itself is not a reason for the contact with another object.

original: 'on kyang de rnams kyi de la nus pa bskyed pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang de rnams kyi de la nus pa bskyed pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the meaning is that it generates the power of those.

original: dngul chu dang gser la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba gzugs dang ro la sogs par snang ba phrad pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngul chu dang gser la sogs pa'i ngo bo snang ba gzugs dang ro la sogs par snang ba phrad pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa ni /
translated: The appearance of the essence of mercury, gold, and so on, appearing as form, taste, and so on, is taught to be in contradiction with contact.

original: ro gzugs la sogs phrad pa 'ga' //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ro gzugs la sogs phrad pa 'ga' //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: The taste, form, and so on, are in contact with some.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan par snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of the possession of form, etc.

original: yongs su brtags ba'i phrad pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su brtags ba'i phrad pa dang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: is contradicted by the contact of the imagined.

original: dro ba dang grang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dro ba dang grang ba lta bu'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is like the contact of heat and cold.

original: 'on te rten la yod pa de'i brten pa phrad pa la nye bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rten la yod pa de'i brten pa phrad pa la nye bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: But if the existence in the support is imagined as the contact of the supported,

original: khri la 'dug pa la khri'i sgra lta bu'o zhes zer ba na /
analyzed: khri la 'dug pa la khri'i sgra lta bu'o zhes zer ba na /
translated: like the word ‚Äúcouch‚Äù for one who is sitting on a couch,

original: nye bar btags pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar btags pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is ‚Äúimagined as the contact of the supported.‚Äù

original: khri dang de la 'dug pa kho na bzhin du rdul @273b phra rab dang de'i phrad pa dad so sor snang ba tha dad par 'gyur la de rnams rtag tu ma dmigs pa yin na gzugs bzhin du dmigs bya yin par nye bar btags pa ma yin no
analyzed: khri dang de la 'dug pa kho na bzhin du rdul @273b phra rab dang de'i phrad pa dad so sor snang ba tha dad par 'gyur la de rnams rtag tu ma dmigs pa yin na gzugs bzhin du dmigs bya yin par nye bar btags pa ma yin no
translated: Just as the couch and the one sitting on it are different, so the atoms and their contact would appear separately, and since they are never apprehended as such, they are not imagined as the objects of apprehension, like form.

original: // nya phyis la dngul bzhin du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa yang 'dis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: // nya phyis la dngul bzhin du lhag par sgro 'dogs pa yang 'dis bsal ba yin no //
translated: This also removes the superimposition of silver on a shell.

original: dkar po la ser po'i shes pa'i rigs pa yang tha dad par mthong ba med na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dkar po la ser po'i shes pa'i rigs pa yang tha dad par mthong ba med na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: If one does not see the difference between the cognition of white and the cognition of yellow, it is not reasonable to say that they are different.

original: blo tha dad par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: blo tha dad par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of this is taught by ‚Äúthe difference in cognition.‚Äù

original: gzugs bzhin du gcig ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir rngul phra rab 'dus pa tsam phul du byung ba skyes pa'i dbang po'i yul yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs bzhin du gcig ni bsags pa yin pa'i phyir rngul phra rab 'dus pa tsam phul du byung ba skyes pa'i dbang po'i yul yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as form is, the collection is merely an aggregation of subtle particles. The meaning is that it is the object of the sense faculty that has arisen from the supreme subtle particles.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa snang ba min pa'i phyir phrad pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang ldan pa snang ba min pa'i phyir phrad pa ni /
translated: Because it is not seen to possess form and so on, contact

original: snang ba 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba 'ba' zhig ma yin te /
translated: is not just appearance.

original: de las gzhan pa phreng ba la sogs pa'i tshad kyi yon tan gzhan mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa phreng ba la sogs pa'i tshad kyi yon tan gzhan mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because one sees other qualities of size, such as a long garland and so on,

original: phreng ring zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phreng ring zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the word ‚Äúlong‚Äù is stated.

original: nges pa can gyi phyogs dang yul rnams la dngos po rnams ma phrad pa yin yang phreng zhes bya ba ni grangs mang po nyid yin yang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin la nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa can gyi phyogs dang yul rnams la dngos po rnams ma phrad pa yin yang phreng zhes bya ba ni grangs mang po nyid yin yang tshad dang ldan pa ma yin la nye bar btags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: In regard to certain directions and places, things are not in contact, yet they are said to be in a row. Although there are many numbers, they are not measured and are not designated.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: This is because of the reasoning that has been taught.

original: de 'di phrad pa la sogs pa khas blangs nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang 'brel pa med pas de dang ldan pa'i shes bya gzhan min par yin lag can spangs pa brjod nas da ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i nges par snang bas gzhan gyi
analyzed: de 'di phrad pa la sogs pa khas blangs nas gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang 'brel pa med pas de dang ldan pa'i shes bya gzhan min par yin lag can spangs pa brjod nas da ni gzugs dang ro la sogs pa'i nges par snang bas gzhan gyi
translated: Having accepted contact, etc., he says that since there is no connection with qualities such as form, there is no other object of knowledge that possesses them. Having rejected the possessor of parts, he now says that since the appearance of form, taste, etc. is definite, the appearance of another

original: snang ba med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du brjod pa yin no //
translated: is not possible. The absence of an appearance is said to be the convention of non-existence.

original: grangs dang phrad dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grangs dang phrad dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Number, contact, etc.

original: thag nye ba'i dngos po gnyis dang de'i brda las byung ba'i sgra yang snang ba yin gyi phrad pa gzhan nam de'i sgra yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thag nye ba'i dngos po gnyis dang de'i brda las byung ba'i sgra yang snang ba yin gyi phrad pa gzhan nam de'i sgra yang ma yin no //
translated: Two proximate things and the sound arising from their sign also appear, but not another contact or its sound.

original: dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa las nus pa gzhan ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba pha rol po'i gzhung spong bar byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul nyid kyi nus pa las nus pa gzhan ni sgrib pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin no zhes bya ba pha rol po'i gzhung spong bar byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs theory is refuted in the following:

original: rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe atoms, etc.‚Äù

original: yan lag can gyis nus pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni de nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: yan lag can gyis nus pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni de nyid med pa ste /
translated: The connection of the power of the whole with another power is not tenable,

original: yan lag can gyi nus pa gzhan med na'o ;
analyzed: yan lag can gyi nus pa gzhan med na'o ;
translated: because the power of the whole does not exist.

original: gser dang bcas phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gser dang bcas phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the presence of gold, etc.‚Äù

original: phan tshun 'dres pa yin na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams ma 'dres pa yin par khas blangs pas rlung la sogs pa'i sgrib par byed pa'i snam bu la sogs skar khung lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres pa yin na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rdul phra rab rnams ma 'dres pa yin par khas blangs pas rlung la sogs pa'i sgrib par byed pa'i snam bu la sogs skar khung lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were mixed, the mass would be the size of an atom. Since it is accepted that the atoms are not mixed, the obscuring cloth, etc., such as wind, would be like a window.

original: gegs med pa ni @274a * //
analyzed: gegs med pa ni @274a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of obstruction‚Äù

original: phan tshun nad du ste khung du rlung la sogs pa 'jug pa gang dag gis de rnams de lta bur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun nad du ste khung du rlung la sogs pa 'jug pa gang dag gis de rnams de lta bur ro //
translated: means that the wind, etc., enter the holes between the atoms.

original: gang dag gis yan lag can skyed par byed pa yang phul du byung ba skye bar mi byed na mi srid par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang dag gis yan lag can skyed par byed pa yang phul du byung ba skye bar mi byed na mi srid par bstan pa ni /
translated: And if the cause of the arising of the whole does not produce the arising of the whole, it is impossible for the whole to arise.

original: reg pa med par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa med par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is shown by the words ‚Äúwithout contact.‚ÄùüîΩ  When the subtle particles, which are not seen to be in contact with each other, are situated in proximity, they act as obstructions, etc., just like other objects.

original: gang gi tshe yang phan tshun ma reg pa kho na ma mthong ba las nye bar gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams don gzhan bzhin du sgrib pa la sogs par byed pa yin la de'i tshe yang so so yin pa ni tshang ba'i phub ma gtor ba bzhinüîΩdu mi 'gyur ba kho nar bstan pa ni /üîΩrdul phran rnams ni 'dres min yang //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang phan tshun ma reg pa kho na ma mthong ba las nye bar gnas pa'i rdul phra rab rnams don gzhan bzhin du sgrib pa la sogs par byed pa yin la de'i tshe yang so so yin pa ni tshang ba'i phub ma gtor ba bzhin du mi 'gyur ba kho nar bstan pa ni / rdul phran rnams ni 'dres min yang //
translated: At that time, they are not mixed, just like a pile of various grains.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is shown by the words ‚Äúthe particles are not mixed.‚ÄùüîΩ  This is also seen from a distance, but the individual particles are not apprehended.

original: mthong ba 'di yang thag ring ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi so so ba nyid mi 'dzin gyi bar mtshams med par snang bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba 'di yang thag ring ba'i rgyu mtshan gyi so so ba nyid mi 'dzin gyi bar mtshams med par snang bar bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that they appear without interstice, it is said:

original: ji lta bar mtshams dang bcas pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta bar mtshams dang bcas pa //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAs if they had interstice.‚Äù

original: rab rib can gyis skra nyag re re mi 'dzin yang 'dus pa mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can gyis skra nyag re re mi 'dzin yang 'dus pa mi 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Those with eye disease do not apprehend individual hairs, but they do apprehend their collection.üîΩLikewise, the subtle particles of sweat are not visible, but they become visible.

original: de bzhin du rngul phra rab kyang mi snang ba kho na snang bar 'gyur zhes rgol bas gnod pa yang ma yin la dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i skyon yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rngul phra rab kyang mi snang ba kho na snang bar 'gyur zhes rgol bas gnod pa yang ma yin la dbang po rnams yul ma yin pa la 'jug pa'i skyon yang med do //
translated: The objection does not undermine our position, and there is no fault of the sense faculties engaging objects that are not their objects.

original: rab rib can la ni skra rnams dbang po'i yul nyid du dgos pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la ni skra rnams dbang po'i yul nyid du dgos pa can ma yin no //
translated: For those with eye disease, hairs are not necessary as objects of the sense faculties.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang rnal 'byor ba'i dbang po'i yul yin zhes tshig yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang rnal 'byor ba'i dbang po'i yul yin zhes tshig yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the words ‚ÄúThe subtle particles are also objects of the sense faculties of the yogi‚Äù exist,

original: de'i phyir gang gis 'dus pa 'dzin pa des gcig 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgos pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis 'dus pa 'dzin pa des gcig 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i dgos pa can ma yin no //
translated: it is not necessary to say ‚ÄúThat which apprehends the collection does not apprehend the individual.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs la brten nas yan lag can la 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid du sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi tshogs la brten nas yan lag can la 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid du sgrub pa ni /
translated: The definition of the collection in terms of the whole is established in dependence on the collection of subtle particles.

original: de la gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that is not a reason to refute that,üîΩthen we reply:

original: bya ba dang 'gal pa'i phyir sun 'don pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bya ba dang 'gal pa'i phyir sun 'don pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the refutation is contradicted by what is done?

original: rag las pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rtogs bzhin pa ni de nyid la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rag las pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas rtogs bzhin pa ni de nyid la gnod par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not tenable that dependence is different, what is being cognized does not undermine itself.

original: de med na rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na rang nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it does not exist, it does not exist by itself.

original: rigs pa brgya byen che ba yin gyi gcig ni rgya che ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rigs pa brgya byen che ba yin gyi gcig ni rgya che ba ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that a hundred reasonings are great, but one is not great?

original: yul sna tshogs pa la phan tshun rjes su mthun pa ni gcig ma yin no //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs pa la phan tshun rjes su mthun pa ni gcig ma yin no //
translated: It is not one that is mutually compatible with respect to various objects.

original: de ltar 'ga' yang rtog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'ga' yang rtog par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that any one conceives of it.

original: so sor snang ba nyid de lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor snang ba nyid de lta bu'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the individual appearances are of that kind.

original: des na 'jig pa ni blo la brten pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
analyzed: des na 'jig pa ni blo la brten pa'i phyir mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, destruction is not tenable because it depends on the mind.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kho na snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kho na snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because only the atoms appear.

original: mi snang na de la 'du ba can gyi rdzas snang ba yin par ci las yin /
analyzed: mi snang na de la 'du ba can gyi rdzas snang ba yin par ci las yin /
translated: If they do not appear, how could the substance that is composed of them appear?

original: yan lag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yan lag 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the apprehension of the parts.

original: mi gsal ba'i snang ba @274b la yang chu skyar du 'dzin pa la rgya che ba dmigs pas yan lag rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i snang ba @274b la yang chu skyar du 'dzin pa la rgya che ba dmigs pas yan lag rnams 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even in the case of unclear appearances, the parts are apprehended because the extensive object is apprehended as a crane.

original: des na mtha'i snang ba la yang yan lag snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rngul phra rab rnams ji ltar dbang po las 'das pa yin /
analyzed: des na mtha'i snang ba la yang yan lag snang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir rngul phra rab rnams ji ltar dbang po las 'das pa yin /
translated: Therefore, even in the case of the final appearance, the parts are just appearances, so how can the subtle particles be beyond the senses?

original: 'on te snang ba bzhin du de yan lag rnams kyang snang ba kho na'i phyir dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te snang ba bzhin du de yan lag rnams kyang snang ba kho na'i phyir dbye ba yin no //
translated: Or, just as the appearance is, the parts are also just appearances, so the division is made.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: de la yang yan lag yod na snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang yan lag yod na snang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there are parts there, the appearance would follow.

original: mi snang ba nyid yin yang dbye ba nyid ma gtogs pa'i phyir de kho na rngul phra rab rnams kyang dbang po'i yul nyid yin par ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid yin yang dbye ba nyid ma gtogs pa'i phyir de kho na rngul phra rab rnams kyang dbang po'i yul nyid yin par ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: Even though they are not appearing, the subtle particles are not impaired as objects of the senses, except for the division itself.

original: gseng med pa'i shes pa bzhin du gser med pa'i 'bras bu bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di nyid kyi yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gseng med pa'i shes pa bzhin du gser med pa'i 'bras bu bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu 'di nyid kyi yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Like the cognition without space, the result without space is shown to be the result of this:

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: So too, the other effects are also like that.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang phra ba nyid kyis dbye ba ma nges pas de ltar snang ba ni thams cad yul gcig la 'dres na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rdul phra rab cha shas can du thal bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang phra ba nyid kyis dbye ba ma nges pas de ltar snang ba ni thams cad yul gcig la 'dres na gong bu rdul phra rab tsam du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / rdul phra rab cha shas can du thal bar 'gyur bar rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, the atoms are not definite in their division due to their subtlety. Thus, it is understood that if they appear in that way and are mixed into a single object, it follows that they would be a mere atom in size and it follows that the atom would have parts.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Also, in this regard,

original: bu gcan rnams kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi dbang gis bug med par mthong ba ma yin gyi sgrib pa la sogs pa 'bras bu yang mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bu gcan rnams kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi dbang gis bug med par mthong ba ma yin gyi sgrib pa la sogs pa 'bras bu yang mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is not that the reason for the holes of the bamboo is seen to be without holes, but it is taught that the effect, such as the obstruction, is also seen.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ste yan lag can med kyang gnyi gas dngul chu dang gser la sogs pa sgrib pa la sogs pa byed par mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ste yan lag can med kyang gnyi gas dngul chu dang gser la sogs pa sgrib pa la sogs pa byed par mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: For example, although there is no possessor of parts, it is taught that both see the obstruction, such as mercury and gold, and so on.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or.üîΩüîΩ

original: gal te ma mthong ba'i dbang gis rdul phra rab 'dus pa ni ma 'byar ba yin yang so so ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba'i dbang gis rdul phra rab 'dus pa ni ma 'byar ba yin yang so so ba ma yin na /
translated: If the aggregation of atoms is not separated because of not being seen, then even the chaff, flour, beer, etc.

original: phub ma phye ma chang pa la sogs pas 'phangs pa yang de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phub ma phye ma chang pa la sogs pas 'phangs pa yang de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: that are thrown out by the winnowing basket, etc. would not be separated.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: rtogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe understanding, etc.

original: ma mthong bas sbyar ba'i rngul phra rab rnams ji ltar mthong ba kho nar rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma mthong bas sbyar ba'i rngul phra rab rnams ji ltar mthong ba kho nar rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The atoms of sweat that are not seen are just like those that are seen.‚Äù

original: gtor ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid kho na rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gtor ba dang cig shos la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sna tshogs pa can nyid kho na rtogs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The understanding of the various results of scattering, etc. is taught:

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus, form, etc.‚Äù

original: 'on te rten dang phrad pa las dbang po phrad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rten dang phrad pa las dbang po phrad par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the understanding of the sense faculties is not from contact with their supports.

original: 'on kyang phrad pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phrad pa kho na las yin no //
translated: But it is only from contact.

original: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na rten mthong ba med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa ni 'o na rten mthong ba med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In response to this, it is said: ‚ÄúIf the sense faculties are not understood from seeing their supports, etc.‚Äù

original: rdzas dang dbang po dang dngul la chud dang gser dag gi phrad pa ni phrad pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir rdzas dang yon @275a * //
analyzed: rdzas dang dbang po dang dngul la chud dang gser dag gi phrad pa ni phrad pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir rdzas dang yon @275a * //
translated: The contact of substance, sense faculty, and silver and gold is not contact.

original: tan dag la 'dir rtog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tan dag la 'dir rtog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because substance and quality are not imagined here.

original: de lta yin na khas blangs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na khas blangs pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If that is so, it is accepted. This is shown by

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúat that time.‚Äù

original: rgyu ma yin pa ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa ni 'du ba can gyi rgyu ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not a cause is not a cause of the assemblage.

original: dbang po dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la 'du ba las phrad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: dbang po dang ldan pa'i rdul phra rab rnams la 'du ba las phrad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: If the contact of the subtle particles possessing sense faculties is grasped from the assemblage,

original: de'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rdul dra rab rnams snang ba 'am 'bras bu gzhan byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag ni rtogs pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i rdul dra rab rnams snang ba 'am 'bras bu gzhan byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir yan lag ni rtogs pa'i yul ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then the subtle particles possessing that distinction would produce another effect, the appearance. Therefore, the part is not the object of cognition. This is shown by

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so, then‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ldan pa'i 'du ba 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ldan pa'i 'du ba 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the contact of possession is grasped,

original: phra ba'i yan lag gi phrad pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phra ba'i yan lag gi phrad pa yang 'dzin par 'gyur ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: then the contact of the subtle part would also be grasped. This is shown byüîΩ‚ÄúIf the contact of possession is grasped‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: phrad pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phrad pa thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: All contacts.

original: thag ring ba la yang rags pa mthong ba'i rjes su dpog pa ni dbang po dang phrad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thag ring ba la yang rags pa mthong ba'i rjes su dpog pa ni dbang po dang phrad pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to demonstrate that even in the case of distant objects, the perception of gross objects is inferred from the contact of the sense faculty with the object.

original: ma yin te rags pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te rags pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: No, because even gross objects.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba sel bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu nyid khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba sel bar byed pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to resolve the contradiction with the acceptance of the reason as the cause.

original: 'on te phrad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te phrad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if contact is the reason,

original: dbang po dang phrad pa la dngul chu dang gser phrad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de ci las yin pa bsams na /
analyzed: dbang po dang phrad pa la dngul chu dang gser phrad pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de ci las yin pa bsams na /
translated: then what is the reason for the contact of the sense faculty with mercury and gold?

original: gzhan med pas de kho na yin pa'i phyir de nyid skyon yin par bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan med pas de kho na yin pa'i phyir de nyid skyon yin par bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that it is because there is no other cause, then that is the fault, as it demonstrates that the reason is the cause.

original: 'du ba ni 'di la'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du ba ni 'di la'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is the assembly.

original: gal te 'bras bu rdzas yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rdzas yod pa yin na /
translated: If the effect is a substantial existent,

original: de dang dbang po'i dngos su 'brel pa yin pas brgyud pa'i ldan pa 'du bar rtogs pa la don med do //
analyzed: de dang dbang po'i dngos su 'brel pa yin pas brgyud pa'i ldan pa 'du bar rtogs pa la don med do //
translated: then it is directly related to the sense faculty, so it is pointless to understand the assembly as an indirect relation.

original: de lta yin na de bzhin rdul phra rab phrad pa yod na yan lag can du brtag pa des ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de lta yin na de bzhin rdul phra rab phrad pa yod na yan lag can du brtag pa des ci zhig bya /
translated: If that is so, then what is the use of postulating a whole when there is contact among the subtle particles?

original: de rnams kho na phrad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mngon sum pa rnams su 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams kho na phrad pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i mngon sum pa rnams su 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: They alone, which have the distinction of contact, are the manifest.

original: 'on te 'bras bu'i rdzas zhis bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu'i rdzas zhis bya ba ste /
translated: But if the substance of the effect is the action,üîΩthen the reverse is also the case.

original: bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams med na yang yan lag can du rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog pa la yang zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab rnams med na yang yan lag can du rtog pa yin te /
translated: Even if the subtle particles do not exist, the whole is imagined.

original: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no cause for differentiation.

original: gang yang yan lag can yod pa yin na rdul phra rab dang phrad pa dbang bo la mi srid do zhes bya ba de mi rigs te /üîΩyan lag can dang phrad pa la yang de rnams dang yul tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang yang yan lag can yod pa yin na rdul phra rab dang phrad pa dbang bo la mi srid do zhes bya ba de mi rigs te / yan lag can dang phrad pa la yang de rnams dang yul tha mi dad pa nyid kyis de yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, it is illogical to say that if the whole exists, contact with the subtle particles is impossible for the sense faculties.

original: yan lag can dang phrad pa ni //
analyzed: yan lag can dang phrad pa ni //
translated: Because even if there is contact with the whole, they are not different objects from those, and therefore they exist.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught in the line:

original: yan lag can dang par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag can dang par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Contact with the whole is not tenable.üîΩThe whole is grasped as one.

original: gang gi phyir de ni gzhan par dgag par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni gzhan par dgag par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: because it does not negate the other.

original: de'i phyir ldan pa'i dus kho na 'dzin par rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldan pa'i dus kho na 'dzin par rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of apprehending the conjunction itself.

original: drug po 'byar ba yin pa'i phyir yan @275b lag can bzhin du rngul phra rab dang phrad pas kyang dbang po dang phrad pa yin du chug kyang mthong ba la mi 'thad pa lung las sam gzhan las kyang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: drug po 'byar ba yin pa'i phyir yan @275b lag can bzhin du rngul phra rab dang phrad pas kyang dbang po dang phrad pa yin du chug kyang mthong ba la mi 'thad pa lung las sam gzhan las kyang ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Even if the subtle particles of the sense faculty come into contact with the subtle particles of the object, because the six sense faculties are conjoined, like the possessor of parts, it is still not tenable that they are apprehended, as has been explained from scripture and reasoning.

original: yang na rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, it is said that they are realized.

original: phrad pa las yang dbang po'i phrad pas ro dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i ldan pa'i 'du pa las dmigs byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pa las yang dbang po'i phrad pas ro dang gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyang de'i ldan pa'i 'du pa las dmigs byar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the contact of the sense faculty, taste and form, etc. are also objects of the conjunction of the sense faculty.

original: de ma mthong na de rnams la dbang po dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir de rnams ldan pa'i 'du ba las 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma mthong na de rnams la dbang po dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir de rnams ldan pa'i 'du ba las 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not seen, because they do not come into contact with the sense faculty, they would not be apprehended from the conjunction of the sense faculty.

original: de bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the line, ‚ÄúMoreover, if the sense faculty does not come into contact with the object...‚Äù

original: blo tha dad par zhes bya ba ni de yod pa dang med pa dag gis so sor snang ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: blo tha dad par zhes bya ba ni de yod pa dang med pa dag gis so sor snang ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent cognitions‚Äù means that they appear separately as existent and nonexistent.

original: gzhan gyi ni de las gzhan pa la nye bar btags pa yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni de las gzhan pa la nye bar btags pa yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The other is imputed to it, but it is just as it is, not otherwise.

original: gzhan du yang snang bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du yang snang bar bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it appears otherwise:

original: gzugs sam ro gang yin pa de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs sam ro gang yin pa de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very form or taste.‚Äù

original: gal te shin tu 'dres pa ni sna tshogs par mtshon pa nyid la gzhan du rtogs pa gang yin na rdul phra rab rnams kho na phra ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gal te shin tu 'dres pa ni sna tshogs par mtshon pa nyid la gzhan du rtogs pa gang yin na rdul phra rab rnams kho na phra ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If it is extremely mixed, it is just the representation of a variety. If it is understood otherwise, it would be just the subtle atoms, because they are subtle. It is taught:

original: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,

original: rdul phra rab rnams dngar ba'i khyad par las phreng ba la sogs la de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid mthong ba yang yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams dngar ba'i khyad par las phreng ba la sogs la de ltar rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid mthong ba yang yin te gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: the atoms are seen as the cause of such understanding in a garland, etc., due to the difference in arrangement, because there is nothing else.‚Äù It is taught:

original: gal te rdul phra rab ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is the atoms.‚Äù

original: dngar ba zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni /üîΩdngar ba'i khyad par tsam nyid kyi //
analyzed: dngar ba zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa ni / dngar ba'i khyad par tsam nyid kyi //
translated: The explanation of this ‚Äútaste‚Äù is:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúmerely the particular taste.‚Äù

original: de'i na de lta'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de'i na de lta'i zhes bya ba'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthus‚Äù in that is:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúin the same way,‚Äù and so on.

original: rtsod pa ni rab tu rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa ni rab tu rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDisputation‚Äù is to argue.

original: gzhi ni gang gi yan lag can gyi yul du mngon par 'dod pa dngar ba tsam nyid la rab tu rtsod pa tsam du rtogs pa nyid kyis mngon sum la sogs pa rtsa ba med pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin la de'i phyir de bzhin du
analyzed: gzhi ni gang gi yan lag can gyi yul du mngon par 'dod pa dngar ba tsam nyid la rab tu rtsod pa tsam du rtogs pa nyid kyis mngon sum la sogs pa rtsa ba med pa nyid gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin la de'i phyir de bzhin du
translated: ‚ÄúBasis‚Äù is the mere taste of the object that is the member of the syllogism. The mere argument is understood. The expression of the reason ‚Äúbecause of being without a root‚Äù refers to perception and so on. Therefore, in the same way,

original: phrad par khas blangs pas de dang der bstan nas da ni phrad pa nyid de la rung bar mngon par 'dod pa dang tha dad pas ma dmigs par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phrad par khas blangs pas de dang der bstan nas da ni phrad pa nyid de la rung bar mngon par 'dod pa dang tha dad pas ma dmigs par bstan pa ni /
translated: since contact is accepted, having demonstrated that in various places, now, in order to demonstrate nonobservation by way of difference with respect to that very contact that is accepted as suitable, he says,

original: gang yang brjod pa zhes bya ba ni phrad las shes na 'dir thal mtshungs zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: gang yang brjod pa zhes bya ba ni phrad las shes na 'dir thal mtshungs zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever is said,‚Äù and so on. If it is known from contact, then here, ‚Äúthe same reductio follows,‚Äù that is, it follows in that way.

original: phrad pa can 'ba' zhig ni nye ba nyid kyis phrad pa can gyi shes pa'i yul kho na yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa can 'ba' zhig ni nye ba nyid kyis phrad pa can gyi shes pa'i yul kho na yin no //
translated: Only the perceptible is the object of the cognition of the perceptible.

original: gnod pa med pa'i rnam rtog gi blo ni tha dad pa'i yul can yin la de'i phyir mngon sum yang tha dad par 'dzin pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir de ni gzhan @276a * //üîΩdu mthong ba las skyes pa ma yin la des ma skyes pa ni de lta yin yang 'di yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir de dngos po'i dbye ba'i
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i rnam rtog gi blo ni tha dad pa'i yul can yin la de'i phyir mngon sum yang tha dad par 'dzin pa yin no // gang gi phyir de ni gzhan @276a * // du mthong ba las skyes pa ma yin la des ma skyes pa ni de lta yin yang 'di yang de ltar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa la dngos po'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir de dngos po'i dbye ba'i
translated: The cognition of the imagination of what is unreal has a different object, and therefore perception also has a different object.üîΩBecause it does not arise from the seeing of something else, and what does not arise from that is not like that, even though it is like that, it is not like that.

original: phan byed ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di sgra zhes dngos po zhes bya ba 'di'i rtogs bya bstan pa ni /
analyzed: phan byed ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di sgra zhes dngos po zhes bya ba 'di'i rtogs bya bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe difference of the thing is not the cause of the cognition of the difference‚Äù is stated in the words ‚ÄúThe difference of the thing is not the cause of the cognition of the difference.‚Äù

original: ldan pa yin no zhes blos bzung ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa yin no zhes blos bzung ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthing‚Äù is understood to mean ‚Äúthe thing that is the cause of the cognition of the difference.‚Äù

original: gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par bstan pa ni /
translated: The difference of the state is stated in the words ‚ÄúThe difference of the state.‚Äù

original: der ni nye bar skye bar gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: der ni nye bar skye bar gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is born there‚Äù is the response.üîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is it not seen as existing in that state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúJust as that object is present in front of one,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:

analyzed: gnas skabs de ma gtogs par de byung na de dang ldan pa bzhin du so sor snang bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /

analyzed: ji ltar don de mdun gnas pa //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:

analyzed: gnas skabs kyi khyad par yang de ma gtogs par med par bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚Äù

original: rjes 'gro'i ldog pa dag las ni //
analyzed: rjes 'gro'i ldog pa dag las ni //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:

analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚Äù

analyzed: 'ba' zhig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:üîΩ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:

analyzed: 'byor pa las ma 'byor pa gzhan nyid yin par mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin nam /
