analyzed: dngos po gzhan kho na mngon sum gyis rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is there no difference in the state?‚Äù is:

original: gnas skabs gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the absence of the presence of that state,üîΩ‚Äù

original: dngos po nyid gnas skabs gzhan dang phrad pa yang yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po nyid gnas skabs gzhan dang phrad pa yang yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is also said that the thing itself comes into contact with another state.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: gcig nyid dang phrad pa la sogs pa can phyi rol gyi bsdus pa las ldog pa'i nus pa can nye ba dang bskyed pa yang bor nas gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang phrad pa la sogs pa can phyi rol gyi bsdus pa las ldog pa'i nus pa can nye ba dang bskyed pa yang bor nas gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: the external object that has the nature of unity and contact, etc., is not abandoned, but its capacity is turned away from.

original: de yang rang dbang du rnam rtog gi shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang dbang du rnam rtog gi shes pas 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not apprehended by an independent conceptual cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i don yin no //
translated: It is the object of a conceptual cognition.

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam rtog gis te tha dad pas so //
analyzed: rnam rtog gis te tha dad pas so //
translated: By a conceptual cognition, i.e., by a difference.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni med pa nye ba las ldog pa ni dngos po'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis so //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni med pa nye ba las ldog pa ni dngos po'i rjes su 'brang bas zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'dis so //
translated: The difference of things is turned away from non-existence, and it follows the thing, i.e., by this mode.

original: rnam rtog gi don la yang de ltar yin no //
analyzed: rnam rtog gi don la yang de ltar yin no //
translated: The object of a conceptual cognition is also like that.

original: bag chags las dngos po tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir tha dad par rnam par brtag pa'i don la rnam rtog gi shes pa yin gyi phyi rol gyi dbye ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin la gzugs gcig dang ro gcig ces bya
analyzed: bag chags las dngos po tha dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir tha dad par rnam par brtag pa'i don la rnam rtog gi shes pa yin gyi phyi rol gyi dbye ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin la gzugs gcig dang ro gcig ces bya
translated: because the latent impressions follow the different things, the object that is imagined as different is a conceptual cognition, not a cognition that posits external distinctions.

original: ba lta bu dang / rdza ma chag go zhes mya ngan byed pa dang / ma skyes pa'i @276b bu rnams rgan por gyur pa bzhin du yang mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba lta bu dang / rdza ma chag go zhes mya ngan byed pa dang / ma skyes pa'i @276b bu rnams rgan por gyur pa bzhin du yang mthong ba yin no zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: And it is seen that one says, ‚ÄúOne form, one taste,‚Äù and one grieves, ‚ÄúThe pot is broken,‚Äù and one sees, ‚ÄúThe children who were not born have become old.‚Äù

original: yon tan la sogs pa 'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa 'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúqualities, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po la med kyang rnam rtog gi tha dad par mthong bar byed par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po la med kyang rnam rtog gi tha dad par mthong bar byed par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that although it does not exist in things, it causes the seeing of the difference of conceptualization.

original: sgra dang shes pa zhes bya ba nas gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa zhes bya ba nas gnas par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is from ‚Äúsound and consciousness‚Äù up to ‚Äúit does not endure.‚Äù

original: gal te bag chags kyi dbang gis de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa don gyi yul lam yin na 'on te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags kyi dbang gis de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa don gyi yul lam yin na 'on te de lta na /
translated: If, due to the power of latent impressions, such conceptualization does not have an object, then how is it that

original: ji ltar don mchog tu 'dzin pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar don mchog tu 'dzin pa yin /
translated: How is it that it apprehends the supreme object?üîΩIt is that which is absent in the absence of the object, and it is also absent in the presence of the object.üîΩIt is apprehended by positive and negative concomitance.

original: bral ba dang ma bral ba la yang de nyid de la med kyang de kho na bral ba de la yod kyang med pa yin la zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas bzung ba yin la tha dad pa'i shes pa de lta bu'i bag chags las byung
analyzed: bral ba dang ma bral ba la yang de nyid de la med kyang de kho na bral ba de la yod kyang med pa yin la zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas bzung ba yin la tha dad pa'i shes pa de lta bu'i bag chags las byung
translated: The cognition that is different from that is not arisen from the latent potentialities of that kind.

original: ba ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa'i don de nyid de lta bu byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba ni de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa'i don de nyid de lta bu byed pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that the object that is not of that kind is the cause of that kind is

original: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is apprehended by positive and negative concomitance.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i dngos po kho na de lta bur mngon par 'dod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta bur gyur pa ma yin pa'i dngos po kho na de lta bur mngon par 'dod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: The statement that conceptualization is the mere desire for a thing that is not of that kind is

original: brtags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just an imputation.‚Äù

original: rnam par brtags pa nyid ni don ma yin la skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i tha dad par 'dzin pa'i dbye bas dngos po yod na yul gyi rnam par dbye bas 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu mi 'gyur bar
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa nyid ni don ma yin la skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i tha dad par 'dzin pa'i dbye bas dngos po yod na yul gyi rnam par dbye bas 'jug pa dang ldog pa dag tu mi 'gyur bar
translated: The meaning of the term is not a real thing, but if a thing exists, it is engaged through the classification of its object due to the differentiation of the apprehension of momentariness and non-momentariness, etc.

original: bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught:

original: rnam par rtog pa'i don tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i don tha dad pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The different objects of conceptualization.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi bag chags gang yin pa de las rnam par rtog pa yin la de'i yul yang sgra yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gi bag chags gang yin pa de las rnam par rtog pa yin la de'i yul yang sgra yin no //
translated: Conceptualization arises from the latent tendencies of positive and negative concomitance, and its object is also sound.üîΩIf the negative is also different from a thing, then the conceptualization that observes it would also definitely observe something different.

original: gal te ldog pa yang dngos po las gzhan pa yin na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tha dad pa kho nas dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la ldog pa yang log pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa yang dngos po las gzhan pa yin na de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang tha dad pa kho nas dmigs par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di la ldog pa yang log pa las zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, it is said, ‚ÄúThe negative is also the opposite of the positive.‚Äù

original: de nyid ni gseng gi dbye ba bsdus pa ma yin pa dang / mi ldan pa las ldog pa ni bsdus pa dang cig shos kyang de nyid yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa las tha dad pa las rnam rtog gi yul yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni gseng gi dbye ba bsdus pa ma yin pa dang / mi ldan pa las ldog pa ni bsdus pa dang cig shos kyang de nyid yin pa'i phyir mi ldan pa las tha dad pa las rnam rtog gi yul yin no //
translated: and that is the opposite of the non-possession of the collection of the parts, and the opposite of the non-possession of the collection of the parts is the collection itself, and the other is that, so the object of conceptual thought is different from the non-possession.

original: de bzhin du mi ldan pa dang cig shos la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi ldan pa dang cig shos la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes mjug sdud par byed pa ni /
translated: In the same way, the non-possession and the other should be applied.üîΩThe summary is:

original: de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And from that.

original: gzugs gcig ro gcig ces bsdus pa las bzlog pa ni rdzas kyi thun mong ba nyid dmigs nas de'i yon tan grangs su nye bar btags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs gcig ro gcig ces bsdus pa las bzlog pa ni rdzas kyi thun mong ba nyid dmigs nas de'i yon tan grangs su nye bar btags pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the opposite of the collection ‚Äúone form, one taste‚Äù is the commonality of substance, and that the number of its qualities is imputed?

original: de bzhin du rnga ma chag pa rjes su dran pas bzung ba yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnga ma chag pa rjes su dran pas bzung ba yin na /
translated: In the same way, if the memory of the broken rope is apprehended,

original: @277a * // mya ngan ni las yin pas nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: @277a * // mya ngan ni las yin pas nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: sorrow is imputed because it is the action.

original: nges par brtags pas bzung ba'i bul ni rgas pa byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: nges par brtags pas bzung ba'i bul ni rgas pa byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The salt that is apprehended by the definite examination is the agent of aging.

original: de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bstan pa ni /
translated: That is taught:

original: gal te 'dir ni btags 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te 'dir ni btags 'dod na //
translated: If it is asserted that it is imputed here,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.üîΩ

original: de lta yin na bsdus pa las ldog pa las gcig nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na bsdus pa las ldog pa las gcig nyid yin na ni /
translated: Thus, if it is so, then the exclusion of the included is one.

original: gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir yin la gnyi ga ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma dmigs pa'i phyir yin la gnyi ga ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is one, then it is not both, because the other is not perceived.

original: de lta yin na /
analyzed: de lta yin na /
translated: If it is so,

original: bsdus pa las ldog pa yin pas gcig pa nyid du nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsdus pa las ldog pa yin pas gcig pa nyid du nges par 'gyur te /
translated: then the exclusion of the included is ascertained to be one,

original: 'di ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir gsum nyid dam gcig nyid dag tu the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de tsam yin pa'i phyir gsum nyid dam gcig nyid dag tu the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is just that much. There would be no doubt about whether it is three or one.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it is not so,

original: bsdus pa ldog pa tsam gcig nyid yin la de'i khyad par ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsdus pa ldog pa tsam gcig nyid yin la de'i khyad par ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then the exclusion of the included is just one, and the exclusion of its particular is not.

original: gnyis pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par ldog pa yin pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang khyad par ldog pa yin pa ni /
translated: And this ‚Äúnot two‚Äù is the exclusion of the particular,

original: gsum nyid la sogs pa'i bsdus pa gzhan dang thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum nyid la sogs pa'i bsdus pa gzhan dang thun mong ba yin no //
translated: which is common to other inclusions such as three.

original: de'i phyir the tshom ni yon tan nam gzhan yang rung ba ldog par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom ni yon tan nam gzhan yang rung ba ldog par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: Therefore, doubt is not the exclusion of a quality or anything else.üîΩThis is taught:

original: de 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is accepted,

original: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag bzhin du nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa dag gis bzung ba'i dngos po thams cad la sgra dang shes pa ni chos can yod kyang bsdus pa ldog pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag bzhin du nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa dag gis bzung ba'i dngos po thams cad la sgra dang shes pa ni chos can yod kyang bsdus pa ldog pa la sogs pa rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Just as with a destroyed thing and an unarisen thing, all things apprehended by ascertaining and remembering cognition are the reasons for the terms and cognition, respectively.

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas la yang gcig nyid du 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du rdzas la yang gcig nyid du 'dzin par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as with form and so on, they are also grasped as substances and unities.

original: rgyu mtshan gang gis zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i bum pa dang bu la sogs pa rnams la nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pas bzung ba nyid ni nye bar gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang gis zhes bya ba ni zhig pa dang ma skyes pa'i bum pa dang bu la sogs pa rnams la nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pas bzung ba nyid ni nye bar gdags pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: By what reason? The reason for the designation of the ascertained and remembered things, such as a destroyed pot, an unarisen son, and so on, is the terms and cognition.

original: nye bar btags pa ste de nyid yin par sgro gdags pa ni ;
analyzed: nye bar btags pa ste de nyid yin par sgro gdags pa ni ;
translated: The designation is the superimposition of just that.

original: sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis shes pa de las gzhan sgro 'dogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gang gis shes pa de las gzhan sgro 'dogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: By what reason of terms and cognition is it designated? It is not designated by any other superimposition.

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid 'ba' zhig las de nyid las sgro 'dogs pa yin la de shes pa'i ngo bo dang de'i rjes su 'brang bar byed pa yang de'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid 'ba' zhig las de nyid las sgro 'dogs pa yin la de shes pa'i ngo bo dang de'i rjes su 'brang bar byed pa yang de'i sgra yin no //
translated: It is only a mere similarity to that which is superimposed upon that, and the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the nature of the cognition and to what follows after it.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang bsdus pa las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan las gcig nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang de'i sgra yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang bsdus pa las bzlog pa'i rgyu mtshan las gcig nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang de'i sgra yin no //
translated: In the same way, in regard to form, etc., the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the superimposition of oneness on the basis of a reason that is the opposite of the collection.

original: de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang de'i shes pa dag la tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par brjod par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa dang de'i shes pa dag la tha dad pa med kyang tha dad par brjod par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Although there is no difference between the superimposition of identity and the cognition of that, the difference is expressed by the addition of the word ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni de rgyu mtshan nyid du nye bar btags pa de dag gi rgyu yin zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni de rgyu mtshan nyid du nye bar btags pa de dag gi rgyu yin zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the cause of the designation of that as the reason. The explanation is:

original: gal te @277b zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te @277b zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that it is in regard to the ceased and the unarisen‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni gang gi sgrar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan kho na de nyid yin zhes mchog tu 'dzin par byed de rgyu ni rtags su bzung nas de rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du pho rtags nyid yin la rgyu ni rgyu mtshan khoüîΩna yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang gi sgrar bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan kho na de nyid yin zhes mchog tu 'dzin par byed de rgyu ni rtags su bzung nas de rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du pho rtags nyid yin la rgyu ni rgyu mtshan kho na yin no //
translated: Others hold that the reason for the term ‚Äúthat‚Äù is just that itself, and they hold it to be supreme. Just as a cause is taken as a reason and is said to be the object of inference, so too the sign of a male is the cause, and the cause is the reason alone.

original: zhig pa la sogs pa rnams la de'i sgra dang shes pa dag tu nye bar btags pa yin la gang zhig de la de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de kho na thams cad la 'gyur la ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan btags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: zhig pa la sogs pa rnams la de'i sgra dang shes pa dag tu nye bar btags pa yin la gang zhig de la de'i rgyu mtshan yin pa de kho na thams cad la 'gyur la ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gzhan btags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i
translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù and the consciousness of that are imputed to the state of having ceased and so on. Whatever is the reason for that is just that, and it is applied to all. What is the point of imputing another reason that is not seen?

original: don yin par 'chad do //
analyzed: don yin par 'chad do //
translated: This is explained to be the meaning of the term ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: btags pa ni de'i shes pa dag la tha dad pa med kyang rgyu dang de dang ldan pa nyid du brjod pa yin no bya ba dang de dang ldan pa dag gi tha dad par yongs su btags pas yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: btags pa ni de'i shes pa dag la tha dad pa med kyang rgyu dang de dang ldan pa nyid du brjod pa yin no bya ba dang de dang ldan pa dag gi tha dad par yongs su btags pas yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Although there is no difference in the consciousness of that, it is said that the imputed is the cause and that which possesses it. The explanation that it is imputed as a difference between that and that which possesses it is as follows.

original: thog ma med pa'i rtog pa ste thog ma med pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de la sgro btags pa ni byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i rtog pa ste thog ma med pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de la sgro btags pa ni byed pa yin no //
translated: The superimposition of that upon beginningless conceptuality, that is, beginningless latent propensities, is the superimposition of the agent.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.

translated: The superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The superimposition of the object of knowledge upon the object of knowledge is the superimposition of the object.üîΩThe

original: mthong na yang rmo bar 'dod pa'i mi la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa kho na phal pa dang cig shos yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong na yang rmo bar 'dod pa'i mi la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa kho na phal pa dang cig shos yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: If one sees, then the mere word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is taught to be the other, i.e., the principal, in relation to the man who desires to milk.

original: tha dad par ni ba lang gi lkog shal la yin la rmo byed kyi mi la sogs pa ni gtso bo'i tha dad khyad par yin no //
analyzed: tha dad par ni ba lang gi lkog shal la yin la rmo byed kyi mi la sogs pa ni gtso bo'i tha dad khyad par yin no //
translated: The difference is in the cow‚Äôs dewlap, and the man who desires to milk, etc., are the difference in the principal.

original: gal te ga las ni ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te ga las ni ma yin pa ste /
translated: But how is that?

original: gtso bo thams cad tha dad pa'i khyad par ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo thams cad tha dad pa'i khyad par ma yin te /
translated: Not all the principal is the difference,

original: kha cig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but only some of it.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid med na gtso bo dang cig shos kyi dbye ba ji ltar yin ji ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid med na gtso bo dang cig shos kyi dbye ba ji ltar yin ji ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: If there is no difference at all, how can there be a distinction between the principal and the other?

original: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan las tha snyad dag la de ltar dbye bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan las tha snyad dag la de ltar dbye bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not so, because the distinction is made in conventional expressions on the basis of the non-difference.

original: bsdus pa las rtog pa tsam la tha snyad 'dogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'am de dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bsdus pa las rtog pa tsam la tha snyad 'dogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa 'am de dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the conventional expressions are made in regard to the mere conceptualization of the collection, whether in regard to form, etc., or in regard to that which possesses them?

original: de'i sgra dag la bum pa dang rtsig pa'i sgra @278a * //
analyzed: de'i sgra dag la bum pa dang rtsig pa'i sgra @278a * //
translated: The sounds of pot and wall are not the same.üîΩ

original: dag bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i don nyid kyi yon tan dang yon tan can gyi sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dag bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i don nyid kyi yon tan dang yon tan can gyi sgra nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The words ‚Äúquality‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which has a quality‚Äù would not be words that are not different in meaning, like the words ‚Äúpot‚Äù and ‚Äúwall.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: The words ‚Äúwithout difference‚Äù teach this.

original: khyed kyis gcig pa nyid kyi grangs rjod par byed pa'i gcig gi sgra'i rdzas la de med kyang gzugs la sogs pa la yin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra'i rnam grangs ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyis gcig pa nyid kyi grangs rjod par byed pa'i gcig gi sgra'i rdzas la de med kyang gzugs la sogs pa la yin yang gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra'i rnam grangs ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though the substance of the word ‚Äúone,‚Äù which expresses the number one, does not exist in form and so on, the word ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on is not a synonym for the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gang las kyang ji lta ba bzhin du kho'i yang gzugs po dang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams mtshungs pa'i don la ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gang las kyang ji lta ba bzhin du kho'i yang gzugs po dang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams mtshungs pa'i don la ma yin te /
translated: This is because the words ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on are not equivalent in meaning to the word ‚Äúone‚Äù in the same way that the words ‚Äúbody‚Äù and ‚Äúpot‚Äù and so on are.

original: rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The words ‚Äúbecause of a different reason‚Äù teach this.

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can min yang //üîΩzhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can min yang //üîΩzhes bya ba'o ;
translated: Even though it is not a reason that is a different object,üîΩthe word ‚Äúform‚Äù and so on is not a synonym for the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: / gzugs la sogs pa la yang rdzas bzhin du grangs gcig pa nyid ni khyed kyi yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi rdzas las tha mi dad pa'i don nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: / gzugs la sogs pa la yang rdzas bzhin du grangs gcig pa nyid ni khyed kyi yang yon tan dang ldan pa nyid kyi rdzas las tha mi dad pa'i don nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Also, with regard to form and so on, the fact that they are one in number, like substances, is shown to entail the absurd consequence that they are not different from substances that possess qualities.

original: gal te der yang don gzhan na //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te der yang don gzhan na // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is also different in meaning,üîΩthen it is not the meaning of the word.

original: gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi rgyu mtshan gang yin gang gis tha dad ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra dag gi rgyu mtshan gang yin gang gis tha dad ma yin pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa ni /
translated: The reason why the words form and so on and pot and so on are not different is taught:

original: ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are different by the division of exclusion.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni khyad par gyi nus pa'i yul yin la bum pa'i sgra ni spyi'i nus pa'i yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra ni khyad par gyi nus pa'i yul yin la bum pa'i sgra ni spyi'i nus pa'i yul la yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the word form and so on is the object of specific potency, while the word pot is the object of general potency.

original: de ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na'i ngo bo ni nus pa yin te las ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ma yin pa las ldog pa kho na'i ngo bo ni nus pa yin te las ma yin pa la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Potency is the nature of only the exclusion of what is not that, not the object. It is taught that it is not different from the object, like nonaction and so on.

original: las rdzas min pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las rdzas min pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot a substance‚Äù meansüîΩthat the cause is not a substance.

original: gtso ba'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni der sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩde med na gang la sgro 'dogs pa yin des na nye bar btags pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: gtso ba'i rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni der sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir te / de med na gang la sgro 'dogs pa yin des na nye bar btags pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe reason for the primary nature‚Äù means that the primary nature is the object of reification.üîΩIf it did not exist, then what would be the object of reification? Therefore, the phrase ‚Äúnot a nominal designation‚Äù means that it is not a nominal designation.

original: / mthong ba med na ji ltar sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: / mthong ba med na ji ltar sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin zhes bya bar ni mi rigs te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it is not seen‚Äù means that it is not reasonable to reify it.

original: mthong ba med kyang dbang phyug rtag pa la sogs pa bzhin du rtog pa tsam gyis dmigs pa la sgro 'dogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba med kyang dbang phyug rtag pa la sogs pa bzhin du rtog pa tsam gyis dmigs pa la sgro 'dogs pa srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though it is not seen‚Äù means that, like ƒ™≈õvara, permanence, and so on, it is possible to reify an object by mere conception.

original: rtog pas byas pa'i khyad par tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtog pas byas pa'i khyad par tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa different attribute that is created by conception‚Äù meansüîΩthat the different attributes themselves are the primary nature.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin a different order‚Äù means that the meaning is ascertained in a different order.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid gtso bo yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du nges par bzung ba'i don du brjod nas gnas ji lta bzhin bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par nyid gtso bo yin no zhes rim pa gzhan du nges par bzung ba'i don du brjod nas gnas ji lta bzhin bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin accordance with the treatise‚Äù means that the treatise is explained in accordance with the meaning.

original: gzhan yang gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it is not seen‚Äù means that it is not reasonable to reify it.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though it is not seen‚Äù means that, like ƒ™≈õvara, permanence, and so on, it is possible to reify an object by mere conception.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúa different attribute that is created by conception‚Äù meansüîΩthat the different attributes themselves are the primary nature.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin a different order‚Äù means that the meaning is ascertained in a different order.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúin accordance with the treatise‚Äù means that the treatise is explained in accordance with the meaning.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid ci las gcig tu nges pa kho na yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par gtso bo yin no zhes bya ba nyid ci las gcig tu nges pa kho na yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: What is the certainty that the difference is primary? It is not so!

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par @278b gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang mtha' yod pa'i phyir snga ma snga mar nye bar btags pa zhes phyi ma phyi ma las gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par @278b gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba 'di yang mtha' yod pa'i phyir snga ma snga mar nye bar btags pa zhes phyi ma phyi ma las gtso bo yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: However, the difference is not primary, but rather the non-difference. This is because the former is designated in relation to the latter, and the latter is primary in relation to the former.

original: yon tan la sogs pa la 'am zhes bya ba 'dis med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa zhig pa la'am skyes la zhes bya bas med pa'i khyad par can brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa la 'am zhes bya ba 'dis med pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa zhig pa la'am skyes la zhes bya bas med pa'i khyad par can brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: By saying in the quality, etc. he shows that the term destruction refers to that which possesses the difference of non-existence, and by saying arisen he shows that the term destruction refers to that which possesses the difference of non-existence.

original: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the destroyed and the non-arisen means in the destroyed and the non-arisen.

original: gal te med pa'i khyad par la yang gtso bo yin yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi sgra dag rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te med pa'i khyad par la yang gtso bo yin yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi sgra dag rnam grangs nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the difference is primary in the case of non-existence as well, then the terms difference and possessor of the difference would be synonymous.

original: khyad par can tsam yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don dang tha dad pa med pa tha dad don zhes bya ba 'di 'chad par bstan pa ni gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can tsam yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don dang tha dad pa med pa tha dad don zhes bya ba 'di 'chad par bstan pa ni gal te khyad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthe difference of the referent‚Äù is explained in the following:

original: gal te sgra dag gi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa yin na 'di dag la gnas pa dag la ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba bzhin du gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur zhes zer ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha snyad pa yin la 'jug
analyzed: gal te sgra dag gi 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa yin na 'di dag la gnas pa dag la ba lang dang rta zhes bya ba bzhin du gzhi mthun par mi 'gyur zhes zer ba ni tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir tha snyad pa yin la 'jug
translated: If the reason for the application of the words is the difference, then the words ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù would not have a common locus, just as the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúhorse‚Äù do not.

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa sgra gang gi yin pa de de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan tha dad pa sgra gang gi yin pa de de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: The reason for the application of the words is the difference, and the referent of the words is the difference.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de tsam mo //
translated: The nature of the referent is just that.

original: snang ba ni snang bar byed pa nyid yin pa'o //üîΩgzhi mthun pa nyid ni sgra las byung ba yin yang don la byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba ni snang bar byed pa nyid yin pa'o // gzhi mthun pa nyid ni sgra las byung ba yin yang don la byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúAppearance‚Äù means that which appears.üîΩAlthough the common locus is the result of the words, it is not the result of the referent.

original: sngon po'i sgra ni yon tan tsam la 'jug pa yin gyi yon tan la 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po'i sgra ni yon tan tsam la 'jug pa yin gyi yon tan la 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúblue‚Äù applies to mere quality, but it does not apply to quality.

original: autpala'i sgra yang rig pa tsam la 'jug pa yin gyi de dang ldan pa la ni ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: autpala'i sgra yang rig pa tsam la 'jug pa yin gyi de dang ldan pa la ni ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: The term ‚Äúlotus‚Äù is applied to mere awareness, but not to that which possesses it.

original: 'on te yon tan gyis mtshon pa'i yon tan la 'jug pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te yon tan gyis mtshon pa'i yon tan la 'jug pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it is applied to the quality that is characterized by the quality,

analyzed: de lta na yon tan can de spyi nyid du mtshon pa ma yin te /
translated: then in that case, the possessor of the quality is not characterized by the universal,

analyzed: gzhi mthun pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no common locus.

original: khyad par las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par las yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is from the particular,

analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa gcig nyid dang ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then the phrase ‚Äúby the very same expression‚Äù is stated.

original: 'brel pa na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste rgyu mtshan dang byed pa dang rgyu rnams la thams cad la mang por mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
analyzed: 'brel pa na zhes bya ba ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste rgyu mtshan dang byed pa dang rgyu rnams la thams cad la mang por mthong ba yin zhes bya ba'i tshig las so //
translated: The word ‚Äúin‚Äù is the seventh case, the case of reason, and it is seen in all cases, such as the reason, the agent, and the cause.

original: 'du ba'i 'brel pa ni de ltar mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyis thams cad mtshon pa ni don gyi sgo kho na las yin no //
analyzed: 'du ba'i 'brel pa ni de ltar mtshon pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir gcig nyid kyis thams cad mtshon pa ni don gyi sgo kho na las yin no //
translated: The connection of inherence is the reason for the characterization, and therefore the characterization by the one of the all is only by way of the object.

original: de'i phyir dpyod pa kho nas de yang dpyad pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de'i phyir dpyod pa kho nas de yang dpyad pa yin par bstan pa ni ;
translated: Therefore, the statement that only analysis is the analysis of that is:

analyzed: don rnams gzhi mthun pa nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven the sameness of the basis of objects.‚Äù

original: yon tan ni yon tan can gyi khyad par mtshon par byed pa yang rang yongs su gcod pas mtshon par byed pa yin gyi gzhan mtshon par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan ni yon tan can gyi khyad par mtshon par byed pa yang rang yongs su gcod pas mtshon par byed pa yin gyi gzhan mtshon par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: A quality is that which indicates the difference of the possessor of the quality. It is indicated by the complete determination of itself, but it does not indicate another.

original: de'i phyir gnyis pa'i sbyor ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyis pa'i sbyor ba yin no snyam du sems pa ni 'brel pa yod pa yin na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the thought that it is the application of the second is: ‚ÄúEven if there is a connection.‚Äù

original: @279a * // gang las zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni /
analyzed: @279a * // gang las zhes bya ba 'di'i lan ni /
translated: The answer to ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù is:

original: 'du ba'i stobs kyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'du ba'i stobs kyis ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of aggregation.‚Äù

original: gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another is not possible.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di la ni tha mi dad par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba 'di la ni tha mi dad par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù is: ‚ÄúWithout difference.‚Äù

original: 'du ba la ni phrad pa bzhin du don dmigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'du ba la ni phrad pa bzhin du don dmigs pa ma yin te //
translated: In aggregation, the object is not apprehended as if it were a contact,

original: so so bar grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so bar grub par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would be established as individual.

original: de'i phyir yon tan dang yon tan can yang tha mi dad par dmigs pa yin na de dag la 'dus pa dag gi yon tan dang rigs dag la de ltar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gcig gi sgra don med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yon tan dang yon tan can yang tha mi dad par dmigs pa yin na de dag la 'dus pa dag gi yon tan dang rigs dag la de ltar dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir gcig gi sgra don med pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, if the quality and the possessor of the quality are observed to be non-different, then since they are observed in that way with regard to the qualities and the types of the aggregates, the term ‚Äúone‚Äù is meaningless.

original: gcig nyid las ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid las ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚ÄúFrom one.‚Äù

analyzed: 'on te sngon po dang autpala'i sgra dag la phan tshun yongs su gcod pa'i chos can la khyab pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the terms ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus‚Äù do not have the property of mutually excluding their referents,

analyzed: rang gi brjod bya yongs su gcod pa tsam la mthar thug pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni /

analyzed: 'on te sngo sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then this is taught by ‚ÄúBut if blue, etc.‚Äù

analyzed: autpala nyid 'du ba can gyi chos can sngon po'i sgra las rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If the referent of the term ‚Äúblue‚Äù is understood from the term ‚Äúlotus,‚Äù

analyzed: ji ltar dbye ba 'di yin zhes zer ba la 'du ba can te ; chos can ni autpala nyid kyis so //
translated: then how is this distinction made?üîΩThe referent is ‚Äúlotus,‚Äù

original: rtogs pa ni sngon po'i sgra las so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni sngon po'i sgra las so //
translated: and it is understood from the term ‚Äúblue.‚Äù

original: de'i mngon sum gyis sngon po'i chos rtogs pa na de'i 'du ba can autpala nyid kyang rtogs bya nyid du mthong bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i mngon sum gyis sngon po'i chos rtogs pa na de'i 'du ba can autpala nyid kyang rtogs bya nyid du mthong bar bstan pa ni /
translated: When the direct perception of that [blue] realizes the property of blue, it is seen that the very lotus that is conjoined with that [blue] is also to be realized.

original: ji ltar sngon po mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po mngon sum gyis zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: khyad par gyi mthar thug pa yin na yang sgra ngag gi gzhi mthun pa nyid du mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ni / sgras ni nges pa nyid kyi don //

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, Sound is the meaning of ascertainment...

original: blangs pa'i sngon po nyid chos can las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blangs pa'i sngon po nyid chos can las gzhan yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The very blue that is taken is not a different existent from the property-possessor,

original: mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: because it is not observed by direct perception.

original: aindra n'i la autpala sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: aindra n'i la autpala sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, The sapphire, the lotus, and so on...

original: de'i phyir cha tsam gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin te me bzhin ba'i cha nyid len pa yin na sgra don dang reg par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir cha tsam gsal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin te me bzhin ba'i cha nyid len pa yin na sgra don dang reg par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not the manifestation of a mere part. The meaning is that if the very part of the fire were taken as the manifestation, it would not come into contact with the meaning of the sound.

original: sngon po'i sgra las autpalar yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa na autpala'i sgra bzhin yod na autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon po'i sgra las autpalar yang nye bar 'jog par byed pa na autpala'i sgra bzhin yod na autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the word blue is applied to a lotus, then just like the word lotus, it would not be distinguished from what is not a lotus.

analyzed: de bzhin du autpala'i sgra la yang sngon po'i sgra yod na / sngon po ma yin pa las ldog pa yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i nus pa yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: In the same way, if the word blue is in the word lotus,üîΩthen just like the word lotus, it would not be distinguished from what is not blue. Thus, the capacity of both words would be the same.üîΩIf you think that,

original: gal te sngo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te sngo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: then the word blue would be meaningless,

original: gal te sngon po'i sgra autpala tsam gyis nus pa can bzhin no //üîΩsngon po'i sgra don med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sngon po'i sgra autpala tsam gyis nus pa can bzhin no // sngon po'i sgra don med par 'gyur la /

analyzed: 'on te de dang de ma yin pa la nus pa can @279b yin na ji ltar autpala'i sgra nye ba na ldog par 'gyur /
translated: But if it has the capacity to express both, then how could it be distinguished when the word lotus is present?

original: 'on te de nye ba dang ma 'brel ba yang skyes bus de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te de nye ba dang ma 'brel ba yang skyes bus de ltar rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Or if it is not related to that, then a person would have to posit it in that way.

original: de lta yin na skyes bu'i blo las byung ba'i khyad par la sogs pa nyid yin gyi sgra las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na skyes bu'i blo las byung ba'i khyad par la sogs pa nyid yin gyi sgra las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the difference is produced by the mind of a person, and so on, and is not produced by a word.

original: 'on te sgra yang blo de'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na de lta yin na blo sgrub pa ni 'di brjod bya yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sgra yang blo de'i rjes su 'jug pa yin na de lta yin na blo sgrub pa ni 'di brjod bya yin pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the word also follows that mind, then in that case, the establishment of the mind is the object of expression, and therefore external objects are not [the object of expression].

original: 'on te khyad par la yang sgra nyid nus pa can yin na thams cad la de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te khyad par la yang sgra nyid nus pa can yin na thams cad la de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the word itself has the power even with regard to the difference, then it would be the same for everything.

original: 'on te gzhan la yang nus na 'di la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la yang nus na 'di la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it has the power even with regard to another, then it would be the same for this [word] as well.

original: nus pa de dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa de dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not separated from that power.

original: gnas skabs la sogs pa yang 'dis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs la sogs pa yang 'dis bshad pa yin no //
translated: And this also explains the case of the states, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu ni gnas skabs pas de la med pa'i khyad par yang rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu ni gnas skabs pas de la med pa'i khyad par yang rtogs pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because a person is in a state, he also understands the difference that does not exist in that [state]. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi la yang sngon po ma yin pa log pas sngon po'i sgras rtogs par bya ba de nyid autpala'i sgra yang autpala ma yin pa las so ldog pa phan tshun khyad par med pas gzhi mthun pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi la yang sngon po ma yin pa log pas sngon po'i sgras rtogs par bya ba de nyid autpala'i sgra yang autpala ma yin pa las so ldog pa phan tshun khyad par med pas gzhi mthun pa med pa yin te /
translated: Since the opposite of non-blue is the very object that is to be understood by the word blue, and since the opposite of non-lotus is the very object that is to be understood by the word lotus, there is no common locus of the two, since the opposite of the one and the opposite of the other are not mutually exclusive.

original: khyad par dang cig shos yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir rang gi bag chags kyi dbang gis skyes pa'i blo nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par dang cig shos yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la de'i phyir rang gi bag chags kyi dbang gis skyes pa'i blo nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: If you think that it follows that the one would exist and the other would not exist, then the text says, ‚Äúdue to the power of one‚Äôs own latent propensities.‚Äù

original: bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa sngon po nyid dang cig shos tha dad par byed cing slar yang tha mi dad par byed pa de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid dam cig shos su 'gyur gyi dngos po tha mi dad pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa sngon po nyid dang cig shos tha dad par byed cing slar yang tha mi dad par byed pa de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid dam cig shos su 'gyur gyi dngos po tha mi dad pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the conception that arises from latent propensities makes blue and the opposite of blue different and then again makes them nondifferent, there is a common locus of the two, but not due to the nondifference of things.

original: rdzas lhung na de'i gzugs la sogs pa lhung ba yin gyi gzhan ma lhung bar mthong ba la gzhan du rdzas dang ldan par snang ba ni ma yin la gzhan lci ba nyid ni gzhan gyi ltung ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /üîΩthal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas lhung na de'i gzugs la sogs pa lhung ba yin gyi gzhan ma lhung bar mthong ba la gzhan du rdzas dang ldan par snang ba ni ma yin la gzhan lci ba nyid ni gzhan gyi ltung ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te / thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Heavy weight is not the reason for the falling of another substance, because that would be absurd.

original: de'i phyir lci ba nyid kyi phyir ltung ba yin pas gzugs la sogs pa byed pa dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir lci ba nyid kyi phyir ltung ba yin pas gzugs la sogs pa byed pa dang ldan par bstan pa ni /
translated: Therefore, because of heavy weight, falling is taught to be the activity of form, etc.

original: lci ba nyid yod pas na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te lci ba nyid bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ltung ba las lci ba nyid kyi kyang de ltar 'gyur na de ltar na thug pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: lci ba nyid yod pas na zhes bya ba'o // gal te lci ba nyid bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ltung ba las lci ba nyid kyi kyang de ltar 'gyur na de ltar na thug pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because heavy weight exists, falling exists.üîΩIf, like heavy weight, form, etc. were to fall because of heavy weight, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni de ltar ltung ba zhes ma yin la de'i bar gyis gzhan de lta bur gyur pa ma yin yang ltung bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni de ltar ltung ba zhes ma yin la de'i bar gyis gzhan de lta bur gyur pa ma yin yang ltung bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the intrinsic reality of form, etc. is not falling, and even though it is not another substance that is heavy weight, it is not the cause of falling.

original: de la rang nyid de ltar gyur pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir cher dpyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rang nyid de ltar gyur pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir cher dpyod pa yin no //
translated: Since it is not the case that one is like that, it is a great analysis.

original: yon tan ltung ba yin zhes 'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni @280a * //
analyzed: yon tan ltung ba yin zhes 'di mthong ba yin par bstan pa ni @280a * //
translated: It is seen that the qualities are a downfall.

original: btung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is shown by ‚Äúdrinking, and so on.‚Äù

original: gal te bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa ni /
analyzed: gal te bag chags las byung ba'i rtog pa ni /
translated: If the conception that arises from latent propensities

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par yang byed na /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par yang byed na /
translated: is also made different or not different,

original: ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur de'i dbang du byas pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'i ngo bo gzhan du 'gyur de'i dbang du byas pa yin na /
translated: how does the nature of an entity become otherwise?

original: de nyid rnam grangs nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de nyid rnam grangs nyid yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If one thinks that it is just a synonym,

original: dngos po tha mi dad kyang ldog pa'i bya ba'i dbang gis rtog pa bag chags byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po tha mi dad kyang ldog pa'i bya ba'i dbang gis rtog pa bag chags byung ba yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: it is taught that even though the entity is not different, the conception that arises from latent propensities is due to the power of the action of exclusion:üîΩ‚ÄúTherefore, by the difference of exclusion,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is said.

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù is said.

original: pho rtags yin te /
analyzed: pho rtags yin te /
translated: It is a male sign.

original: sgra dang shes pa'i bsams pas yin par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sgra dang shes pa'i bsams pas yin par bstan pa ni /
translated: It is taught that it is the thought of sound and consciousness:

original: sgra dang rtogs pa tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra dang rtogs pa tha dad pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Sound and the conception are different.

original: gal te ldog pa'i yul la rtog pa yin na ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i yul la rtog pa yin na ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba bzhin du /
translated: If the conception is of the object of exclusion, then just as it is said ‚Äúcow of a cow,‚Äù

original: ba yang thu yu zhes bya bar yang 'gyur gyi gzhi mthun par ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: ba yang thu yu zhes bya bar yang 'gyur gyi gzhi mthun par ni mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: it would be ‚Äúcow of a horse,‚Äù and there would be no common locus.

original: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What do you think?

original: de la re zhig ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa dngos po brjod pa nyid kyi rta dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyis tha dad bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig ba lang gi ba lang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa dngos po brjod pa nyid kyi rta dang rta la sogs pa rnams kyis tha dad bzhin du ste /
translated: In the case of ‚Äúcow of a cow,‚Äù etc., the thing itself is stated, and the horse, etc., are different.

original: yan 'gar bzhin du mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: yan 'gar bzhin du mtshon pa yin no //
translated: It is like the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù itself.

original: gang de la chos gzhan rnams kyis te dkar po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gang de la chos gzhan rnams kyis te dkar po nyid la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: When it is qualified by other properties, such as whiteness, etc.,

analyzed: khyad par byed pa ni rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid do //
translated: it is distinguished.

original: de'i phyir de las gzhi mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gzhi mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no common locus.

original: 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba 'di ni tha snyad pa'i ma yin pa ma yin nam don byed par mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sbyor ba 'di ni tha snyad pa'i ma yin pa ma yin nam don byed par mi ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Is this sort of application not non-conventional, because it does not show the functioning of the object?

original: de rnams don med pa can la tha snyad du byed pa ni ma yin te tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams don med pa can la tha snyad du byed pa ni ma yin te tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that they make a convention about what is meaningless, because they make a convention about what is meaningful.

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the reason why it is not meaningless is:

original: thos pa de tsam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thos pa de tsam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is merely the hearing of that.

original: tha snyad 'di yang don gyi mthar thug pa kho na yin gyi ;
analyzed: tha snyad 'di yang don gyi mthar thug pa kho na yin gyi ;
translated: This convention is only about the ultimate object.

original: ji ltar thu yul la 'jug pa'i ba lang gi brda ni khra mo la ba lang nyid kyi tha snyad mi byed kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar thu yul la 'jug pa'i ba lang gi brda ni khra mo la ba lang nyid kyi tha snyad mi byed kyang /
translated: Just as the convention of the word cow in the domain of cows is not made about a white cow,

original: ba lang gi sgra'i yul yod pa yin la de 'di la yang des tha snyad la 'di'i go skabs yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgra'i yul yod pa yin la de 'di la yang des tha snyad la 'di'i go skabs yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but the domain of the word cow exists, and it is said that the domain of that convention exists for that.

original: 'phangs pa med pa ni khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phangs pa med pa ni khongs su gtogs pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The absence of projection is the absence of inclusion.

original: gzhan kun ni chos gzhan te dkar po la sogs pa gang gis de de ltar yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan kun ni chos gzhan te dkar po la sogs pa gang gis de de ltar yin pa'o //
translated: The other is a different property, by which it is so.

original: mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i dngos por tha mi dad pa yin yang rtog pas bslang ba'i bsam pa kho nas tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i dngos por tha mi dad pa yin yang rtog pas bslang ba'i bsam pa kho nas tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Although it is not different from the entity apprehended by direct perception, it is different only by the thought generated by conception.

original: 'di la dpe ni /
analyzed: 'di la dpe ni /
translated: The example for this is

original: sor mo'i ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sor mo'i ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúhaving fingers.‚Äù

original: gzhi mthun pa'i yul nye bar bstan pa ni /üîΩsor mo ldan gyur @280b zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa'i yul nye bar bstan pa ni / sor mo ldan gyur @280b zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The demonstration of a common locus is

original: mi ldan pa las log pa tsam yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa las log pa tsam yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äúhaving fingers‚Äù because it is a mere negation of not having fingers.üîΩSince it is also said to be not separate from other phenomena, it is a common locus of those that are not other.

original: de dang mthun pa yang chos gzhan dang ma bral ba yin par brjod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa rjod par byed pa de lta bu rnams kyis gzhi mthun pa 'thob pa yin la chos can brjod par grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa yang chos gzhan dang ma bral ba yin par brjod pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa rjod par byed pa de lta bu rnams kyis gzhi mthun pa 'thob pa yin la chos can brjod par grags pa yin no //
translated: Since it is well known to express the subject,üîΩif it is said to include everything, is it not a synonym of other phenomena?

original: des thams cad khongs su gtogs par brjod na chos gzhan dang brjod pa rnams kyis rnam grangs su 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la don gcig brjod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des thams cad khongs su gtogs par brjod na chos gzhan dang brjod pa rnams kyis rnam grangs su 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhes zer ba la don gcig brjod kyang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since it is said that even though one meaning is expressed,

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag la /
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag la /
translated: The difference and non-difference

original: brjod bya gcig kho na yin la bral ba dang ma bral ba dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya gcig kho na yin la bral ba dang ma bral ba dag kho na yin no //
translated: have only one object of expression, and they are only separated and not separated.

original: gal te 'di kho na ci las she na /
analyzed: gal te 'di kho na ci las she na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is this?‚Äù

original: de ltar te rnam pa de nyid kyis byas pa ni rgan po rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar te rnam pa de nyid kyis byas pa ni rgan po rnams kyis so //
translated: The elders have done it in that way, that is, in that very form.

original: brda ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: brda ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The convention is established.

original: gang gi yin pa de de bzhin te gang gi phyir yin pa de'i phyir 'di khyad par yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi yin pa de de bzhin te gang gi phyir yin pa de'i phyir 'di khyad par yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is so is just that, and that is why this is the distinction. This is the meaning.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni ldog pa'i yul la chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag gi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rtog pas sprul pa yin par bstan nas ldog pa'i tha dad med kyang rtog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa'i 'jig rten gyi brda la
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pa ni ldog pa'i yul la chos can brjod pa'i sgra dag gi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rtog pas sprul pa yin par bstan nas ldog pa'i tha dad med kyang rtog pas byas pa'i tha dad pa'i 'jig rten gyi brda la
translated: The author of the commentary, having shown that the words expressing the subject in the domain of negation are also imagined differences and non-differences by conceptualization, says that even without a difference in negation, one should understand based on the worldly convention of difference created by conceptualization.

original: brten nas go bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don don gcig brjod pa'i zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: brten nas go bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don don gcig brjod pa'i zhes bya bas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is explained by ‚Äúhaving only one object of expression.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du ba lang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i tha dad yod pa can gyi yul zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha dad bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ldog pa'i tha dad yod pa can gyi yul zhes bya ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: Similarly, cow and so on, by different and so on, the difference of exclusion exists.  Object is the classification.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya bas kyang brtags pa'i tha dad pas zhes 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya bas kyang brtags pa'i tha dad pas zhes 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Also, by similarly, the difference of conceptualization is grasped.

original: ril zhes bya ba ni chos bsdus pa dang chos gzhan yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ril zhes bya ba ni chos bsdus pa dang chos gzhan yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word all includes the dharmas and also expresses other dharmas.

original: 'dzin pa gzhan zhes bya bas ni ji lta ba'i rnam grangs gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzhan zhes bya bas ni ji lta ba'i rnam grangs gsal ba yin no //
translated: By other grasping, the clarification of the synonym is stated.

analyzed: tha dad pa ni zhes bya bas ni dngos su ba'i tha dad gsal ba yin no //
translated: By difference, the actual difference is clarified.

original: gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha dad par mngon par brjod pa ni ma yin la dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pas thos pa de tsam zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tha dad par mngon par brjod pa ni ma yin la dgongs pa can nyid du bstan pas thos pa de tsam zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa nyid ces bya ba ni mngon sum gyis de nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe relation of identity‚Äù means that perception sees that very object.

analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni yul thag ring po la ba lang dang rta'i bye brag la rnam par dpyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalone‚Äù means that there is no analysis of the particularities of cows and horses in a distant place.

original: ba lang dkar po zhes bya bas tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul @281a * //üîΩbstan pa ni /
analyzed: ba lang dkar po zhes bya bas tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyi yul @281a * // bstan pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa white cow‚Äù indicates the object of a different convention.

original: sor mo ldan gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sor mo ldan gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving fingers‚Äù indicates the object of a similar convention.

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshigs su bcad pa'i phyed bshad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhen . . . ‚Äù and so on explains the second half of the verse.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad bstan pa sdud par byed pa yin no //üîΩ'di rnams tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa zhes bstan pa'i dri ba bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad bstan pa sdud par byed pa yin no // 'di rnams tshigs su bcad pa dang pos ni gang gi tshe ba lang gi rnam pa zhes bstan pa'i dri ba bsdus pa yin no //

analyzed: gnyis pas ni de'i tshe ba lang gi'o zhes sngar mthong ba las zhes bya ba bsdus pa yin no //

original: gang gi tshe gal te mthong ba dman pa zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gal te mthong ba dman pa zhes bya ba bstan pa ni /
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúIf the seeing is inferior,‚Äù

analyzed: gal te tshad ma'i 'jug pa la zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: it is included in ‚Äúif there is engagement of valid cognition.‚Äù

analyzed: de'i tshe ni lan du zhes bstan pa ni de'i tshe dngos rig pa de zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: When it is said, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù it is included in ‚Äúin that case, that awareness of the thing.‚Äù
